mcqs.explanation: Explanation There are five pillars of Islam: The first pillar of Islam is ____? Shahadatain The second pillar of Islam is------? Namaz the third fundamental pillar of Islam? Zakat The fourth pillar of Islam is--------? Fasting ( Soam) ** 5th pillar of Islam is? Hajj **** Which pillar of Islam is declared as armor ? Fasting ( Soam) Which pillar of Islam washes sin like water ? Hajj

mcqs.question_en: The first Surah of the Holy Quran is ____?
mcqs.question_ur: قرآن پاک کی پہلی سورت کونسی ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The first Surah of the Quran is Surah Al-Fatiha . Al-Fatiha means Opening . Surah Al-Fatiha is also known as Al-Hamd (The Praise). It has 7 verses, 29 words, and 139 letters. It is also referred to as: As-Salah (The Prayer) Umm al-Kitab (Mother of the Book) Umm al-Quran (Mother of the Quran) Sab'a min al-Mathani (Seven Repeated Ones) Ash-Shifa' (The Cure).

mcqs.question_en: Grand Mosque at Damascus was built by_____?
mcqs.question_ur: دمشق میں عظیم الشان مسجد کو _____ نے بنایا تھا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The Great Mosque of Damascus is also known as the Umayyad Mosque . It was built by the Umayyad Caliph al-Walīd I between 705 and 715 CE. It is located in the old city of Damascus. It is the capital of Syria. It is one of the largest and oldest mosques in the world. The mosque opened in 715 AD.

mcqs.question_en: Ayat ul Kursi is in which Surah of the Holy Quran?
mcqs.question_ur: آیت الکرسی قرآن مجید کی کس سورت میں ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Ayatul Kursi is the 255th verse of the 2nd surah of the Quran , Al-Baqarah . It is located in the third para named "تِلْكَ ٱلْرُّسُلُ." It is also known as Sardar ul Ayat or The Throne Verse. Surah Al-Baqarah is the longest Surah of the Qur'an. It revealed after the Prophet ﷺ migrated to Madinah.

mcqs.question_en: Salat-e-Kasoof is offered at the time of ____?
mcqs.question_ur: نماز کسوف ____ کے وقت پڑھی جاتی ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Salat ul-Kusuf is a prayer of two rakaaht performed during a solar eclipse. Namaz-e-Khasoof (نماز خسوف) is offered during a lunar eclipse. Namaz-e-Kasoof (نماز کسوف) is offered during a solar eclipse.

mcqs.question_en: Which prophet of Allah is dignified with the special title Khalil Ullah (Friend of God)?
mcqs.question_ur: اللہ کے کس نبی کو خلیل اللہ (خدا کا دوست) کے خاص لقب سے نوازا جاتا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Khaleel-Ullah is the title of the Prophet Hazrat Ibrahim (AS) *** Hazrat Ibrahim (A.S) was born in Iraq the second wife of Hazrat Ibrahim (A.S) Hazrat Hijrah. She was the mother of Hazrat Ismail (A.S) Hazrat Ibrahim's (AH) name is mentioned in the Holy Quran 67 times. Hazrat Ibrahim A.S remained on fire for 40 days. *** ND9-11-2022

mcqs.question_en: Where is the headquarters of the Organization of the Islamic Conference (OIC) located?
mcqs.question_ur: اسلامی کانفرنس (او آئی سی) کی تنظیم کا صدر دفتر کہاں واقع ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation OIC headquarters is located in Jeddah. OIC Stands for Organization of Islamic Cooperation It is the largest international organization outside of the United Nations . The official languages of the OIC are Arabic, English, and French. It was founded in 1969 and had 25 members originally. It changed its name on 28 June 2011 from the Organization of the Islamic Conference to its current name. Total Current member = 57 The first summit of OIC was held in Rabat 48th Session of Foreign Ministers of OIC to be held from March 22 to 23, 2022 The 14th OIC meeting was held on May 31, 2019, in Makkah for Palestine.

mcqs.question_en: Who is known as Adam-e-Sani?
mcqs.question_ur: آدم ثانی کے نام سے کون مشہور ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Hazrat Nooh prophet was declared Adam 2ND Because after his storm he followers died and the humanity will restarted as after adam . storm طوفان

mcqs.question_en: At the time of Ghazwa-e-Khandaq there was only one Jewish tribe left in Madina name it?
mcqs.question_ur: غزوا-خندق کے وقت مدینہ میں صرف ایک یہودی قبیلہ باقی تھا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation During Ghazwa-e-Khandaq, Banu Quraizah was the only Jewish tribe remaining in Madina. They broke their treaty with the Muslims during the battle , leading to a significant confrontation afterward.

mcqs.question_en: How many Countries are members of OIC?
mcqs.question_ur: او آئی سی  کے کتنے ممالک ممبر ہیں؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation OIC Stands for Organization of Islamic Cooperation Total Current member = 57 OIC headquarters is located in Jadda. It is the largest international organization outside of the United Nations . The official languages of the OIC are: Arabic, English, French. It was founded in 1969 and had 25 members originally. It changed its name on 28 June 2011 from the Organization of the Islamic Conference to its current name. The first summit of OIC was held in Rabat

mcqs.question_en: Fatimid Caliphate was established in which country?
mcqs.question_ur: فاطمی خلافت کس ملک میں قائم ہوئی؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation In 969, they conquered Egypt , and in 973 they established Cairo as the capital of their caliphate. The Fatimid Caliphate was an Ismaili Shia caliphate of the 10th to the 12th centuries CE.

mcqs.question_en: Surah An-Nur describes the modesty of whom?
mcqs.question_ur: سورہ ان نور نے کس کی شائستگی کو بیان کیا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Surah Al-Noor is found in the 18th Parah (Juz) of the Quran. It has 64 verses . It is divided into 9 Rukus . It focusing on social laws and morality for both men and women .

mcqs.question_en: Where did Prophet Muhammad (PBUH) deliver his last sermon?
mcqs.question_ur: نبی کریم صلی اللہ علیہ وسلم نے اپنا آخری خطبہ کہاں دیا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The Prophet (PBUH) delivered his final sermon during the Hajj on Mount Arafat. It is also known as Farewell Sermon . The Holy Prophet (SAW) performed Hajjat-ul-Wida in the 10th Hijri. It was performed on Friday, the 9th of Dhu al-Hijjah (March 6, 632 A.D). This final pilgrimage included his renowned Farewell Sermon.

mcqs.question_en: Jamila al-Azhar is located in which country?
mcqs.question_ur: جمیلہ الازہر کس ملک میں واقع ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Jamia Al-Azhar is located in Cairo, Egypt . The Mosque of al-Azhar was founded by Jawhar al-Siqilly , the Fatimid conqueror of Egypt, in 970 as the congregational mosque for the new city of al-Qahira. The first khutba was delivered from its minbar in 972 . A university was established there in 988 .

mcqs.question_en: Talha ibn Ubaidullah got the title “The Living Martyr” after which Ghazwa?
mcqs.question_ur: طلحہ ابن اوبید اللہ کو "دی لیونگ شہید" کا عنوان کس غزوہ کے بعد ملا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Talha ibn Ubaidullah (R.A) fought bravely in Ghazwa-e-Uhud . Despite being seriously wounded, he survived, earning the title “ The Living Martyr (Shaheed-e-Hayy) ”.

mcqs.question_en: Ruma was the mother of _____?
mcqs.question_ur: روما _____ کی ماں تھی؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Ruma was the mother of Hazrat Talha (R.A) , a famous companion of Prophet Muhammad ﷺ. Hazrat Talha (R.A) is known for his bravery and generosity in early Islamic history.

mcqs.question_en: What the period of Hazrat Usman (RA) as third caliph of Islam?
mcqs.question_ur: حضرت عثمان رضی اللہ عنہ کا اسلام کے تیسرے خلیفہ کی حیثیت سے دور کتنے سال تھا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Hazrat Usman (R.A) Belonged Quraysh Born Makkah Caliph Third caliph Caliphate 23 to 35 Hijjah Caliphate 644 to 656 CE Titles Zun-Noorain & Jame-al-Quran Martyred 18th Zul-Hijjah 35 A.H Martyrdom day Friday Wives Ruqayyah (RA) & Umm-e-Kulthum (RA) Full Name Usman bin Affaan Death cause Martyred by rebels Know everything about Hazrat Usman (R.A) Hazrat Usman (RA) at the persuasion of Hazrat Abu-Bakr (RA) accepted Islam. Wives of Hazrat Usman (RA) namely Ruqayyah (RA) & Umm-e-Kulthum (RA) were the daughter of the Holy Prophet (PBUH). Hazrat Usman (RA) could not participate in Battle of Badr because his wife Ruqayyah (RA ) was on deathbed. After the death of Ruqayyah (RA) , Hazrat Usman (RA) married with Umm-e-Kulthum (RA). Ruqayyah (RA died on victory day of Battle of Badr. Hazrat Usman (RA) purchased the adjoining land for 25,000 dirham to extend Masjid-e-Nabavi. Hazrat Usman used to enfranchise a slave on every Friday . Muslim Navy was also developed during the period of Hazrat Usman (RA). Zun-Noorain means Possessor of Two Lights Jame-al-Quran means compiler of Quran .

mcqs.question_en: Zam zam means _____?
mcqs.question_ur: زم زم کا مطلب کیا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Zam Zam means " to stop ." The Zamzam Well is located within the Masjid al-Haram in Mecca, Saudi Arabia. It 20 meters (66 feet) east of the Kaaba. Millions of pilgrims visit the well each year during Hajj or Umrah to drink its water.

mcqs.question_en: Where is the grave of Hazrat Ibraheem (علیہ)?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation important question : Namrud ordered throwing Hazrat Ibrahim (A.S) into the fire Nimrod, the king of Babylon , commanded his men to throw Prophet Ibrahim (AS) into a huge pit of burning fire Hazrat Ibrahim A.S remained on fire for 40 days Khalil Ullah is the title of Hazrat Ibrahim (A.S) Hazrat Ibrahim is buried in Jerusalem , Israel. Hazrat Ibrahim (A.S) was born Iraq Hazrat Ibrahim's (AH) name is mentioned in the Holy Quran 69 times. Abraham had two children, 1. Isaac 2. Ismael, ****

mcqs.question_en: First Azan was called out in ______ A.H.
mcqs.question_ur: پہلی مرتبہ آذان کب دی گئی؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Hazrat Bilal called the first Azan of Fajar prayer First Azan was called out in 1 A.H Bilal ibn Rabah is considered to have been the first muezzin , chosen by Hazrat Muhammad himself. The Title of Bilal ibn Rabah : Sayyid al-Muʾaḏḏin Bilal ibn Rabah Born: 580 AD, Mecca , Saudi Arabia Bilal ibn Rabah Died: on March 2, 640 AD, in Damascus, Syria Bilal ibn Rabah's Place of burial: Bab el Saghir Cemetery, Damascus, Syria while Hazrat 'Umar was the first person to suggest the calling of the Azan. ND2023-2-12

mcqs.question_en: اسلامی اقدار کے مطابق عزت کا معیار کیا ہے ؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation اسلام میں عزت کا اصل معیار تقویٰ ہے، اور یہ تمام دی ہوئی خصوصیات (حسنِ اخلاق، خدمتِ خلق، دیانت) کی بنیاد ہے۔ عزت کا اصل پیمانہ اللہ کا خوف اور اس کی اطاعت ہے۔ جب انسان تقویٰ پر قائم ہوتا ہے تو وہ حسنِ اخلاق، خدمتِ خلق، اور دیانت جیسے اعمال انجام دیتا ہے، جو عزت کا باعث بنتے ہیں۔

mcqs.question_en: کس عمل سے قوت برداشت میں اضافہ ہوتا ہے ؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation غصہ پی جانا قوت برداشت میں اضافہ کرتا ہے۔ یہ جذبہ کو کنٹرول کرنے کا سب سے بہترین طریقہ ہے، جو کہ طاقت کا اصل معیار ہے۔ جب کوئی آپ کو غصہ دلائے تو صبر سے کام لینا اور فوری ردعمل نہ دینا ہی اصل برداشت ہے۔ اس کے علاوہ، روزہ بھی قوت برداشت کو بڑھاتا ہے کیونکہ یہ صبر اور اپنی خواہشات کو قابو کرنے کا سبق دیتا ہے ۔

mcqs.question_en: آیت کریم ہے کہ عادل کا دمانّ چھوڑو چاہئے تمہارا
options: بہترین دوست ہی کیوں نہ ہو
اپنا ہمسایہ ہی کیوں نہ ہو
اپنا بھائی ہی کیوں نہ ہو
قریبی رشتہ دار ہی کیوں نہ ہو
mcqs.correct_answer: اپنا بھائی ہی کیوں نہ ہو
mcqs.explanation: Explanation آیت کریم ہے کہ عادل کا دمانّ چھوڑو چاہئے تمہارا اپنا بھائی ہی کیوں نہ ہو مندرجہ ذیل حوالہ قرآن مجید کی سورہ النساء کی آیت نمبر 135 کی جانب اشارہ ہے۔

mcqs.question_en: قرآن پاک میں ارشاد ہے اپنی اولاد کو قتل نہ کرو؟
options: غربت اور افلاس کے ڈر سے
mcqs.correct_answer: غربت اور افلاس کے ڈر سے
mcqs.explanation: Explanation وَلَا تَقۡتُلُوۡۤا اَوۡلَادَكُمۡ خَشۡيَةَ اِمۡلَاقٍ​ؕ نَحۡنُ نَرۡزُقُهُمۡ وَاِيَّاكُمۡ​ؕ اِنَّ قَتۡلَهُمۡ كَانَ خِطۡاً كَبِيۡرًا‏ ٣١ اور اپنی اولاد کو قتل نہ کرو مفلسی کے اندیشے سے ہم ان کو بھی رزق دیں گے اور تمہیں بھی یقیناً ان کو قتل کرنا بہت بڑی خطا ہے

mcqs.question_en: اسلامی معیشت میں ریڑھ کی ہڈی کسے کہتے ہیں؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation زکوٰۃ اسلامی معیشت میں ریڑھ کی ہڈی ہے

mcqs.question_en: اسلام ایک دین ھے کیونکہ یہ
mcqs.explanation: Explanation اسلام کو دین اس لیے کہا جاتا ہے کیونکہ یہ صرف عبادات یا عقائد کا مجموعہ نہیں بلکہ ایک مکمل ضابطہ حیات  ہے ۔ یہ زندگی کے ہر شعبے کے لیے رہنمائی فراہم کرتا ہے — انفرادی، اجتماعی، معاشی، سیاسی اور اخلاقی۔

mcqs.question_en: اسلام کا معاشی انصاف یہ ھے کہ
options: غریبوں کو زیادہ دیا جاتا ہے
mcqs.explanation: Explanation اسلام کا معاشی انصاف اس اصول پر قائم ہے کہ ہر فرد کو اس ک ی محنت، قابلیت، اور ضرورت کے مطابق دیا جائے۔ - اسلام سرمایہ داری کی طرح دولت کا ارتکاز نہیں چاہتا - اور نہ ہی اشتراکیت کی طرح سب کچھ برابر بانٹتا ہے - بلکہ اسلام کا نظام اعتدال پر مبنی ہے، جہاں محنت کا صلہ ملتا ہے اور کم زوروں کا خیال رکھا جاتا ہے (جیسے زکٰوة، صدقات وغیرہ کے ذریعے)

mcqs.question_en: Which is the second largest Religion in the World?
mcqs.question_ur: دنیا کا دوسرا بڑا مذہب کون سا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Islam is the second-largest religion in the World List of World's largest Religions. 1. Christianity (31.2%) 2. Islam (24.1%) 3. No religion (16%) 4. Hinduism (15.1%) 5. Buddhism (6.9%) 6. Folk religions (5.7%) 7. Other religions (0.5%) 8. Sikhism (0.3%) 9. Judaism (0.2%)

mcqs.question_en: Hazrat ______ levied zakat on horses?
mcqs.question_ur: حضرت ______ نے گھوڑوں پر زکوٰۃ لگائی؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Umar ibn al-Khattab was the second caliph of the Rashidun Caliph from 634 to 644 CE. During the earlier period, there was a great dearth of horses. Most of the horses had been killed in early battles. In the time of Hazrat Uthman, things had changed.

mcqs.question_en: From which Word ‘Aqeeda’ is Derived?
mcqs.question_ur: عقیدہ کس لفظ سے ماخوذ ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The word ‘ Aqeeda ’ is derived from the Arabic root ‘Aqd’, which means to tie or bind firmly. عقیدہ عربی لفظ " عَقد " سے نکلا ہے، جس کا مطلب ہے باندھنا یا مضبوطی سے باندھنا ۔ عقیدہ دل میں کسی بات پر پختہ یقین رکھنے کو کہتے ہیں، جیسے اللہ پر ایمان ۔

mcqs.question_en: Hazrat Younis (AS) remained in the abdomen of fish for how many days?
mcqs.question_ur: حضرت یونس علیہ السلام کتنے دن مچھلی کے پیٹ میں رہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Hazrat Younis remained in the abdomen of fish for 40 days. Surah Younis is the 10th chapter (surah) of the Quran with 109 verses (ayat). His named after the prophet Yunus (Jonah). He is mentioned in the holy Quran: 4 times Hazrat Younis (AS) is called Dhun - Nun

mcqs.question_en: The battle of Hunain was fought between ______?
mcqs.question_ur: حنین کی جنگ ______ کے درمیان لڑی گئی؟
options: The Prophet (PBUH) & his companions and Hawazin (Hawazin and Thaqif)
The Prophet(PBUH) & his companions with Banu Quraish
The Prophet (PBUH) & his companions & Banu Taheem
mcqs.correct_answer: The Prophet (PBUH) & his companions and Hawazin (Hawazin and Thaqif)
mcqs.explanation: Explanation On 1st Shawwal, 8th Hijra (630 CE) , a force of 12,000 Muslims approached the valley of Hunain. The Battle of Hunain, fought near al-Ta'if. It was fought between the Prophet Muhammad (PBUH) and his companions against the Hawazin and Thaqif tribes. It took place shortly after the conquest of Makkah . The Battle of Hunain resulted in a Muslim victory over the Bedouin tribes.

mcqs.question_en: Hazrat Muhammad (SAW) went to Syria with Hazrat Abu Talib (RA) at the age of ______?
mcqs.question_ur: حضرت محمد صلی اللہ علیہ وسلم ______ سال کی عمر میں حضرت ابو طالب رضی اللہ عنہ کے ساتھ شام گئے تھے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The Prophet's first business trip was to Syria at age twelve with his uncle Abu Talib (RA). During this journey , he met a monk named Bahira in Basra, Syria. Shab-e-Miraj refers to a separate miraculous night journey of Prophet Muhammad (PBUH).

mcqs.question_en: Atique is the title of _____?
mcqs.question_ur: عتیق کس کا لقب ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Atique is the Title of Hazrat Abu Bakar (RA). .. Abu Bakr  was a sahabi, one of the companions of Muhammad and the first Caliph of Islam . He was also Muhammad's father-in-law through Aisha. His real name was Abdullah or Abul-Kaaba and Abu Bakr was his kunya.

mcqs.question_en: Name of maternal grandmother of Prophet (PBUH) was _____?
mcqs.question_ur: نبی کی ماموں دادی کا نام (صلی اللہ علیہ وآلہ وسلم) _____ تھا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation - Fatima bint Amr was the parental grandmother of Prophet Muhammad (PBUH ) from the father’s side. - She belonged to the Makhzum clan of the Quraysh tribe. The maternal grandmother of Prophet Muhammad (PBUH) was Barrah bint Abd Al-Uzza. She was the mother of Amina bint Wahb (RA), the Prophet’s (PBUH) mother. Family of the Holy Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ): Father : Hazrat Abdullah (R.A) Mother : Hazrat Amina (R.A) Grandfather : Hazrat Abdul Muttalib Grandmother : Fatimah bint Amr Uncle : Hazrat Abu Talib (chief guardian in youth) (Also: Hamza, Abbas, Abu Lahab — other uncles)

mcqs.question_en: What was the name of Hazrat Muhammad parental grandmother?
mcqs.question_ur: حضرت محمد کی دادی کا کیا نام تھا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation - Fatima bint Amr was the parental grandmother of Prophet Muhammad (PBUH ) from the father’s side. - She belonged to the Makhzum clan of the Quraysh tribe. The maternal grandmother of Prophet Muhammad (PBUH) was Barrah bint Abd Al-Uzza . She was the mother of Amina bint Wahb (RA), the Prophet’s (PBUH) mother. Family of the Holy Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ): Father : Hazrat Abdullah (R.A) Mother : Hazrat Amina (R.A) Grandfather : Hazrat Abdul Muttalib Grandmother : Fatimah bint Amr Uncle : Hazrat Abu Talib (chief guardian in youth) (Also: Hamza, Abbas, Abu Lahab — other uncles)

mcqs.question_en: Tariq bin Ziyad conquered Spain the year?
mcqs.question_ur: طارق بن زیاد نے اسپین کو کب فتح کیا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Tariq bin Ziyad landed on the coast of Spain in Rajab, 92 Hijri (711 AD). His conquest marked the beginning of Muslim rule in Andalusia (Spain). In 711 Muslim forces invaded and in seven years conquered the Iberian peninsula. It became one of the great Muslim civilizations ; reaching its summit with the Umayyad caliphate of Cordovain the tenth century. Muslim rule declined after that and ended in 1492 when Granada was conquered.

mcqs.question_en: Khateeb-ul-Anbia is a title of which Prophet?
mcqs.question_ur: خطیب الانبیاء کس نبی کا لقب ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation “Khateeb-ul-Ambia” means a person who delivers the sermon (khuṭbah) during the Friday prayer and Eid prayers Holy Prophet Mohammad (P.B.U.H.) called Hazrat Shoaib “Khateeb-ul-Ambia” “Speaker of Prophets" is also the title of Hazrat Shoaib because he was a very eloquent speaker. His name is mentioned in the Quran 11 times . Hazrat Shoaib AS was a divine prophet from the progeny of Ibrahim (A.S) his mother was a daughter of Hazrat Lut (A.S). Hazrat Shoaib Relatives : Hazrat Musa (son-in-law)‎ Hazrat Shoaib was born in Median .

mcqs.question_en: Hazrat Abu Bakar (R.A) was died in ______?
mcqs.question_ur: حضرت ابوبکر رضی اللہ عنہ کی وفات ____ میں ہوئی؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Hazrat Abu Bakar ( رضہ ) Born: October 27, 573 AD, Mecca, Saudi Arabia Hazrat Abu Bakar ( رضہ ) Died: August 23, 634 AD, Medina, Saudi Arabia

mcqs.question_en: How many times Hazrat Jibrael (AS) is mentioned in the holy Quran?

mcqs.question_en: Hazrat Ruqayyah (RA), the wife of Hazrat Usman (RA) died at victory day of which battle?

mcqs.explanation: Explanation Ruqayyah (RA) died on the victory day of the Battle of Badr ( in Ramadan 17, 2 AH) She was the Second daughter of Hazrat Muhammad ﷺ She married (2nd time) to the third caliph Uthman Hazrat Usman (RA) could not participate in the Battle of Badr because his wife Ruqayyah (RA) was on his deathbed. mcqs.question_en: Which companion of the Prophet (PBUH) was known as the greatest scholar of the Quran?
mcqs.question_ur: نبی صلی اللہ علیہ وسلم کا کون سا ساتھی قرآن مجید کے سب سے بڑے اسکالر کے طور پر جانا جاتا تھا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Abdullah bin Abbas (RA) was renowned as the greatest scholar and interpreter of the Qur’an among the companions. The Prophet (PBUH) prayed for him saying, “ O Allah, teach him the interpretation of the Qur’an .”

mcqs.question_en: How many Doors of hell are there?

The gatekeeper of heaven is Rizwan. **** Name of 7 doors of hell: Jahannam was reserved for Muslims who had committed grave sins. al-Laza (the blaze) for the Jews. al-Hutama (the consuming fire) for the Christians. al-Sa'ir for the Sabians. al-Saqar (the scorching fire) for the Zoroastrians. al-jahim (the hot place) for the idolaters. al-Hawiya (the abyss) for the hypocrites.

mcqs.question_en: How Hazrat Salman Farsi (RA) was freed as a slave?

mcqs.question_en: Who was the first ambassador of Islam?
mcqs.question_ur: اسلام کا پہلا سفیر کون تھا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Mus’ab ibn Umayr was appointed the first ambassador of Islam and was sent to Yathrib ( Medina ) to prepare the city for the forthcoming Hijra after the first pledge with the Ansar. A man of Medina named Asad ibn Zurarah assisted him.

mcqs.question_en: Where is Hajr-e-Aswad situated?
mcqs.question_ur: حجر اسود کہاں واقع ہے؟
options: Northern Corner of Kaaba Corner of Kaaba
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Hajr-e-Aswad , or the Black Stone, is located in the eastern corner of the Kaaba in the Grand Mosque in Mecca, Saudi Arabia. The Black Stone is a revered Islamic relic believed to have been set into the Kaaba by the Prophet Muhammad (SAW) in 605 CE, five years before his first revelation.

mcqs.question_en: Prophet (PBUH) married to Hazrat Juwayriah Bint Harith (RA) after which battle?

mcqs.explanation: Explanation The Prophet (PBUH) married Hazrat Juwayriah bint al-Harith (RA) after the Battle of Banu Mustaliq . Her marriage led to the freedom of many captives , strengthening ties between Muslims and her tribe.

mcqs.question_en: Verse 22 of Surah Mujadillah was revealed due to the following incident?
mcqs.question_ur: مندرجہ ذیل واقعے کی وجہ سے سورہ مجد اللہ کی آیت 22 کا انکشاف ہوا ہے؟
options: When Muslims after initial setback recovered and won the Battle of Hunain
Hazrat Abu Ubeydah (RA) killed his father in the Battle of Badr
When Muslims were temporarily got a surprise from Quraysh in the Battle of Uhud

mcqs.explanation: Explanation Verse 22 of Surah Al-Mujadilah praises believers who stand firm in faith even against their own relatives. It was revealed after Hazrat Abu Ubaydah (RA) killed his idolater father during the Battle of Badr for the sake of Islam.

mcqs.question_en: The literal meaning of Jihad?

mcqs.question_en: In which Nabvi year the Social Boycott of Banu Hashim was started?

mcqs.explanation: Explanation Boycott Of Banu Hashim (617 AD – 619 AD) Boycott was against the clan of Banu Hashim , declared in the 7 th year of the Prophethood Boycott was continued for 3 years boycott declared by the leaders of Banu Makhzum and Banu Abd-Shams , two important clans of Quraysh. the boycott was carried out to put pressure on Banu Hashim to withdraw its protection from Muhammad. mcqs.question_en: Hazrat Khalid Bin Waleed (RA) embraced Islam in which Hijri?

mcqs.question_en: Which is the longest (largest) surah in the Holy Quran?
mcqs.question_ur: قرآن پاک کی سب سے لمبی سورت کون سی ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Al-Baqarah (The Cow or The Heifer) is the second and longest chapter of the Quran , with 286 verses. It derives its name from the story of the cow (vv. 67-73). Verse 282, the longest verse, is known as 'āyatu d-dayn. It consists of 25,500 letters and is positioned in Juzʼ 1–3. The chapter has 40 Rukus and is classified as Medinan. Hazrat Ibrahim (علیہ السلام) is mentioned 13 times. The verse 183 describes the obligation of fasting (soam). Surah Aal-e-Imran is the second longest surah of Holy Quran . Surah Al-Kausar is the shortest surah of Holy Quran.

mcqs.question_en: Name the Angle who is appointed at Heaven?

mcqs.explanation: Explanation Angel Rizwan is appointed as the gatekeeper of Heaven (Jannah). He welcomes the righteous believers into Paradise . Angel Malik is the chief gatekeeper of Hell (Jahannam). He oversees the punishments of the inhabitants of Hell .

mcqs.question_en: In which night Quran was revealed?
mcqs.question_ur: قرآن مجید کس رات میں نازل ہوا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Lailat al Qadr , the Night of Power, marks the night in which the Qur'an was first revealed to the Prophet Muhammad S.A.W by Allah. Shab-e-Qadar is the most important night in the month of Ramzan. Laylat al-Qadr is found to be on the last 5 odd nights of Ramadan (21st, 23rd, 25th, 27th, or 29th) whereby night precedes day. Many traditions insist particularly on the night before the 27th of Ramadan. *** Also called: The night of Power, Night of Value, Night of Destiny, Night of Determination, Night Of Decree, or Precious Night **** ND02-12-2022

mcqs.question_en: Ghazwa-e-Badr occurred in which hijrah?
mcqs.question_ur: غزوہ بدر کس ہجری میں ہوا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation " Badr " means " full moon " in Arabic. The Battle of Badr , also called Furqan . The Battle of Badr is also known as The Day of the Criterion. Day of the Criterion means کسوٹی کا دن It took place on Tuesday, 13 March 624 CE (17 Ramadan, 2 AH ) near the city of Badr . Prophet Muhammad SAW , commanding his Sahaba, defeated the Quraysh army led by Abu Jahl (Amr ibn Hishām). The Kufar forces numbered 1,000 . It was the first battle of Islam , with 313-317 Muslims. The Muslim forces included 82-85 Muhajirun and 231 Ansar ( 61 from Aws and 170 from Khazraj ). They had 2 horses and 70 camels. Fourteen Muslims were martyred , while 70 Kufar were killed and 70 captured. Surah Al-Anfal mentions that Allah promised to reinforce the Muslims with 1,000 angels.

mcqs.question_en: When did Shab-e-Miraj occur?
mcqs.question_ur: شبِ معراج کب ہوئی؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The Miraj event took place on the 27th of Rajab in the 10th (621 A.D) year of Prophethood. Prophet Muhammad (SAW) was staying at the house of Umm Hani on the night of Miraj. That night, Angel Jibreel came to the Prophet (SAW) and took him on the journey of Israa and Miraj. During Miraj, Hazrat Adam and Hazrat Muhammad (SAW) met at the first heaven. The event is mentioned in Surah Bani Israel. It is also known as 'Isra and Mi'raj' or 'Shab-e-Meraj'. Isra : Night journey from Makkah to Masjid Al-Aqsa. Mi’raj : Journey from Masjid Al-Aqsa to the heavens. Gifts of the 27th of Rajab : The five prescribed daily prayers. The last part of the chapter of Al-Baqara (Amanar-Rasulu).

mcqs.question_en: In which Ghazwa did Hazrat Khalid bin Walid receive the title Saifullah?
mcqs.question_ur: حضرت خالد بن ولید کو کس غزوہ میں سیف اللہ  کا خطاب ملا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation حضرت خالد بن ولیدؓ مسلمانوں کے درمیان ایک سرکاری فوجی کمانڈر کے طور پر شامل کیا اور حضرت محمد مصطفیٰ صلی اللہ علیہ وسلم نے خالد بن ولید کو سیف اللہ (اللہ کی تلوار) کا خطاب دیا آٹھ ہجری میں حضرت خالد بن ولیدؓ مسلمان ہونے He was a Muslim commander in the service of the: Prophet Muhammad Caliph Abu Bakr Umar He was born in  592 AD, in Mecca He Died : in 642 AD, in Homs‎, Syria They were Buried in Khaled Ibn Walid Mosque, in Syria

mcqs.question_en: According to Hadith, at what age does Salah (Namaz) become obligatory to teach a child?
mcqs.question_ur: حدیث کے مطابق ، صلاح (نماز) کس عمر میں کسی بچے کو پڑھانا لازمی بن جاتی ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation As per Hadith , parents are instructed to teach children Namaz at the age of 7 . At 10 years , discipline can be applied if they neglect it.

mcqs.question_en: Which of the following Prophets was known As Abu-ul-Arab (Father of the Arabs)?
mcqs.question_ur: مندرجہ ذیل میں سے کون سا نبی ابو ال عرب (عربوں کے والد) کے نام سے جانا جاتا تھا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Hazrat Ismael (AS) is called Abu-ul-Arab ( Father of the Arabs ) because Arab tribes trace their lineage through him. He settled in Makkah and married into the Jurhum tribe , giving rise to Arab ancestry.

mcqs.question_en: Hazrat Amina (RA) mother of Hazrat Muhammad (SAW) belonged to which tribe?
mcqs.question_ur: حضرت محمد صلی اللہ علیہ وسلم کی والدہ حضرت آمنہ رضی اللہ عنہا کا تعلق کس قبیلے سے تھا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Hazrat Amina was the mother of Hazrat Muhammad PBUH. She was died when the age of Holy Prophet is 6 years.

mcqs.question_en: Malika Saba (Queen of Sheba) was associated with the era of which Prophet?
mcqs.question_ur: ملکہ صبا (شیبہ کی ملکہ) کس نبی کے عہد سے وابستہ تھی؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Malika Saba (Queen Bilqis) ruled Sheba and is mentioned in the Quran . She accepted Islam after witnessing the wisdom and miracles of Hazrat Suleman (AS).

mcqs.question_en: Which treaty did the Holy Prophet (PBUH) attend before the announcement of Prophethood?
mcqs.question_ur: نبی صہ ہونے کے اعلان سے قبل حضور نبی صلی اللہ علیہ وآلہ وسلم نے کس معاہدے میں شرکت کی؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The Half-e-Fazool was a pact in Makkah to uphold justice and protect the oppressed. The Holy Prophet (PBUH) participated in it even before Prophethood .

mcqs.question_en: The Police Department/System was first established by ______?
mcqs.question_ur: محکمہ پولیس/سسٹم سب سے پہلے ______ کے ذریعہ قائم کیا گیا تھا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Umar was the second muslim Caliph and reigned during 634 to 644 CE . THE REFORMS OF UMAR'S ERA. Umar undertook many administrative reforms and closely oversaw public policy, establishing an advanced administration for newly conquered lands, including several new ministries and bureaucracies, as well as ordering a census of all the Muslim territories . During his reign, the garrison cities of Basrah and al-Kūfah were founded or expanded. In 638, he extended and renovated the Grand Mosque in Mecca and the Mosque of the Prophet in Medina. He also began the process of codifying Islamic law. **********

mcqs.question_en: Who holds the key to Kabba?
mcqs.question_ur: فتح مکہ کے بعد کلید کعبہ کس صحابی کے حوالے کی گئی؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Hazrat Usman bin Talha (R.A) always kept Ka'aba's key. **** He is considered and called as “ Sadin of Mecca “, He became a Muslim in the 8th year of the Migration, before the Conquest of Makkah. He was a companion of the Islamic prophet Muhammad. His father was Talhah ibn Abi Talhah al-Abdali *** Saleh Bin Taha Al-Shaibi is the key holder of Kaaba 2022. ***

mcqs.question_en: Wealth given in the way of Allah is wasted by ______?
mcqs.question_ur: اللہ کی راہ میں دی گئی دولت ______ کے ذریعہ ضائع ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation In the Quran , it is said that charity in Allah’s way should not be spoiled by reminders of favors or hurtful words . Such behavior nullifies the reward of good deeds and giving .

mcqs.question_en: The slow and clear recitation of the Quran is called ______?
mcqs.question_ur: قرآن کی آہستہ اور واضح تلاوت کو ______ کہا جاتا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Tartil means reciting the Quran slowly, clearly, and with proper pauses. It ensures correct pronunciation and reflection on the meanings of verses .

mcqs.question_en: A person who recites Kalma of Islam Verbally Not Heartilly is called?
mcqs.question_ur: جو شخص اسلام کا کلمہ زبانی نہیں دل سے پڑھتا ہے کیا اسے کہتے ہیں؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation A person who reads the Kalima of Islam verbally and calls himself Muslim but disbelieves it heartily is called a “ Hypocrite ” (Munafiq). Munafiq is a person who in public and in the community shows that he is a Muslim but rejects Islam In Islam, the munafiq or false Muslims or false believers. The hypocrisy itself is called nifāq (نفاق).

mcqs.question_en: What is the meaning of Wahi?
mcqs.question_ur: وحی کا کیا مطلب ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The literal meaning of "Wahi" is: Allah's Message or Revelation Two kinds of Wahi are there: 1. Wahee-e-Matlu : It means the revelation which God has transmitted in His own words and speech 2. Wahee-e-Ghair Matlu : It is the revelation that Allah projected in the heart of the Holy Prophet.

mcqs.question_en: The Compilation of Ahadith is called _____?
mcqs.question_ur: احادیث کی تالیف کو _____ کہتے ہیں؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Imam Malik was the first to undertake the comprehensive and systematic compilation of Hadith. His work is known as Al- Muwatta '. In this regard, it is very important to note that there are two kinds of compilations: musnad and musannaf.

mcqs.question_en: Which Prophet has been mentioned the most in Holy Quran?
mcqs.question_ur: قرآن پاک میں سب سے زیادہ کس نبی کا ذکر آیا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Prophet Musa (AS) is mentioned the most in the Quran. The name of Musa is mentioned 136 times in the Quran.

mcqs.question_en: What is the punishment of Had-e-Qazaf (false Accusation)?
mcqs.question_ur: حدِ قزاف کی سزا کیا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Qazaf is Clause in Islam Qazf in Islam is imposed on: False accusations of Zina Had–e–Qazaf (false Accusation) is: 8 0 Lashes Lashes mean: کوڑے First Muslim who faced the first-ever ordinance of Qazf : Hasan ibn Sabit, Mustah ibn Asasa, Hamnah ibn Jahsh

mcqs.question_en: If a person cannot offer sacrifice (Qurbani) during Hajj, what should he/she do?
mcqs.question_ur: اگر کوئی شخص حج کے دوران قربانی (قربانی) پیش نہیں کرسکتا ہے تو اسے کیا کرنا چاہئے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation If one cannot afford to offer Qurbani during Hajj , the Shariah allows fasting 10 days (3 during Hajj, 7 after returning home). This is mentioned in the Qur’an ( Surah Al-Baqarah 2:196 ).

mcqs.question_en: How many Surah are with the name of Prophets?
mcqs.question_ur: انبیاء کے نام پر کتنی سورتیں ہیں؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The Holy Quran has 25 Prophets names mentioned and there are 6 Surahs titled with their names. Surah Ibrahim Surah Yusuf Surah Mohammed Surah Nuh Surah Hood Surah Younus (Jonah). Surah Al-A’la ends with which two prophets' names? Hazrat Ibrahim & Musa ND7-5-2023

mcqs.question_en: Makkah was also known as _____?
mcqs.question_ur: مکہ کو _____ کے نام سے بھی جانا جاتا تھا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Makkah was conquered on 8th Hijri. Battle of Motah fought also 8th Hijri.

mcqs.question_en: When a Hadith is narrated by different persons but one narrator is of higher rank, it is called _____?
mcqs.question_ur: جب ایک حدیث کو مختلف افراد کے ذریعہ بیان کیا جاتا ہے لیکن ایک راوی اعلی درجہ کا ہوتا ہے تو اسے _____ کہا جاتا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Mashhoor Hadith is one that is narrated by more than two companions, and among them, one may be of a higher rank. It becomes well-known (mashhoor) due to its wide transmission across chains of narrators.

mcqs.question_en: According to Hazrat Ali (R.A.), a true judge is one who _____?
mcqs.question_ur: حضرت علی رضہ کے مطابق ، ایک سچا جج وہ ہے جو _____؟
options: Bases judgment on Nisar (justice without bias) and Surayah (insight/truth)
mcqs.correct_answer: Bases judgment on Nisar (justice without bias) and Surayah (insight/truth)
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Hazrat Ali (RA) described a true judge as one who gives decisions with impartial justice (Nisar) and true insight (Surayah). He warned against judging for fame or based only on personal opinion .

mcqs.question_en: During the Battle of the Trench (Ghazwa Khandaq), who was appointed as the supervisor (in charge) of Medina in the Prophet’s absence?
mcqs.question_ur: خندق کی لڑائی کے دوران (غزوا خندق) ، جو نبی کی عدم موجودگی میں مدینہ کا سپروائزر (انچارج) کے طور پر مقرر ہوا تھا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The Holy Prophet (PBUH) was the overall commander and leader of the Muslim army during the Battle of Khandaq (Trench). The strategy for digging the trench was suggested by Salman al-Farsi . While the Prophet (PBUH) led the Muslim forces, he did appoint Ibn Umm Maktūm as his representative in Medina to manage affairs within the city while the army was stationed outside.

mcqs.question_en: Which prophet is referred to as Peer-e-Kanaan?
mcqs.question_ur: "پیر کنعان" کس نبی کو کہا جاتا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation پیر کنعان ایک لقب ہے جو حضرت یعقوب علیہ السلام کے لیے استعمال کیا جاتا ہے ۔ حضرت یعقوب علیہ السلام حضرت اسحاق علیہ السلام کے بیٹے اور حضرت ابراہیم علیہ السلام کے پوتے تھے۔ آپ کا تعلق کنعان (موجودہ فلسطین اور اردگرد کے علاقے) سے تھا۔ اسی نسبت سے آپ کو پیر کنعان کہا جاتا ہے۔ پیر کے معنی ہیں بزرگ یا رہنما، اور "کنعان" وہ خطہ ہے جہاں حضرت یعقوب علیہ السلام اور ان کی اولاد آباد تھی۔ اردو شاعری اور اسلامی ادب میں "پیر کنعان" کا ذکر حضرت یعقوب علیہ السلام کے لیے عزت و احترام کے ساتھ کیا جاتا ہے ،

mcqs.question_en: In which mosque was the order of keeping the Qibla (direction of prayer) changed from Jerusalem to Kaaba in Makkah?
mcqs.question_ur: مکہ مکرمہ میں یروشلم سے کعبہ کی طرف قبلہ (نماز کی سمت) کو تبدیل کرنے کا حکم کس مسجد میں دیا گیا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The Banu Salma Mosque , also known as Masjid al-Qiblatayn , is located in Medina It is the mosque where the Prophet Muhammad (PBUH) received the revelation to change the direction of prayer from Jerusalem to the Kaaba in Mecca. The change occurred in 624 CE after the revelation of Surah 2, verses 144 and 145 of the Quran

mcqs.question_en: Mother of Hazrat Isa A.S. (Jesus)?
mcqs.question_ur: حضرت عیسیٰ علیہ السلام کی والدہ کا کیا نام تھا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Quran 66:12 states that: Jesus was born when the spirit of God breathed upon Mary, whose body was chaste. The Quran's narrative of the virgin birth is somewhat different from that in the New Testament.

mcqs.question_en: What is the title of Hazrat Ali (RA)?
mcqs.question_ur: حضرت علی رضی اللہ عنہ کا لقب کیا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Haider is one of the titles of Hazrat Ali (RA). It means "Lion" and reflects his bravery and valor in various battles.

mcqs.question_en: Who was the first Caliph of Islam?
mcqs.question_ur: اسلام کا پہلا خلیفہ کون تھا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation First Caliph : Hazrat Abu Bakr (June 8, 632 – August 23, 634) Second Caliph: Hazrat Umar (R.A.) Third Caliph : Hazrat Usman (R.A.) Fourth Caliph: Hazrat Ali (R.A.) (656–661 CE) Sahabi who proposed Hazrat Abu Bakr for the Caliphate : Hazrat Umar (R.A.)

mcqs.question_en: In the belly of which animal did Prophet Yunus (A.S.) remain?
mcqs.question_ur: حضرت یونس علیہ السلام کس جانور کے پیٹ میں رہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Hazrat Younis remained in the abdomen of fish for 40 days. Surah Younis is the 10th chapter (surah) of the Quran with 109 verses (ayat). His named after the prophet Yunus (Jonah). He is mentioned in the holy Quran: 4 times Hazrat Younis (AS) is called Dhun - Nun

mcqs.question_en: How many Takbeer are offered in Eid Prayer?
mcqs.question_ur: عید کی نماز میں کتنی تکبیریں پڑھی جاتی ہیں؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Eid literally means a “festival” or “feast” in Arabic. Doing ghusl on Eid is mustahabb . It was narrated that the Prophet ﷺ did ghusl on the day of Eid. Eid Prayer is Wajib Eid Salat consists of two ' Rakats ' and six 'Takbirs'. There are two Eid prayers in a year, Eid-ul-fitr and Eid-ul-adha. first Eid Prayer offered by the Holy prophet in 2 nd A.H

mcqs.question_en: Which is the first month of Islamic Calendar?
mcqs.question_ur: اسلامی کیلنڈر کا پہلا مہینہ کون سا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Rajab is the seventh month of the 12 lunar months in the Islamic calendar. Safar is the second month of the 12 lunar months in the Islamic calendar. Jumada al-Awwal  is the fifth month of the 12 lunar months in the Islamic calendar. ** The names of the months in the Islamic calendar are: 1.Muharram 2.Safar 3.Rabi' al-awwal 4.Rabi' al-thani 5.Jumada al-awwal 6.Jumada al-thani 7.Rajab 8.Sha'aban 9.Ramadan 10.Shawwal 11.Dhu al-Qi'dah 12.Dhu al-Hijjah.

mcqs.question_en: In which Islamic month Hajj is performed?
mcqs.question_ur: حج کس اسلامی مہینے میں کیا جاتا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Hajj is performed in the Islamic month of Zilhajj . It specifically from the 8th to the 12th of this month. Hajj was made Farz in the 9th Hijri year.

mcqs.question_en: Who was the commander of Muslims in the battle of Muta?
mcqs.question_ur: مؤتہ کی لڑائی میں مسلمانوں کا کمانڈر کون تھا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The army was led by Zayd ibn Harithah The second-in-command was J afar ibn Abi Talib And the third-in-command was Abd Allah ibn Rawahah.

mcqs.question_en: کون سے صحابی	غزوہ تبوک کے سوا باقی تمام غزوات میں نبی کریم صَلَّی اللہُ تَعَالٰی عَلَیْہِ وَاٰلِہٖ وَسَلَّم کے ساتھ رہے؟
options: حضرت عمر رَضِیَ اللہُ تَعَالٰی عَنْہُ
حضرت علی رَضِیَ اللہُ تَعَالٰی عَنْہُ
حضرت ابوبکر رَضِیَ اللہُ تَعَالٰی عَنْہُ
حضرت عثمان رَضِیَ اللہُ تَعَالٰی عَنْہُ
mcqs.correct_answer: حضرت علی رَضِیَ اللہُ تَعَالٰی عَنْہُ
mcqs.explanation: Explanation غزوہ تبوک ، رسول خداؐ کے غزوات میں سے آخری غزوہ ہے۔ حضرت علی رَضِیَ اللہُ تَعَالٰی عَنْہُ غزوہ تبوک کے سوا باقی تمام غزوات میں نبی کریم صَلَّی اللہُ تَعَالٰی عَلَیْہِ وَاٰلِہٖ وَسَلَّم کے ساتھ شریک رہے۔ غزوہ تبوک میں انہیں مدینہ کی دیکھ بھال کے لیے چھوڑا گیا تھا۔

mcqs.question_en: In which Hijri Ghazwa-e-Khyber was fought?
mcqs.question_ur: غزوہ خیبر کس ہجری میں لڑا گیا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Ghazwa-e-Khyber was fought in 7 Hijri (628 AD). It was a battle between Muslims and the Jews of Khaybar. The battle began and ended in 629 AD. Location : Khaybar, Saudi Arabia. Result: Muslim victory . 15 Muslims were martyred , and 93 Jews were killed in the battle.

mcqs.question_en: When Hazrat Ali (AS) shifted capital from Madina to Kufa?
mcqs.question_ur: حضرت علی (ع) نے کب دارالحکومت مدینہ سے کوفہ منتقل کیا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The Battle of the Camel , also known as the Battle of Jamel or the Battle of Basra . The Battle of the Camel took place at Basra , Iraq on 7 November 656 (13 Jumada Al-Awwal 36 AH) . Hazrat Ali shifted capital from Madina to Kufa after battle of camel in 657 AD .

mcqs.question_en: Who collected verses of Quran?
mcqs.question_ur: قرآن مجید کی آیات کس نے جمع کیں؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Hazrat Usman colleted the verses of Quran. Hazrat Usman (R.A), the t hird caliph of Islam was martyred at the age of 8 2 Hazrat Usman was the first Hafiz of the Holy Qura n. people who have completely memorized the Quran is called Hafiz Quran. ............... Hazrat Ali (R.A), the fourth caliph of Islam was martyred at the age of 60.

mcqs.question_en: In how many provinces, Hazrat Umar (RA) divided the Muslim Empire for administrative purposes?
mcqs.question_ur: حضرت عمر رضی اللہ عنہ نے مسلم سلطنت کو انتظامی مقاصد کے لیے کتنے صوبوں میں تقسیم کیا
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Hazrat Umar (RA) divided the Muslim Empire into 10 provinces for administrative purposes. The 10 provinces were: Arabia Basra (Iraq) Kufa (Iraq) Syria Jordan (part of the Syrian province) Palestine (part of the Syrian province) Egypt Persia (modern-day Iran) Khorasan (modern-day Afghanistan and parts of Iran) Armenia (which included parts of modern-day Turkey and Caucasus region)

mcqs.question_en: In the Islamic era, the Postal System was established by ________?
mcqs.question_ur: اسلامی دور میں ڈاک کا نظام کس نے متعارف کروایا تھا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Ameer Muawiyah (R.A) established Postal System Purposes: speed up the arrival of intelligence from his outlying provinces. *** About Ameer Muawiyah (R.A) Mu'awiya I was the founder and first caliph of the Umayyad Caliphate serving from 661 until his death. He became caliph less than thirty years after the death of the Islamic prophet Muhammadﷺ Muawiyah was appointed as the Governor of Syria after his brother Yazid ibn Abu Sufyan died

mcqs.question_en: Ghazwa-e-Tabook was fought in the which year?
mcqs.question_ur: غزوہ تبوک کس سال لڑی گئی؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The Battle of Tabuk is known as the last Gazwa of Holy Prophet Ghazwa Tabook is fought against : Romans Ghazwa e Tabook was fought in the year : 9 Hijri initiated by Muhammad in October 630 AD. It took place During Rajab and Sha'ban in the region of Tabuk 20 days Hazrat Muhammad PBUH stayed during Tabook Battle *** ND29-1-2023

mcqs.question_en: Ghazwa Ahzab is also called _____?
mcqs.question_ur: غزوہ احزاب کو کیا کہا جاتا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The Battle of Khandaq is also known as Battle of the Trench and the Battle of the Confederates . It was a 27-day-long defense by Muslims of Yasrab (now Medina). The Battle of the Trench took place in Shawwal – Dhu al-Qi'dah, 5 A.H (627 C.E).

mcqs.question_en: Who was the commander/leader of the muslim in the Battle of Uhud?
mcqs.question_ur: غزوہ احد میں مسلمانوں کا سردار کون تھا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The Battle of Uhud, was fought on Saturday , 23 March 625 AD (7 Shawwal, 3 AH), in the valley north of Mount Uhud . The Qurayshi Meccans, led by Abu Sufyan ibn Harb, commanded an army of 3,000 men toward Muhammad's stronghold in Medina.

mcqs.question_en: Hazrat Ali (R.A) was martyred in the city of ________?
mcqs.question_ur: حضرت علی (آر اے) ________ میں عید کی شہادت کی گئی تھی؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation He was the fourth caliph of Islam. He was the first among the youth who accepted Islam just at the age of 10. ************** Hazrat Ali (R.A) was attacked with a poisoned sword On 19th Ramazan 40th Hijri, before the time of FAJAR prayers to the mosque of Kufa. He died on the 21st Ramadan 40 A.H. and buried in Najaf al-Ashraf (Iraq).

mcqs.question_en: Who was the first poet of Islam?
mcqs.question_ur: اسلام کا پہلا شاعر کون تھا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The first poet of Islam was Hassan Bin Sabit . An Arabian poet and companion of the Prophet Muhammad SAW. He was renowned for his poetry defending and promoting Islam . He was Born in 563 AD. He was died in 674 AD , aged 110 or 111.

mcqs.question_en: When was Baitul Muqaddas conquered during Rashidun Caliphate?
mcqs.question_ur: بیت المقدس کب فتح ہوا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Umar ibn Abd al-Aziz, commonly known as Umar II, was the eighth Umayyad caliph. Umar ibn Abd al-Aziz called the first Mujaddid . He was sixth righteous caliph of Islam after Hasan Ibn Ali . Umar ibn Abd al-Aziz was born on 2 November 682 in Medina, Umayyad Caliphate. Died on 5 February 720 (aged 37) Hazrat Umar conquered Bait Ul Maqdas in 15 A.H.

mcqs.question_en: How many year did the Caliphate of Hazrat Abu Bakr (AR) last?
mcqs.question_ur: حضرت ابوبکر رضی اللہ عنہ کی خلافت کتنے سال رہی؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The Caliphate of Hazrat Abu Bakr lasted 2 years, 2 months, and 14 days: Reign: Abu Bakr ruled from June 8, 632 to Augus t 634 Death: Abu Bakr died of illness in August 634 Abu Bakr was the first caliph of Islam

mcqs.question_en: Battle of Khandaq was fought in _________?

Sawda bint Zam'a : She became his wife after the death of Khadijah. Aisha bint Abi Bakr : She was married to the Prophet when she was young and remained a significant figure in Islamic history. Zaynab bint Khuzayma : She was known for her piety and passed away during the lifetime of the Prophet. Umm Salama Hind bint Abi Umayya : She was a widow and married the Prophet after her first husband passed away. Zaynab bint Jahsh : She was initially married to Zaid ibn Haritha, who was adopted by the Prophet and later divorced him. Juwayriyya bint al-Harith : She was from a tribe that was captured during a military expedition and later married the Prophet. Umm Habiba Ramla bint Abi Sufyan : She was initially married to someone from the Meccan elite but later married the Prophet after migrating to Medina. Safiyya bint Huyayy : She was initially married to a Jewish man and later married the Prophet after the conquest of Khaybar. Maymunah bint al-Harith : She married the Prophet during a pilgrimage to Mecca. Maria al-Qibtiyya : She was a Coptic Christian slave gifted to the Prophet by the ruler of Egypt and became his concubine. Rayhana bint Zayd : She was from the Banu Nadir tribe and became a concubine of the Prophet after the Banu Nadir were expelled from Medina.

Day of the Criterion means کسوٹی کا دن It took place on Tuesday, 13 March 624 CE (17 Ramadan, 2 AH ) near the city of Badr . Prophet Muhammad SAW , commanding his Sahaba, defeated the Quraysh army led by Abu Jahl (Amr ibn Hishām). The Kufar forces numbered 1,000 . It was the first battle of Islam , with 313-317 Muslims. The Muslim forces included 82-85 Muhajirun and 231 Ansar ( 61 from Aws and 170 from Khazraj ). They had 2 horses and 70 camels. Fourteen Muslims were killed , while 70 Kufar were killed and 70 captured. Surah Al-Anfal mentions that Allah promised to reinforce the Muslims with 1,000 angels.

mcqs.question_en: In Hajj, touching the Black Stone, is known as ____?

mcqs.explanation: Explanation Istilam is the act of kissing Hajar al-Aswad or gesturing towards it at the beginning and at the end of each circuit of the Kaaba during the rite of Tawaf . In Hajj, touching the Black Stone is called Istilam. Istilam is an established sunna action of the Tawaf *****

mcqs.question_en: Which is the Arabic word known as Nimaz?
mcqs.question_ur: عربی زبان کا کون سا لفظ ہے جسے نماز کہتے ہیں؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation In Arabic, " Salat " (صلاة) is the term for the five daily prayers in Islam. It is also known as " Nimaz " in Urdu and other languages.

mcqs.question_en: When conquest of Makkah took place?
mcqs.question_ur: فتح مکہ کب ہوا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The conquest of Mecca by Muslims led by the Islamic prophet Muhammad in December 629 or January 630 AD (Julian), 20 Ramadan, 8 AH . The Messenger of Allah (S.A.W.) entered Makkah on his favorite camel Al-Kaswa having Usama Ibn Zaid (R.A. ) sitting behind him. mcqs.question_en: Prophet Muhammad (PBUH) migrated from Makkah to Madina in the which year?

mcqs.explanation: Explanation Prophet Muhammad (PBUH) migrated from Makkah to Madina in the year 622 CE (13th Year of the Prophethood). This event, known as the Hijra. This marks the beginning of the Islamic calendar.

mcqs.question_en: What is the meaning of word Quran?
mcqs.question_ur: لفظ قرآن کا کیا مطلب ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The word " Quran " is derived from the Arabic root "q-r-a," which means " to read " or " to recite ." It signifies the recitation of the divine message revealed to Prophet Muhammad (PBUH).

mcqs.question_en: Zakat purifies the individual as well as ______?
mcqs.question_ur: زکوٰۃ نے فرد کے ساتھ ساتھ ______ کو بھی پاک کیا؟

mcqs.question_en: Hazrat Musa (AS) was granted ______ miracles.

mcqs.question_en: The book “Kitab al Amwal” (The book of Revenue) was written by _____ ?

mcqs.explanation: Explanation Kitab al-Amwal is the work of a brilliant legal mind. mcqs.question_en: Siha-e-Sitta are ______ books of Hadith?

mcqs.question_en: What was the old name of Madina?

mcqs.question_en: What companion of Prophet (PBUH) was awarded with the title of “The Lion of Allah (Sher-e-Khuda)"?

mcqs.explanation: Explanation Prophet Muhammad PBUH have at the age of 40 . He and his wife had six children — two boy s (who did not live into adulthood) and four girls . By the time he was 40 , he began having religious visions that would change his life. This is Prophet Muhammad's mosque in Medina. At the age of 40 in 11 BH (610 CE) , Muhammad is said to have received his first verbal revelation in the cave called Hira , which was the beginning of the descent of the Quran that continued up to the end of his life.

mcqs.question_en: How many instances of Madd (elongation marks) are there in the Holy Quran?
mcqs.question_ur: قرآن پاک میں مد کی کتنی مثالیں ہیں؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation There are 1,771 Madd (elongation signs) in the Holy Quran, It is used to indicate where reciters should stretch the pronunciation of certain letters. The two main types of madd are: Madd Asli/Tabiy (Natural Madd)  المد الأصلي Madd Far’ee (Secondary Madd) المد الفرعي

mcqs.question_en: How many dots are in Holy Quran?
mcqs.question_ur: پورے قرآن پاک میں کتنے نقطے ہیں؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The Holy Quran is said to contain 1,015,030 dots.

mcqs.question_en: The cave Hira, where Prophet Muhammad (SAW) received his first revelation is in the _____?
mcqs.question_ur: غار حرا ، جہاں حضرت محمد (ص) کو پہلی وحی نازل ہوئی وہ _____ میں ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Cave (Ghar-e-Hira) is located on Jabal Al-Noor mountain. Jabal Al-Noor also Called the “Mountain of Light” or “Hill of Illumination”. It takes around 45 minutes to reach the top. Muhammad first received revelation in a Mount Hira cave. The Holy Qur’an was revealed from 610-632 AD.

mcqs.question_en: Which Surah in the Quran is known as one of the Azāim (verses of prostration)?
mcqs.question_ur: قرآن مجید میں کون سی سورت ہے جسے سجدہ کی آیات میں سے ایک کہا جاتا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Surah As-Sajdah: Classification: Meccan Hizb no: 42 No. of letters: 1523 No. of Rukus: 3 No. of Sajdahs: 1 No. of verses: 30 No. of words: 372

mcqs.question_en: What companion of Prophet (PBUH) was awarded with the title of “The Sword of Allah”?
mcqs.question_ur: رسول اللہ صلی اللہ علیہ وسلم کے کس صحابی کو "اللہ کی تلوار" کے خطاب سے نوازا گیا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Khalid bin Waleed (R.A) was awarded the title of “ The sword of Allah ” Saifullah, meaning sword of God He was an Arab Muslim commander in the service of the Islamic prophet Muhammad, caliph Abu Bakr, and Uma r. He was born in 592 AD, in Mecca, Saudi Arabia He Died : in 642 AD, in Homs ‎ , Syria They were Buried in Khaled Ibn Walid Mosque , in Syria ************* Vu FIA CBT PAPER 15-12-2021

mcqs.question_en: The enforcement of 80 lashes as punishment for consuming alcohol (sharab) is attributed to which Caliph?
mcqs.question_ur: شراب کے استعمال کی سزا کے طور پر 80 کوڑے کے نفاذ کو کس خلیفہ سے منسوب کیا گیا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The punishment of 80 lashes for alcohol consumption was standardized during the caliphate of Umar ibn al-Khattab (R.A) (634–644 CE). This was based on his ijtihad (juridical reasoning) and consultation with companions , considering alcohol’s societal harm.

mcqs.question_en: What did Hazrat Umar (RA) refuse to do in the case of a Zani (adulterer)?
mcqs.question_ur: زانی کے معاملے میں حضرت عمر نے کیا کرنے سے انکار کیا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Hazrat Umar (RA) upheld the Islamic legal requirement of four witnesses to prove the crime of adultery (zina). He refused stoning unless this condition was met, ensuring justice and fairness in accordance with Sharia law .

mcqs.question_en: The doctrine of Qiyas (analogical reasoning) was developed by whom?
mcqs.question_ur: قیاس کا نظریہ (مشابہت استدلال) کس کے ذریعہ تیار کیا گیا تھا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Qiyas is an Islamic jurisprudential tool for deducing legal rulings by analogy . Imam Abu Hanifa was the first to systematically develop and apply Qiyas in Islamic law.

mcqs.question_en: Who introduced the Jail System?
mcqs.question_ur: جیل کا نظام کس نے متعارف کرایا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Hazrat Umer (R.A) introduced the Jail System in Islam Hazrat Umer was the second caliph of Islam . He ruled from August 634 until his assassination in 644. He was the father-in-law of the prophet Muhammad . He became the first Muslim to pray at the Kaaba openly. He has participated in almost all battles He embraced Islam when he was about 32 years old in 616 AD. *** ND29-1-2023

mcqs.question_en: Imam Shafi was Born at Gaza and died at _______?
mcqs.question_ur: امام شافعی غزہ میں پیدا ہوئے اور کہاں وفات پائی؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Fustat, was the first capital of Egyp t under Muslim rule. It was built by the Muslim general 'Amr ibn al-'As immediately after the Muslim conquest of Egypt in AD 641 , and featured the Mosque of Amr, the first mosque built in Egypt

mcqs.question_en: What is meaning of Qayas?
mcqs.question_ur: قیاس کا کیا مطلب ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Qayas refers to " reasoning by analogy " in Islamic jurisprudence (Fiqh). It is legal rulings are derived by analogical reasoning from established principles to new situations.

mcqs.question_en: Tahleel means Recitation of _______?
mcqs.question_ur: تہلیل کا مطلب ہے _______ کی تلاوت؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The word Tahlil is the verbal noun of the form 2 verb Hallala (هَلَّلَ) which literally means '"to praise" or "to acclaim".

mcqs.question_en: What is the rate/ratio of Zakat on silver, gold, and currency (money)?
mcqs.question_ur: چاندی ، سونے اور کرنسی پر زکاٹ کی شرح کتنی ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The standard rate of Zakat on silver, gold, and currency is 2.5% (or 2 ½ %) ........ Zakat money can be spent on Poor Muslims Zakat became obligatory in 2 AH List of Heads of Zakat 1. Al-Fuqara (The poor) 2. Al-Masakin (The needy) 3. Zakat collectors 4. Who converted to Islam 5. Freeing captives 6. Debtors 7. In the path of Allah 8. Wayfarer (Traveler)

mcqs.question_en: What is the Arabic word for "telling the truth"?
mcqs.question_ur: سچ بتانے کے لئے عربی لفظ کیا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Sidq (صدق) means truthfulness or telling the truth in Arabic. It is a key moral value in Islam. It often associated with honesty and integrity.

mcqs.question_en: Who was the first to compile Hadith in the form of a book?
mcqs.question_ur: کسی کتاب کی شکل میں حدیث کو مرتب کرنے والا پہلا شخص کون تھا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Imam Malik ibn Anas compiled the " Muwatta ", the earliest written collection of Hadith and Islamic law. It was organized to serve as a practical legal manual during his time in Medina . Kitaab-ul-Aathaar is one of the earlier Hadith book compiled by Imam Muhammad al-Shaybani (132 AH – 189 AH), the student of Imam Abu Hanifa .

mcqs.question_en: Who was the first naval commander of Islam?
mcqs.question_ur: اسلام کا پہلا بحری کمانڈر کون تھا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Ameer Muawiah (RA) established the first Islamic naval fleet during Caliph Uthman's rule. He led successful maritime campaigns against the Byzantine Empire , marking the start of Muslim naval power.

mcqs.question_en: What does the term "Isnad" refer to in Hadith?
mcqs.question_ur: حدیث میں "اسناد" کی اصطلاح کیا حوالہ دیتی ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Isnad refers to the chain of individuals who transmitted a Hadith from the Prophet Muhammad (PBUH) to the compiler . It is essential for verifying the authenticity and reliability of a Hadith.

mcqs.question_en: What is the meaning of Sunnah?
mcqs.question_ur: سنت کا کیا مطلب ہے؟
options: The way or practice of Prophet SAW
mcqs.correct_answer: The way or practice of Prophet SAW
mcqs.explanation: Explanation There are three type s of Sunnah. The first is the sayings of the prophet – Sunnah Qawliyyah/Hadith. The second is Sunnah Al Filiyya. Third Sunnah Taqririyyah

mcqs.question_en: Which companion taught Hazrat Bilal (RA) the words of Azan?
mcqs.question_ur: حضرت بلال رضی اللہ عنہ کو اذان کے کلمات کس صحابی نے سکھائے؟
options: Hazrat Abdullah bin Zayd bin Abd Rabbah
mcqs.correct_answer: Hazrat Abdullah bin Zayd bin Abd Rabbah
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Hazrat Abdullah bin Zayd bin Abd Rabbah (RA) had a dream in which he saw a man wearing green garments reciting the words of Azan. He told the Prophet Muhammad (PBUH) about the dream, and the Prophet (SAW) instructed him to teach the words to Bilal , who then called the first Azan .

mcqs.question_en: Zakat is NOT due on ______?
mcqs.question_ur: زکوٰۃ ______ پر نہیں ہے؟
options: Personal items like clothes and furniture
mcqs.correct_answer: Personal items like clothes and furniture
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Zakat is not due on personal use items such as clothes, furniture, or home utensils , even if they are expensive. Zakat is due on cash, gold, silver, trade goods, and certain livestock if they reach nisab (minimum threshold).

mcqs.question_en: Salat-e-Jumma became obligatory ______?
mcqs.question_ur: نماز جمعہ کب فرض ہوئی؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation 2nd Hijri Events · Regular calls for prayer. · Change direction of prayer from Jerusalem to the Kabah. · Fasting made compulsory. · Introduction of Zakat. · Hazrat Fatima Marries Hazrat Ali. · Death of Hazrat Ruqayya. · Battle of Badr took place. * Salat-e-Jumma was made compulsory in Madina.

mcqs.question_en: Who claimed to be prophet during the period of Hazrat Abu Bakar Siddique?
mcqs.question_ur: حضرت ابوبکر صدیق کے دور میں نبی ہونے کا دعویٰ کس نے کیا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Musailama al Kazzab False Prophet Was Called The Liar’ By The Holy Prophet Wahshi ibn Harb killed Muslema Kazab (Musailamah al Kazzab) He was killed in the Battle of Yamama in 632 CE .

mcqs.question_en: What is the main purpose of Isma-ur-Rijal?
mcqs.question_ur: اسما ار ریجل کا بنیادی مقصد کیا ہے؟
options: For authenticity of History of Sahaba
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Ilm al-Isma-ur-Rijal is the science of the biographies of Hadith transmitters . Its main purpose is to verify the trustworthiness, memory, and character of narrators in Hadith chains.

mcqs.question_en: "Tarjuman-ul-Quran" was written by which of the following?
mcqs.question_ur: ترجمہ القرآن درج ذیل میں سے کس نے لکھا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation " Tarjuman-ul-Quran " is a translation and commentary of the Quran. It from Arabic to Urdu by Abul Kalam Azad . It is a notable work in Islamic scholarship.

mcqs.question_en: Which pillar of Islam is used as Kaffarah?
mcqs.question_ur: اسلام کا کون سا ستون کفارہ کے طور پر استعمال ہوتا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Fasting (Sawm) is used as Kaffarah (expiation) for certain sins like breaking an oath or intentionally breaking a fast in Ramadan . The Quran prescribes fasting for 60 consecutive days as Kaffarah in specific cases.

mcqs.question_en: Qabil & Habil were the sons of which prophet?
mcqs.question_ur: قابیل اور ہابیل کس نبی کے بیٹے تھے؟
mcqs.explanation:
Explanation Qabil and Habil are the first two sons of Hazrat
Adam (AS) and Bibi Hawwa . The story of Habil and Qabil is mentioned in Surah
e Maida. Qabil killed Habil , becoming the first murderer on
the earth ***

mcqs.question_en: In which language Shah Wali Ullah translated the Holy Quran?
mcqs.question_ur: شاہ ولی اللہ نے قرآن پاک کا ترجمہ کس زبان میں کیا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Ø Real name of Shah Waliullah : Qutubuddin Ahmad Syed Ø Shah Waliullah first time in history translated the Holy Quran in Persian Language Ø Shah Wali Ullah was born in the reign of Aurangzeb, Ø Shah Waliullah Dehlawi Born in 21 February 1703 Phulat, Mughal Empire Ø Shah Waliullah Dehlawi Died in 20 August 1762 (aged 59) Dehli, Mughal Empire

mcqs.question_en: The Umayyad rule in Spain lasted for_____years?
mcqs.question_ur: سپین میں اموی حکومت کتنےسال تک جاری رہی؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The Umayyad rule in Spain, specifically as the Emirate and later Caliphate of Cordoba Lasted for approximately 275 years From 756 to 1031.

mcqs.question_en: What is the correct order of the revealed Islamic holy books?
mcqs.question_ur: نازل شدہ اسلامی مقدس کتابوں کی صحیح ترتیب کیا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation There are four Holy Books The Torat revealed to Musa The Psalms (Zabur r) evealed to Dawud The Injil (Gospel) revealed to Isa The Quran was revealed to Muhammad

mcqs.question_en: Who is considered the compiler of the most authentic collection of hadith?
mcqs.question_ur: احادیث کے سب سے مستند مجموعے کا مرتب کسے کہا جاتا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Imam Bukhari (810-870 CE) is widely considered the compiler of the most authentic collection of hadith, known as Sahih al-Bukhari . His collection is regarded as one of the most reliable and authentic sources of hadith. He is considered the most authentic book after the Quran by many Muslims. List of Siha-e-Sita Books 1. Sahih al Bukhari, collected by Imam Bukhari (d. 870), includes 7275 ahadith 2. Sahih Muslim, collected by Muslim b. al-Hajjaj (d. 875), includes 9200 ahadith 3. Sunan Nasa’i, collected by an-Nasa'i (d. 915) 4. Sunan Abu Dawood , collected by Abu Dawood (d. 888) 5. Jami at-Tirmidhi, collected by al-Tirmidhi (d. 892) 6. Sunan ibn Majah , collected by Ibn Majah (d. 887) ؒList of Siha-e-Sita Books 1. Sahih al Bukhari , collected by Imam Bukhari (d. 870), includes 7275 ahadith 2. Sahih Muslim , collected by Muslim b. al-Hajjaj (d. 875), includes 9200 ahadith 3. Sunan Nasai , collected by an-Nasa'i (d. 915) includes 5270 ahadith 4. Sunan Abu Dawood , collected by Abu Dawood (d. 888) includes 4800 ahadith 5. Jami at-Tirmidhi, collected by al-Tirmidhi (d. 892) includes 3956 ahadith 6. Sunan ibn Majah, collected by Ibn Majah (d. 887) includes 4000 ahadith

mcqs.question_en: Social Boycott of Banu Hashim was continued for ___ years.
mcqs.question_ur: بنو ہاشم کا سماجی بائیکاٹ ___ سال تک جاری رہا۔
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The Meccan banishment of the Hashemites was a public banishment against the clan of Banu Hashim . Declared in 616, 7th year of Prophethood by the leaders of Banu Makhzum and Banu Abd-Shams.

mcqs.question_en: Zun-Noorain is the title of _____?
mcqs.question_ur: زین نورین کس کا لقب ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The literal meaning of Zun-Noorain is Having two Lights *** Zun-Noorain titles of Hazrat Usman, the third Rightly Guided Caliph, Who married t wo of Prophet Muhammad's daughters, viz. Hazrat Ruqaiyya and Hazrat Umm-e-Kulsoom *** Zun-Noorain is the title of Usman (R.A) . This title was given by Khadija (R.A).

mcqs.question_en: Who is considered the pioneer of the School of Hanfi Thought?
mcqs.question_ur: مکتب حنفی کا علمبردار کس کو سمجھا جاتا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The pioneer of the Hanafi School of Islamic thought is Imam Abu Hanifa The Hanafi school emerged from the legal tradition of Kufa in Iraq There are the following Five Schools of Islamic Thought. Hanafi Maliki Shafi΄i Hanbali

mcqs.question_en: Which Surah of Holy Quran, the list of the beneficiaries of Zakat has been specifically given?
mcqs.question_ur: قرآن پاک کی کس سورہ میں زکوٰۃ کے مستحقین کی فہرست (زکوٰۃ کے مصارف) خاص طور پر دی گئی ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Surah Al-Tawba, there are eight categories of people (asnaf) who qualify to benefit from zakat funds. Allah has clearly mentioned the masarif of zakat and sadaqah in Quran in these words: اِنَّمَا الصَّدَقٰتُ لِلْفُقَرَآءِ وَالْمَسٰکِیْنِ وَالْعٰمِلِیْنَ عَلَیْھَا وَالْمُؤَلَّفَۃِ قُلُوْبُھُمْ وَ فِی الرِّقَابِ وَالْغَارِمِیْنَ وَفِیْ سَبِیْلِ اللّٰہِ وَابْنِ السَّبِیْلِ ؕ فَرِیْضَۃً مِّنَ اللّٰہِ ط وَاللّٰہُ عَلِیْمٌ حَکِیْمٌ۔

mcqs.question_en: When did Prophet Muhammad ﷺ visit Taif?
mcqs.question_ur: نبی کریم صلی اللہ علیہ وسلم طائف کب تشریف لائے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation As things became intolerable in Makkah, the Prophet Mohammed (pbuh) decided to move to Taif where he thought he would convey the message of Allah to the tribe of Thaqeef . Prophet Muhammad (PBUH) was accompanied by his adopted son, Zayd ibn Harithah , on his trip to Taif. The trip to Taif in 619 CE . They went to Taif in the month of Shawwal to seek support and spread the message of Isl am.

mcqs.question_en: _______ are the sayings of the Prophet Muhammad (Peace and Blessings of Allah be upon him) as revealed to him by the Almighty Allah.
mcqs.question_ur: حضرت محمد صلی اللہ علیہ وآلہ وسلم کے اقوال ہیں (اللہ کی امن اور برکتیں اس پر رہیں) جیسا کہ اللہ تعالٰی نے ان کے سامنے انکشاف کیا ہے۔ _____
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Hadith Qudsi are divine revelations conveyed by Allah to the Prophet (PBUH) , but in the Prophet's own words. They differ from the Qur'an , which is the exact word of Allah in wording and meaning.

mcqs.question_en: For whom did the Prophet Muhammad (PBUH) pray: "O Allah! Grant him the understanding of Fiqh (religion)"?
mcqs.question_ur: نبی کریم صلی اللہ علیہ وسلم نے کس کے لیے دعا کی: "اے اللہ! اسے فقہ (دین) کی سمجھ عطا فرما"؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The hadith in question refers to a specific prayer the Prophet Muhammad (PBUH) offered for Abdullah ibn Abbas, asking Allah to grant him understanding of Fiqh (religion).

mcqs.question_en: Charge of adultery in Islam is dealt under?
mcqs.question_ur: کیا اسلام میں زنا کے الزام کے تحت کارروائی کی جاتی ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The charge of adultery in Islam, under Pakistani law, is primarily dealt with under Hadd punishment under Hudood Ordinance, specifically the "Offence of Zina (Enforcement of Hudood) Ordinance, 1979".

mcqs.question_en: Ghar-e-Saur is situated in?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Quran's Surah Al Tauba fortieth verse was revealed. Also known as Ghar Thawr, the Cave of Thawr غار ثور کہاں ہے: مکہ آپ صَلَّی اللہُ تَعَالٰی عَلَیْہِ وَاٰلِہٖ وَسَلَّمَ کتنے دن غار ثور میں قیام کیا: تین دن غار یار کس صحابی کو کہا جاتا ہے: حضرت ابو بکر رَضِیَ اللہُ تَعَالٰی عَنْہُ

mcqs.question_en: Surah Hajj consists of _____ Ayats.
mcqs.question_ur: سورہ حج _____ آیتوں پر مشتمل ہے۔
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Surah Hajj was revealed in Madina which consists of 10 Rukus and 78 Ayats. Al-Ḥajj is the 22nd chapter (sūrah) the first stage Surah Al-Hajj  from verses 1-24 shows the Revelation Period of the Holy Prophet's Makki life The second part of Surah Al-Hajj from verses 25-78 was revealed at the first stage of the Holy Prophet's Madni Life **

mcqs.question_en: The nation of Samood was preached by?
mcqs.question_ur: قوم سمود کی تبلیغ کس نے کی تھی؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The nation of Samood was preached by Hazrat Saleh (AS). A miracle of the pregnant female camel was sent to Samood .

mcqs.question_en: When the Ghazwa of Banu Nadhir took place?
mcqs.question_ur: بنو نضیر کا غزوہ کب ہوا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The Ghazwa of Banu Nadhir (Nuzair) took place in May 625 CE, which is equivalent to Rabi' al-awwal 4 AH. Banu Nadir, a Jewish tribe, was expelled from Medina after being accused of plotting to assassinate the Islamic Prophet Muhammad (SAW). The event is described in Surah Al-Hashr, Chapter 59 of the Quran.

mcqs.question_en: The Holy Prophet (PBUH) married Hazrat Khadija at the age of?
mcqs.question_ur: حضور نبی اکرم صلی اللہ علیہ وآلہ وسلم نے حضرت خدیجہ رضی اللہ عنہا سے شادی کس عمر میں کی تھی؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation At the time of the marriage , Hazrat Khadijah was 40 years old. Muhammad was 25 years old. Hazrat Khadija was the first wife of Prophet Muhammad ﷺ Friend of Khadija (رضہ) Nafeesa carried the message of Nikah. Holy Prophet had Four Daughters and three sons from Hazrat Khadija. She passed away when she was 65 and Prophet Muhammad ﷺ was 50 years old. Additional Information She belonged to the tribe of Banu Asad She married Three times in life. She was the daughter of Khuwaylid ibn Asad and Fatima bint Zaidah Hazrat Khadija (R.A) Died on 10 Ramadan BH 3  Mecca She was buried in Jannat al-Mualla, Mecca

mcqs.question_en: Which Surah is called Zeenat-e-Quran?
mcqs.question_ur: زینت القرآن کونسی سورت ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Surah Rehman is also known as the Beauty of Quran. Position: Juzʼ 27 Classification: Medinan No. of letters : 1585 No. of Rukus : 3 No. of verses : 78 No. of words : 352 Other names: Most Gracious

mcqs.question_en: Qurbani during hajj is performed at?
mcqs.question_ur: حج کے دوران قربانی کس وقت ادا کی جاتی ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Qurbani means sacrifice. Qurbani during hajj is performed at Mina Qurbani marks the completion of Hajj The act of Qurbani is carried out between the 10th and 12th of Dhul Hijjah following on from the pilgrimage of Hajj and Eid-ul-Adha prayers They represent Prophet Ibrahim's (AS) and Ismail's loyalty to their religion

mcqs.question_en: حدیث مبارکہ کی رو سے کس دن حضور صہ پر درود شریف کثرت سے پڑھنا چاہیے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation جمعہ کے دن درود شریف کی کثرت کا خاص حکم احادیث مبارکہ سے ثابت ہے۔ یہ دن فضیلت والا ہے اور نبی ﷺ پر درود پڑھنے کا بہت اجر ہے۔

mcqs.question_en: غزوہ بدر کے موقع پر اسلامی لشکر کے پاس کتنے اونٹ تھے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation غزوہ بدر کے موقع پر مسلمانوں کے پاس کل 70 اونٹ اور 2 گھوڑے تھے۔ تین یا چار افراد ایک اونٹ پر باری باری سوار ہوتے تھے، یہاں تک کہ نبی ﷺ نے بھی صحابہ کے ساتھ باری باری سواری فرمائی۔

mcqs.question_en: حضرت جنید بغدادی رحمۃ اللہ علیہ کا اصل نام کیا تھا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation حضرت جنید بغدادی رحمۃ اللہ علیہ کا اصل نام جنید بن محمد بن جنید تھا۔ آپ کی کنیت ابو القاسم تھی اور آپ کو قواریری اور خزار کے لقب سے بھی یاد کیا جاتا ہے۔ آپ کے والد شیشہ فروش تھے، اس لیے آپ کو قواریری بھی کہا جاتا تھا۔

mcqs.question_en: مامون الرشید نے کس بات کا اعلان پوری سلطنت میں کر دیا تھا؟
options: قرآن کو مخلوق ماننا لازم ہے
mcqs.correct_answer: قرآن کو مخلوق ماننا لازم ہے
mcqs.explanation: Explanation خلیفہ مامون الرشید نے " خلقِ قرآن " کا نظریہ اپنایا اور اعلان کیا کہ قرآن کو مخلوق ماننا لازم ہے۔ اس نظریے کی مخالفت کرنے والوں پر سختیاں کی گئیں، جن میں امام احمد بن حنبل کی آزمائش مشہور ہے۔

mcqs.question_en: حدیث "وَاللهُ فِي عَوْنِ العَبْدِ مَا كَانَ العَبْدُ فِي عَوْنِ أَخِيهِ" کے مطابق اللہ تعالیٰ بندے کی مدد کب تک کرتا ہے؟
options: جب تک بندہ اپنے بھائی کی مدد کرتا ہے
جب تک بندہ نماز پڑھتا ہے
جب تک بندہ صدقہ دیتا ہے
mcqs.correct_answer: جب تک بندہ اپنے بھائی کی مدد کرتا ہے
mcqs.explanation: Explanation اس حدیث کا مطلب ہے کہ اللہ تعالیٰ اس بندے کی مدد کرتا ہے جو اپنے مسلمان بھائی کی مدد میں لگا رہے۔ یہ حدیث باہمی تعاون، ہمدردی اور خدمت خلق کی ترغیب دیتی ہے۔

mcqs.question_en: Who accompanied the Holy Prophet (PBUH) in the Cave of Saur?
mcqs.question_ur: غار ثور میں حضور صلی اللہ علیہ وسلم کے ساتھ کون تھا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Also known as Ghar Thawr and Ghar e Saur. According to Islamic legends, this cave is where the Holy Prophet and his companion Abu Bakr al-Siddiq found shelter when fleeing from Quraish search parties. The Prophet (PBUH) and his companion Abu Bakr (RA) hid fo r three days.

mcqs.question_en: How many Muslims participated in the Ghazwa (Battle of) Trench (Khandaq)?
mcqs.question_ur: کتنے مسلمانوں نے غزوا خندق میں حصہ لیا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The Battle of Khandaq (Ahzab) was fought on 5 A. H (627). Ghazwa e Ahzab and Battle of the Trench is the second name of Ghazwa-e-Khandak Muslims 3000 Kufar 10000 10000 Munafiqeen were in Ghazwa-e-Khandaq Additional information: it was the 30-day-long fight of Yathrib by Arabian and Jewish tribes Hazrat Salman Al-Farsi suggests digging the trench at the time of the Battle of Khandaq ***

mcqs.question_en: Allah has mentioned ____ names of the Quran in the Quran itself.
mcqs.question_ur: اللہ تعالیٰ نے قرآن مجید میں ہی ____ قرآن کے نام بتائے ہیں۔
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Allah has mentioned 55 names of the Quran within the Quran itself. These names highlight its attributes, including Al-Furqan (The Criterion), Al-Huda (The Guidance), and Al-Noor (The Light).

mcqs.question_en: How many years did it take for the Quran to be revealed?
mcqs.question_ur: قرآن مجید کے نزول میں کتنے سال لگے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The Holy Quran was revealed to Hazrat Muhammad (PBUH). Iqra (meaning "Read") was the first word revealed in the Holy Quran . The first 5 verses of Surah Al-Alaq were revealed to the Holy Prophet (PBUH). Surah Al-Alaq contains the first revelation in the Holy Quran. Surah Al-Nasr was the last Surah revealed. The Quran was revealed orally by God through the archangel Gabriel (Jibril). The revelation of the Quran began in 610 CE when Prophet Muhammad (PBUH) was 40 years old. The Quran was revealed over 23 years , concluding in 632 CE, the year of the Prophet’s death.

mcqs.question_en: How many Surah are in the Holy Quran?
mcqs.question_ur: قرآن پاک میں کتنی سورتیں ہیں؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The total number of Surah in the Holy Quran is 114 Additional information: The number of Makki Surah is 86 and Madni is 28 The first complete Madani surah of the Quran is Al-Baqarah There are 11 Sajdah are there in Makkah Surah There are only 03 Sajdah are there in Medinan Surah

mcqs.question_en: In which battle a tooth (or part of it according to some sources) of the Holy Prophet (PBUH) was broken?
mcqs.question_ur: کس جنگ میں رسول اللہ صلی اللہ علیہ وسلم کا ایک دانت (یا بعض ذرائع کے مطابق اس کا کچھ حصہ) ٹوٹا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation A tooth of the Holy Prophet (PBUH) was broken at the Battle of Uhud . The Battle of Uhud was a battle fought in 625 CE , where the Prophet Muhammad (SAW) was wounded and had two teeth broken.

mcqs.question_en: Who are called Umm-ul-Momineen?
mcqs.question_ur: ام المومنین کس کو کہتے ہیں؟
options: The sisters of the Holy Prophet (PBUH)
The wife  of the Holy Prophet (PBUH)
The mothers of the Islamic community
The female scholars of early Islam
mcqs.correct_answer: The wife  of the Holy Prophet (PBUH)
mcqs.explanation: Explanation " Umm-ul-Momineen " (أم ٱلْمُؤْمِنِين‎) is an Arabic phrase meaning " Mothers of the Believers ." It is a title given to the wives of the Islamic Prophet Muhammad SAW as a sign of respect. The title is derived from verse 33:6 of the Quran. Muslims use this title before or after referring to these women.

mcqs.question_en: Which was the first battle between Muslims and Kuffars?
mcqs.question_ur: مسلمانوں اور کفار کے درمیان پہلی جنگ کون سی تھی؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation First Ghazwa (Battle) t ook place between Muslims and Kuffar is Ghazwat Abwa. Ghazwa Abwa is the First Ghazwa of Islam. Ghazwa Wadan is another name for this battle. Abwa is the first expedition, in which the Holy Prophet (PBUH) , with 60 Muhajireen , left Madinah with the goal of jihad for the first time in the month of Safar 2 AH.

mcqs.question_en: The Holy Prophet (SAW) was died on ______?
mcqs.question_ur: حضور ﷺنے کب رحلت فرمائی ؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Holy Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) died on 8th June 632 AD on Monday He died at the age of 62 He was buried at al-Masjid an-Nabawi (the Mosque of the Prophet) It is one of the first mosques built by Muhammad in Medina Additional information: The Holy Prophet ﷺ  was born on 12 Rabiulawal (29 August 570 CE) , He was 6 years old when his mother died At eight he loses his grandfather . ** ND13-1-2023

mcqs.question_en: Islamic year starts from/begin with the month of ____?
mcqs.question_ur: اسلامی سال ____ کے مہینے سے شروع ہوتا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The Islamic (Hijri) year begins with the month of Muharram , the first month in the Islamic lunar calendar. It marks the migration (Hijrah) of Prophet Muhammad (PBUH) from Makkah to Madinah . List of Islamic Months Muḥarram, محرم الحرام Ṣafar, صفر المظفر Rabi al Awwal, ربیع الاول Rabi al Sani, ربیع الثانی Jumada al Awwal, جمادی الاول Jumada al Thani, جمادی الثانی Rajab, رجب المرجب Shaban, شعبان المعظم Ramadan (fasting), رمضان المبارک Shawwal, شوال المکرم Dhu al Qadah, ذوالقعدۃ الحرام Dhu al Hijjah, ذوالحجۃ الحرام

mcqs.question_en: ____ is standing straight during Rukus?
mcqs.question_ur: رکوع میں سیدھا کھڑا ھونا کیا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation

mcqs.question_en: Holy Prophet (PBUH) the phase secret preaching continued for how many years?
mcqs.question_ur: حضور صلی اللہ علیہ وآلہ وسلم (ص) مرحلے کی خفیہ تبلیغ کتنے سالوں تک جاری رہی؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Hazrat Muhammad SAW preached Islam secretly for three years . Openly preaching start in 4 Nabvi .

mcqs.question_en: Who is referred in the Quran as Ar-Rooh?
mcqs.question_ur: قرآن مجید میں روح القدس کس کو کہا گیا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Angel Jibril (Gabriel) is referred to as "Rooh ul Ameen". Hazrat Jibrail عَلَيْهِ ٱلسَّلَامُ is the Angel of Allah Almighty who used to bring down revelations to the Prophet . The Holy Quran mentions Hazrat Jibreel (AS) by name only three times. He is the c hief angel. His title is “Rooh” and “Rooh ul Ameen”. “In this Night come down Rooh (Jibril) and angels under the command of their Lord for all the matters” (Sura Al Qadr).

mcqs.question_en: How many week(s) were spent in digging the trench in the Ghazwa-e-Khandaq?
mcqs.question_ur: غزوا خندق میں خندق کھودنے میں کتنے ہفتے گزارے تھے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The Battle of Khandaq (Ahzab) was fought on 5 A. H (627). Ghazwa e Ahzab and Battle of the Trench is the second name of Ghazwa-e-Khandak Muslims 3000 Kufar 10000 10000 Munafiqeen were in Ghazwa-e-Khandaq Additional information: it was the 30-day-long fight of Yathrib by Arabian and Jewish tribes Hazrat Salman Al-Farsi suggests digging the trench at the time of the Battle of Khandaq ***

mcqs.question_en: Jihad become obligatory in which Hijri?
mcqs.question_ur: جہاد کس ہجری میں فرض ہوا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation "Important Question Related To Jihad" Jihad ( Qital Fi Sabilillah ) becomes obligatory 2AH In Islam Jihad by the sword i s superior to all Jihad. To Strive Hard is the literal meaning of Jihad 41 times the word jihad appears in the Quran Syed Ahmad Shaheed started the Jihad movement
