mcqs.explanation: Explanation The terminological meaning of 'Fiqh is " deep understanding" Fiqh refers to the body of Islamic law extracted from detailed Islamic sources There are the following Five Schools of Islamic Thought. Hanafi Maliki Shafi΄i Hanbali ND19-3-2023

mcqs.question_en: The Holy Prophet offered first Jumma prayer in ______?
mcqs.question_ur: حضور صلی اللہ علیہ وسلم نے پہلی نماز جمعہ ______ میں پڑھی؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Holy Prophet offered 1st Juma Prayer in 1 st A.H Salat-e-Juma became Farz in which city Madina

mcqs.question_en: The short period between two Sajda’s is called _____?
mcqs.question_ur: دو سجدوں کے درمیان کی مختصر مدت کو کیا کہتے ہیں؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation A Rakat is one complete cycle of standing (Qa'adah) , bending (Rukoo), prostration (Sajdah), and subsequent sitting (Jalsa) . It also includes standing up again in the Salat.

mcqs.question_en: How many companions (s) are there with the Holy Prophet (PBUH) during the first journey of Yathrib?
mcqs.question_ur: یثرب کے پہلے سفر میں رسول اللہ صلی اللہ علیہ وسلم کے ساتھ کتنے صحابہ تھے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation There they stayed for three days and three nights . On September 24, 622 (1st Hijri) Hazrat Abu Bakar (AS) accompanied the Prophet(SAW) in the migration Qaswa ( camel ) which the Holy Prophet (SAW) was riding in the migration of Madina Muhammad ﷺ and Hazrat Abu Bakr hid inside a cave on the Mount of Thawr. Surah Yaseen is recited by Hazrat Muhammad (PBUH) during migration ABOUT ABU BAKAR Abu Bakr Abdullah was a companion and, through his daughter Aisha . a father-in-law of the Islamic prophet Muhammad. first of the Rashidun Caliphs

mcqs.question_en: Which city of Pakistan held the OIC Conference in 1997?
mcqs.question_ur: انیس سو ستانوے میں او آئی سی کانفرنس پاکستان کے کس شہر میں منعقد ہوئی؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation 1st Extraordinary summit of OIC held in Islamabad between 23–24 March 1997 An Extraordinary OIC Summit was also held in Islamabad in 1997 on the occasion of Pakistan's Golden Jubilee. *** Pakistan hosted the Second OIC Summit Conference in February 1974 in Lahore. 11th Session of The Islamic Summit Conference (Session of The Muslim Ummah in The 21St Century) Dakar, Senegal (13-14 March 2008) ******* 10th Session of The Islamic Summit Conference Putrajaya, Malaysia (16-17 October 2003) ******* 9th Session of The Islamic Summit Conference Doha, State of Qata r (12-13 November 2000) ******* 8th Session of The Islamic Summit Conference Tehran, Islamic Republic of Iran (9-11 December 1997) ******* 7th Session of The Islamic Summit Conference Casablanca, Kingdom of Morocco (13-15 December 1994) ******* 6th Session of The Islamic Summit Conference Dakar, Republic of Senegal (9 - 11 December 1991) ******* 5th Session of The Islamic Summit Conference Kuwait, State of Kuwait (26-29 January 1987) ******* 4th Session of The Islamic Summit Conference Casablanca, Kingdom of Morocco (16-19 January 1984) ******* 3rd Session of The Islamic Summit Conference Makkah Al-Mukarramah , Saudi Arabia (25-28 January 1981) ******* 2nd Session of The Islamic Summit Conference Lahore, Islamic Republic of Pakistan (22 - 24 February 1974) ******* 1st Session of The Islamic Summit Conference Rabat, Kingdom of Morocco (September 1969) ****** ND17-7-2023

mcqs.question_en: Name the language in which the Holy Quran was translated for the first time in India?
mcqs.question_ur: ہندوستان میں پہلی بار قرآن پاک کا ترجمہ کس زبان میں ہوا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The Quran was first translated into Persian in India It was part of the Arabic tafseer (exegesis) of the Quran written by Nizamuddin Nishpuri, an Iranian scholar. The Tafseer was named Tafseer-ul-Gharaaeb Additional information The Holy Quran was first time translated into Urdu : Shah Abdul Qadir and Shah Rafiuddin (Mozah Al-Quran) The Holy Quran was first time translated into Punjabi : Tauqir Amaan Khan The Holy Quran was first time translated into Sindhi : Aakhund Azzizullah The Holy Quran first time translated into English : George Sale The Holy Quran was translated for the first time in World Persian

mcqs.question_en: What is the First belief in Iman-e-Mufassal?
mcqs.question_ur: ایمان مفصل کا پہلا عقیدہ کیا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Muslims have seven beliefs: 1 Belief in the Oneness of God. 2 Belief in the Angels of God. 3 Belief in the Revelations (Books) of God. 4 Belief in the Prophets of God. 5 Belief in the Day of Judgment. 6 Belief in Premeasurement (Qadar). 7 Belief in Resurrection after Death.

mcqs.question_en: The first revelation of Surah Al-Qalam started with the word _____?
mcqs.question_ur: سورہ قلم کی پہلی نزول لفظ _____ سے شروع ہوئی؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The first revelation of Surah Al-Qalam ( Chapter 68 ) started with the word " Nun ". It is the 14th letter of the Arabic alphabet. The chapter begins with the verse: " Nun . By the pen and what they write ." (Quran 68:1)

mcqs.question_en: What are the second belief in Iman-e- Mufassal?
mcqs.question_ur: ایمان مفصل کا دوسرا عقیدہ کیا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Seven essential beliefs are there in Iman-e-Mafassal 1.  Faith in God . 2.  Faith in holy angels . 3.  Faith in all holy Books . 4.  Faith in all holy Prophets . 5.  Faith in the Day of Judgement . 6.  Faith in everything good or bad is decided by God (Taqdir). 7.  Faith in life after death .

mcqs.question_en: Who was the second Caliph?
mcqs.question_ur: دوسرا خلیفہ کون تھا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Who was the First C aliph? Hazrat Abu Bakar was the first caliph after Holy Prophet. Hazrat Abu Bakar remained Chalipha 8 June 632 – 23 August 634 *** Who was the second Caliph? Hazrat Umar(R.A.) *** Who was the Third Caliph of Islam? Hazrat Usman(R.A.) *** Who was the fourth Caliph? Hazrat Ali (R.A.) Hazrat Ali(R.A.) Caliph period from 656 till 661 CE *** Which sahabi proposed the name of Hazrat Abu Bakr (R.A) for the first Caliphate of Islam? Hazrat Umar (R.A) ND10-3-2023

mcqs.question_en: The poet of the Prophet (PBUH) was ______?
mcqs.question_ur: رسول اللہ صلی اللہ علیہ وسلم کا شعر ______ تھا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The first poet of Islam was Hassan Bin Sabit . An Arabian poet and companion of the Prophet Muhammad SAW. He was renowned for his poetry defending and promoting Islam . He was Born in 563 AD. He was died in 674 AD , aged 110 or 111.

mcqs.question_en: Belief in Tauheed is comprehensively described in _____?
mcqs.question_ur: عقیدہ توحید کو _____ میں جامع طور پر بیان کیا گیا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Surah Al-Ikhlas ( Chapter 112 of the Holy Quran) is a comprehensive description of the belief in Tauheed ( the Oneness of God ). It is a short chapter consisting of only 4 verses. But it provides a clear and concise explanation of the concept of Tauheed . It emphasizing the unity and uniqueness of Allah (God) . Tawheed means the Oneness of Allah . No one likes worship without Allah. *** there are five pillars of Islam Tawheed is the first pillar *** The Five Pillars of Islam The profession of Faith (shahada) Tawheed . The belief that "There is no god but God, and Muhammad is the Messenger of God" is central to Islam. Prayer (salat). Muslims pray facing Mecca five times a day: at dawn, noon, mid-afternoon, sunset, and after dark Alms (zakat). Fasting (sawm). Pilgrimage (hajj)

mcqs.question_en: The language of the Holy Qur'an is _____?
mcqs.question_ur: قرآن پاک کی زبان _____ ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The language of the Holy Qur'an is living . It is in Arabic , which remains a widely spoken and understood language. The Holy Quran was revealed to Hazrat Muhammad (PBUH). Iqra (meaning "Read") was the first word revealed in the Holy Quran . The first 5 verses of Surah Al-Alaq were revealed to the Holy Prophet (PBUH). Surah Al-Alaq contains the first revelation in the Holy Quran. Surah Al-Nasr was the last Surah revealed. The Quran was revealed orally by God through the archangel Gabriel (Jibril). The revelation of the Quran began in 610 CE when Prophet Muhammad (PBUH) was 40 years old. The Quran was revealed over 23 years , concluding in 632 CE, the year of the Prophet’s death.

mcqs.question_en: The true purpose of Jehad is ______?
mcqs.question_ur: جہاد کا اصل مقصد کیا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The true purpose of Jihad is the glory of divine religion . It involves striving in the way of Allah to promote justice, righteousness, and uphold the values of Islam. To Strive Hard is the literal meaning of Jihad *** Jihad becomes first in. 2AH 41 times the word jihad appears in Quran Jihad is an Arabic word derived from Jahada .

mcqs.explanation: Explanation ﻿The current order of the Quran surah is Touqeefi. **

mcqs.question_en: Hazrat Jibrael used to come in the guise of ______?
mcqs.question_ur: حضرت جبرائیل ______ کے بھیس میں آیا کرتے تھے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Hazrat Jibrael used to come in the guise of Hazrat Dahya Kalbi . He was a companion of the Prophet Muhammad (PBUH) known for his handsome appearance , which Jibrael sometimes took when visiting the Prophet SAW .

mcqs.question_en: Hazrat Amina mother of Muhammad (PBUH) was buried in _____?
mcqs.question_ur: محمد صلی اللہ علیہ وسلم کی والدہ حضرت آمنہ کو _____ میں دفن کیا گیا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Amina bint Wahb ibn Abd Manaf was the mother of the Islamic Prophet Muhammad SAW. She belonged to the Banu Zuhra tribe.

mcqs.question_en: The grave of the Prophet was prepared by ?
mcqs.question_ur: نبی کریم کی قبر کس نے تیار کی تھی؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The grave of the Holy Prophet Muhammad was prepared by a companion Hazrat Abu Talha RA. Prophet Hazrat Muhammad (PBUH) was buried in Madina (571 AD) He Died  on June 8, 632 on Monday at the age of 63 in the city of Madina .

mcqs.question_en: Who was the bestowed with both Prophethood and Kingship?
mcqs.question_ur: نبوت اور بادشاہی دونوں کس کو عطا کیے گئے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Hazrat Dawood (A.S) is a prophet and messenger of God (Allah) , He was the second king of the United Kingdom of Israel and Judah, reigning c. 1010–970 BCE. Additional information Najibullah is the title of Hazrat Dawood (AS) The holy book Zaboor was revealed to Hazrat Dawood (AS) Hazrat Dawood (AS) is buried in Israel . Hazrat Dawood is called caliph of Allah. Hazrat Dawood (AS) is mentioned in the Holy Quran for 16 times.

mcqs.question_en: Which Manasiq of Hajj is Compulsory?
mcqs.question_ur: حج کا کون سا مناسک فرض ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Pillar 3 – Waqfat Arafah The standing at 'Arafah (Wuquf Arafah) is a pillar of Hajj and is therefore compulsory. Additional information Hajj means to intend . Hajj was made compulsory in 9 A.H. Hajj was ordained in Surah Bakr. There are 3 type s of Hajj . The number of Jamarat is 3. The mosque located in Mina is Kheef. At Meekat, Hujjaj assumes the state of Ihram. Kalima Tauheed is recited during the Hajj.

mcqs.question_ur: حضرت محمد صلی اللہ علیہ وسلم نے اپنی علمی سطح کی وجہ سے کس کے لیے تعلیم کا اہتمام کیا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) recognized Hazrat Hafsa's (RA) intelligence and arranged for her education. Hazrat Hafsah was the 4th wife of Hazrat Muhammad. Hazrat Muhammad ﷺ married Hafsah in Shaaban 3AH She was married to Khunais ibn Hudhaifah but became a widow She was the daughter of Hazrat Umar (2nd Caliph) She was the First Woman “Hafiz e Quran”

mcqs.question_ur: روزے اور زکوٰۃ کو کس ہجری میں فرض کیا گیا؟

mcqs.question_en: Which was the first revealed word of the Holy Quran?
mcqs.question_ur: قرآن پاک کا پہلا نازل شدہ کلام کون سا تھا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Holy Quran r evealed on Hazrat Muhammad Iqra was the first revealed word in the Holy Quran 5 verses of Surah Al-Alaq were first revealed by the Holy Prophet (PBUH) Surah Alaq was the first verse in the Holy Quran revealed Surah Al Nasr was last revealed Quran was orally revealed by God, Quran was revealed through the archangel Gabriel (Jibril), 23 قرآن کا نزول کتنے سالوں میں مکمل ہوا: سال Quran revelation was beginning on 22 December 609 CE, Quran was orally revealed when Muhammad was 40 years old Quran was concluded in 632, the year of Muhammad's death ND13-5-2023

mcqs.question_en: Which Islamic month has Shab-e-Mairaj?
mcqs.question_ur: شب معراج کس اسلامی مہینے میں ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The Miraj event took place on the 27th of Rajab in the 10th (621 A.D) year of Prophethood. Prophet Muhammad (SAW) was staying at the house of Umm Hani on the night of Miraj. That night, Angel Jibreel came to the Prophet (SAW) and took him on the journey of Israa and Miraj. During Miraj, Hazrat Adam and Hazrat Muhammad (SAW) met at the first heaven. The event is mentioned in Surah Bani Israel. It is also known as 'Isra and Mi'raj' or 'Shab-e-Meraj'. Isra : Night journey from Makkah to Masjid Al-Aqsa. Mi’raj : Journey from Masjid Al-Aqsa to the heavens. Gifts of the 27th of Rajab : The five prescribed daily prayers. The last part of the chapter of Al-Baqara (Amanar-Rasulu).

mcqs.question_en: Who conquered the last fort of Khyber?
mcqs.question_ur: خیبر کا آخری قلعہ کس نے فتح کیا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Battle of Khyber fought against Jews of Khyber. Battle of Khyber began in Muharram on 7/628. Hazrat Ali killed Marhab while conquering the Qamus fort.

mcqs.question_en: Which companion of the Holy Prophet (SAW) was called Al-Zulifqar?
mcqs.question_ur: حضور صلی اللہ علیہ وسلم کے کس صحابی کو الذوالفقار کہا جاتا تھا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Hazrat Ali (RA) was given the title " Al-Zulfiqar " by the Holy Prophet (SAW), which means " the possessor of the two swords ". He was a cousin and son-in-law of the Prophet (SAW). He was known for his bravery and military prowess. The sword " Zulfiqar " was also given to him by the Prophet (SAW). He is considered a symbol of his valor and strength.

mcqs.question_en: What is term for the hadith narrated by a single reliable narrator throughout the chain of transmission?
mcqs.question_ur: کسی ایک معتبر راوی کی روایت کردہ حدیث کے لیے کیا اصطلاح ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Gharib (غريب) is a term used in hadith studies to describe a hadith that is narrated by a single reliable narrator throughout the chain of transmission. This means that the hadith is narrated by only one person at each level of the isnad (chain of transmission), making it a unique or solitary narration .

mcqs.question_en: What is the term for the process of interpreting the Quran through the Quran itself?
mcqs.question_ur: قرآن کے ذریعے قرآن کی تفسیر کرنے کے عمل کو کیا اصطلاح کہتے ہیں؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Tafsir (تفسير) is the Arabic term for the process of interpreting the Quran through various methods, including interpreting the Quran through itself , known as " Tafsir al-Quran bi-l-Quran " (تفسير القرآن بالقرآن). This approach involves understanding a particular verse or passage by cross-referencing it with other relevant verses and passages within the Quran.

mcqs.question_en: What was the name of the Abbasid Caliph who commissioned the translation of Greek philosophical works into Arabic?
mcqs.question_ur: یونانی فلسفیانہ کاموں کا عربی میں ترجمہ کرنے والے عباسی خلیفہ کا کیا نام تھا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Al-Mamun (786-833 CE) was the seventh Abbasid Caliph , who ruled from 813 to 833 CE. He was a patron of learning and philosophy , and his court was renowned for its intellectual and cultural achievements. Al-Mamun commissioned the translation of many Greek philosophical works into Arabic , including the works of Aristotle, Plato, and other prominent philosophers.

mcqs.question_en: According to Hanafi jurisprudence, what is the status of a marriage contract concluded without the presence of witnesses?
mcqs.question_ur: فقہ حنفی کے مطابق گواہوں کی موجودگی کے بغیر عقد نکاح کی کیا حیثیت ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation In Hanafi jurisprudence , a marriage contract concluded without the presence of witnesses is considered valid . The Hanafi school of thought holds that the presence of witnesses is not a essential condition for the validity of a marriage contract.

mcqs.question_en: What is the term for the principle of analogical reasoning in Islamic jurisprudence?
mcqs.question_ur: اسلامی فقہ میں مشابہت استدلال کے اصول کی اصطلاح کیا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Qiyas (قياس) is the principle of analogical reasoning in Islamic jurisprudence. It involves using reasoning by analogy to derive a ruling or judgment in a particular case , based on a similar case or principle established in the Quran, Hadith, or previous juristic decisions. Qiyas is one of the four main sources of Islamic law , alongside: Quran (the holy book of Islam) Hadith (the sayings and actions of the Prophet Muhammad) Ijma (consensus of the Muslim community) Qiyas (analogical reasoning)

mcqs.question_en: Who among the following Islamic philosophers argued for the eternity of the universe?
mcqs.question_ur: مندرجہ ذیل اسلامی فلسفیوں میں سے کس نے کائنات کی ابدیت کی دلیل دی؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Ibn Rushd (1126-1198 CE) argued for the eternity of the universe in his work " The Incoherence of the Incoherence ". He believed that the universe has always existed and will always exist , with no beginning or end. This idea was controversial in his time, as it seemed to contradict the Islamic doctrine of creation.

mcqs.question_en: Which Islamic theological school emphasized the role of reason in understanding divine commands?
mcqs.question_ur: کس اسلامی مذہبی مکتب نے احکام الٰہی کو سمجھنے میں عقل کے کردار پر زور دیا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Mutazilisim is an Islamic theological school that emerged in the 8th century CE , emphasizing the role of reason in understanding divine commands. They believed that human reason could be used to interpret the Quran and the Hadith (the sayings and actions of the Prophet Muhammad) , and that individuals had the freedom to choose between good and evil.

mcqs.question_en: Who among the following Islamic philosophers developed the theory of "The Eternity of the Universe"?
mcqs.question_ur: مندرجہ ذیل اسلامی فلسفیوں میں سے کس نے "کائنات کی ابدیت" کا نظریہ تیار کیا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Ibn Rushd (1126-1198 CE) developed the theory of " The Eternity of the Universe " in his work " The Incoherence of the Incoherence ". He argued that the universe has always existed and will always exist, with no beginning or end. This idea was controversial in his time, as it seemed to contradict the Islamic doctrine of creation.

mcqs.question_en: What is the Islamic concept of the "Intercession" on the Day of Judgement?
mcqs.question_ur: قیامت کے دن "شفاعت" کا اسلامی تصور کیا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Al-Shafaah (الشفاعة) is the Islamic concept of " Intercession " on the Day of Judgment. It refers to the idea that certain individuals, such as prophets, saints, and martyrs , will intercede on behalf of sinners to Allah (God) to forgive their sins and grant them entry into Paradise.

mcqs.question_en: Which of the following Islamic scholars is known for his work on the principles of Islamic governance?
mcqs.question_ur: مندرجہ ذیل میں سے کون سا اسلامی اسکالر اسلامی حکمرانی کے اصولوں پر اپنے کام کے لیے جانا جاتا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Al-Mawardi (d. 1058 CE) was a renowned Islamic scholar and jurist . He wrote extensively on the principles of Islamic governance, politics, and public administration. His most famous work, " Al-Ahkam al-Sultaniyya " (The Ordinances of Government), is a seminal text on Islamic political theory and governanc e.

mcqs.question_en: What is the term for the Islamic concept of the "Preservation of faith"?
mcqs.question_ur: تحفظ ایمان کے اسلامی تصور کی اصطلاح کیا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Hifz Al-Iman (حفظ الإيمان) is the Islamic concept of " Preservation of Faith " or " Protection of Faith ". It refers to the idea that Allah (God) protects and preserves the faith of a believer. It ensuring that they remain on the right path and do not stray from the teachings of Islam.

mcqs.question_en: Who is the author of the influential Islamic theological text "Al-Iqtisad Fi Al-I'tiqad"?
mcqs.question_ur: بااثر اسلامی مذہبی متن "الاقتصاد فی الاعتقاد" کا مصنف کون ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Al-Ghazali is the author of " Al-Iqtisad Fi Al-I'tiqad ". It is an influential text on Islamic theology that explores the principles of Islamic belief and rationality in theology.

mcqs.question_en: Which of the following Sufi orders emphasizes the importance of spiritual love and intimacy with Allah?
mcqs.question_ur: مندرجہ ذیل میں سے کون سا صوفی حکم اللہ کے ساتھ روحانی محبت اور قربت کی اہمیت پر زور دیتا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The Chishti Order is a Sufi order that emphasizes the importance of spiritual love and intimacy with Allah. The Chishti's believe that love is the most powerful force in the universe and that it is the key to unlocking spiritual growth and self-realization. They emphasize the development of a personal relationship with Allah, characterized by love, devotion, and intimacy. The Chishti's also emphasize the importance of: Ishq (spiritual love) Muhabba (divine love) Uns (intimacy with Allah) Fana (annihilation of the self)

mcqs.question_en: What is the Islamic concept the "Signs of the end of time"?
mcqs.question_ur: اسلامی تصور "وقت کے خاتمے کی نشانیاں" کیا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Al-Isharat , also known as " The Signs of the End of Time ", refers to the Islamic concept of the indications or portents that signal the approaching end of the world and the Day of Judgment . These signs are believed to be foretold by the Prophet Muhammad (SAW) and are based on hadiths (his sayings and actions). The Signs of the End of Time include events such as: The appearance of the Dajjal (Antichrist) The descent of Jesus Christ (Isa) The rise of the Mahdi (a righteous leader) The emergence of the Ya'juj and Ma'juj (Gog and Magog) The sinking of the earth in the East and West The appearance of the smoke The rising of the sun from the West

mcqs.question_en: Who among the following Islamic scholars developed the theory of "The Four Sources of Shariah"?
mcqs.question_ur: مندرجہ ذیل اسلامی اسکالرز میں سے کس نے "شریعت کے چار ذرائع" کا نظریہ تیار کیا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Al-Shafi'i (d. 820 CE) was a renowned Islamic scholar and jurist who developed the theory of " The Four Sources of Shariah " (الشرعية الأربعة): Quran (القرآن) Hadith (الحديث) Ijma (الإجماع) - Consensus of the Muslim community Qiyas (القياس) - Analogical reasoning

mcqs.question_en: What is the term for the Islamic concept of the "Infallibility of Prophets"?
mcqs.question_ur: انبیاء کی عصمت کے اسلامی تصور کی اصطلاح کیا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Ismah (عصمة) is the Islamic concept of the " Infallibility of Prophets ". It refers to the belief that prophets are protected from committing sins and errors in their teachings and actions . This concept is based on the idea that prophets are chosen by Allah (God) to convey His message to humanity , and therefore, they must be trustworthy and reliable.

mcqs.question_en: What is the Islamic concept of the "Night Journey"?
mcqs.question_ur: رات کے سفر کا اسلامی تصور کیا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Al-Isra' wal-Mi'raj is also known as the Night Journey . It refers to the Prophet Muhammad's (SAW) journey from Mecca to Jerusalem and then to heaven , where he met with previous prophets and received revelations from Allah (God). The Night Journey is believed to have taken place in 621 CE , during the Prophet's lifetime. The terms Al-Isra' and Al-Mi'raj are often used together to describe the entire event, which consists of two parts: Al-Isra' (الاسراء) : The journey from Mecca to Jerusalem, where the Prophet prayed at the Temple Mount. Al-Mi'raj (المعراج) : The ascension to heaven, where the Prophet met with previous prophets and received revelations.

mcqs.question_en: Which of the following Islamic scholars is known for his work on the principles of Islamic economics?
mcqs.question_ur: مندرجہ ذیل میں سے کون سا اسلامی اسکالر اسلامی معاشیات کے اصولوں پر اپنے کام کے لیے جانا جاتا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Ibn Khaldun (d. 1406 CE) was a renowned Islamic scholar, historian, and economist . He is widely recognized as one of the founders of modern economics . His work, " The Muqaddimah " (The Prolegomena), is considered a seminal text in the field of Islamic economics .

mcqs.question_en: What is the term for the Islamic concept of the "Rightly guided caliphs"?
mcqs.question_ur: صحیح ہدایت یافتہ خلفاء کے اسلامی تصور کی اصطلاح کیا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Al-Khulafa Al-Rashidun (الخلفاء الراشدون) is the Islamic term for the " Rightly Guided Caliphs ", who were the first four caliphs in Islamic history. They are considered to be the most righteous and virtuous leaders in Islamic history, and their reign is often referred to as the " Golden Age " of Islam. The four Rightly Guided Caliphs are : Abu Bakr al-Siddiq (632-634 CE) Umar ibn al-Khattab (634-644 CE) Uthman ibn Affan (644-656 CE) Ali ibn Abi Talib (656-661 CE)

mcqs.question_en: Who is the author of the influence Islamic philosophical text "Al-Futuhat Al-Makkiyyah"?
mcqs.question_ur: اثر اسلامی فلسفیانہ متن "الفتوحات المکیہ" کا مصنف کون ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Ibn Arabi (d. 1240 CE) was a renowned Islamic philosopher, mystic, and scholar who wrote the influential text " Al-Futuhat Al-Makkiyyah " (The Meccan Revelations). This work is considered one of the most important in Islamic philosophy and Sufism. "Al-Futuhat Al-Makkiyyah" is a comprehensive treatise on Islamic philosophy, theology, and spirituality , covering topics such as: The nature of God and the universe The role of the prophet and the imam The path to spiritual realization and gnosis The unity of existence (wahdat al-wujud)

mcqs.question_en: Which of the following Sufi orders emphasizes the importance of spiritual retreat?
mcqs.question_ur: مندرجہ ذیل میں سے کون سا صوفی حکم روحانی اعتکاف کی اہمیت پر زور دیتا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The Naqshband order is a Sufi order that emphasizes the importance of spiritual retreat (khalwa) as a means of spiritual growth and self-purification. Naqshbandis believe that spiritual retreat allows the individual to focus on their inner self, detach from worldly attachments, and cultivate a deeper connection with God. The Naqshband order was founded by Baha-ud-Din Naqshband Bukhari (d. 1389 CE) and is known for its emphasis on: Spiritual retreat (khalwa) Silent contemplation (muraqaba) Devotional love (ishq) Inner purification (tazkiya)

mcqs.question_en: What is the Islamic concept of the "Seven Internal Organs" mentioned in the Quran?
mcqs.question_ur: قرآن مجید میں بیان کردہ "سات اندرونی اعضاء" کا اسلامی تصور کیا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation In Islamic theology, Al-Nafs (النفس) refers to the concept of the " Seven Internal Organs " mentioned in the Quran. Al-Nafs is often translated as " the self " or " the soul ". It is believed to comprise seven internal organs or faculties that govern human behavior and spiritual growth. The seven internal organs are: Al-Nafs al-Ammarah (the commanding self) Al-Nafs al-Lawwamah (the reproaching self) Al-Nafs al-Mulhimah (the inspired self) Al-Nafs al-Mutmainnah (the tranquil self) Al-Nafs al-Radiyah (the pleased self) Al-Nafs al-Mardiyyah (the pleasing self) Al-Nafs al-Safiyyah (the pure self)

mcqs.question_en: Who among the following Islamic theologians developed the theory of Acquired Knowledge?
mcqs.question_ur: مندرجہ ذیل اسلامی ماہرین الہیات میں سے کس نے حاصل شدہ علم کا نظریہ تیار کیا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Al-Ghazali (d. 1111 CE) developed the theory of Acquired Knowledge (ilm al-muktasab), which posits that knowledge is acquired through reason, experience, and reflection , in addition to revelation and scripture. He emphasized the importance of intellectual inquiry and critical thinking in understanding the nature of reality and the divine.

mcqs.question_en: What is the term for the Islamic concept of the "Preservation of the Quran"?
mcqs.question_ur: تحفظ قرآن کے اسلامی تصور کی اصطلاح کیا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Hifz refers to the Islamic concept of the " Preservation of the Quran ". In Islamic theology, Hifz means that the Quran has been perfectly preserved and protected from any corruption, alteration, or distortion since its revelation to the Prophet Muhammad (SAW). This concept is based on the belief that Allah (God) has taken it upon Himself to safeguard the Quran, ensuring its integrity and authenticity for all time.

mcqs.question_en: Which of the following Islamic scholars is known for his work on the principles of Islamic jurisprudence?
mcqs.question_ur: مندرجہ ذیل میں سے کون سا اسلامی اسکالر اسلامی فقہ کے اصولوں پر اپنے کام کے لیے جانا جاتا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Al-Shafi'i (d. 820 CE) was a renowned Islamic scholar and jurist. He is known for his work on the principles of Islamic jurisprudence , particularly in his book " Al-Risala " (The Treatise). Al-Shafi'i's contributions to Islamic jurisprudence include: Developing the concept of " usul al-fiqh " (principles of jurisprudence) Establishing the importance of " ijma " (consensus) and " qiyas " (analogical reasoning) in legal decision-making Clarifying the role of " hadith " (Prophetic traditions) in shaping Islamic law

mcqs.question_en: What is the Islamic concept of the "Cycle of Prophecy"?
mcqs.question_ur: نبوت کے چکر کا اسلامی تصور کیا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Nubuwaah (Prophethood) refers to the Islamic concept of the " Cycle of Prophecy ". It describes the process of divine revelation and guidance sent by Allah (God) to humanity through a series of prophets. This cycle begins with the first prophet, Adam , and continues through various prophets, including Abraham, Moses, Jesus, and culminates with the final prophet, Muhammad (SAW).

mcqs.question_en: Who is the author of the influential Islamic theological text "Al-Muwafaqat"?
mcqs.question_ur: بااثر اسلامی مذہبی متن "الموفقات" کا مصنف کون ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Al-Shatibi (d. 1388 CE) was a renowned Islamic scholar and theologian from Granada, Spain . He is best known for his influential work " Al-Muwafaqat fi Usul al-Sharia " (The Reconciliations in the Principles of Jurisprudence). It is a comprehensive treatise on Islamic theology, jurisprudence, and legal theory.

mcqs.question_en: Which of the following Sufi orders emphasizes the importance of love and devotion to Allah?
mcqs.question_ur: مندرجہ ذیل میں سے کون سا صوفی حکم اللہ سے محبت اور عقیدت کی اہمیت پر زور دیتا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The Chishti Order is a Sufi order that emphasizes the importance of love and devotion to Allah. It was founded by Abu Ishaq Shami Chishti (d. 941 CE). He is known for its emphasis on spiritual purification, self-discipline, and love for the Divine.

mcqs.question_en: What is the term for the Islamic concept of the "Collective Duty" to enforce moral and social justice?
mcqs.question_ur: اخلاقی اور سماجی انصاف کے نفاذ کے اسلامی تصور "اجتماعی فرض" کی اصطلاح کیا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Farz Kifayah is also known as Collective Duty. It refers to the Islamic concept where the community as a whole is responsible for ensuring that certain duties and obligation s are fulfilled. This includes enforcing moral and social justice , promoting good, and preventing evil. If the community fails to fulfill these duties , individual members may be held accountable.

mcqs.question_en: Which among the following Islamic philosophers is known for his theory of "Essential vs Accidental Existence"?
mcqs.question_ur: مندرجہ ذیل میں سے کون سا اسلامی فلسفی اپنے نظریہ "ضروری بمقابلہ حادثاتی وجود" کے لیے جانا جاتا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Ibn Sina (980-1037 CE) was a renowned Islamic philosopher and scholar who developed the theory of " Essential vs Accidental Existence ". This theory posits that existence can be categorized into two types: Essential existence (wujud bi-dhatihi) : This refers to the necessary existence of God, which is inherent and self-sustaining. Accidental existence (wujud bi-ghayrihi) : This refers to the contingent existence of created beings, which is dependent on God's will and sustenance.

mcqs.question_en: According to Islamic jurisprudence, what is the primary source of Shariah Law?
mcqs.question_ur: اسلامی فقہ کے مطابق شریعت کا بنیادی ماخذ کیا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation In Islamic jurisprudence, the primary source of Shariah Law is the Quran . It is considered the word of God as revealed to the Prophet Muhammad (SAW). The Quran is the foundation of Islamic law. It is considered the ultimate authority in all matters of faith and practice .

mcqs.question_en: Which of the following concepts is central to the Islamic doctrine of Tauheed?
mcqs.question_ur: مندرجہ ذیل میں سے کون سا تصور اسلامی نظریہ توحید میں مرکزی حیثیت رکھتا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Tauheed (Tawhid) is the Islamic concept of the oneness of God . Wahdat Al-Wujud is a related concept that refers to the idea that there is only one existence , and that everything that exists is a manifestation of God's being . This concept is central to the Islamic doctrine of Tauheed , as it emphasizes the unity and uniqueness of God's existence.

mcqs.question_en: What is the punishment for slander to a pious woman?
mcqs.question_ur: نیک عورت پر بہتان لگانے کی کیا سزا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation In Islamic law, the punishment for slander (known as " Qadhf " in Arabic) against a pious woman is 80 lashes . This is based on the Quranic verse: " And those who accuse chaste women and then do not bring four witnesses, flog them, (giving) eighty lashes, and do not admit any evidence from them ever ." (Quran 24:4)

mcqs.question_en: ______ got the fifth place in the history of the collectors of Hadith.
mcqs.question_ur: احادیث کے جمع کرنے والوں کی تاریخ میں ______ نے پانچواں مقام حاصل کیا۔
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Imam Tirmizi (824-892 CE) was a renowned Islamic scholar and collector of hadith (Prophetic traditions). He compiled a hadith collection known as Jami' al-Tirmizi. It is considered one of the six most authentic hadith collections in Islam. Imam Tirmizi's work is ranked fifth in the history of hadith collection, after: Imam Bukhari (810-870 CE) Imam Muslim (817-875 CE) Imam Abu Dawud (817-889 CE) Imam Nasa'i (823-915 CE) So, Imam Tirmizi's collection is ranked fifth in the order of authenticity and preference.

mcqs.question_en: Name the Ghazwa in which wine was prohibited?
mcqs.question_ur: غزوہ کا نام بتائیں جس میں شراب حرام تھی؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Alcoholic drinks were banned in the fourth year of the Hijra (4 A.H), when Bani Nadeer Jews were driven into exile from their lands.

mcqs.question_en: When Khalid bin Waleed was removed from the service in the reign of Hazrat Umar Farooq (رضہ)?
mcqs.question_ur: حضرت عمر فاروق رضی اللہ عنہ کے دور میں خالد بن ولید کو کب ملازمت سے ہٹایا گیا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Khalid ibn al-Walid was an Arab Muslim commander in the service of the Islamic prophet Muhammad and the caliphs Abu Bakr and Uma r . Born: 592 AD, Mecca, Saudi Arabia Died: 642 AD, Homs ‎ , Syria Buried: 642 AD, Khaled Ibn Walid Mosque, Homs ‎ , Syria

mcqs.question_en: The first ever International treaty in Islamic History is known as?
mcqs.question_ur: اسلامی تاریخ کا پہلا بین الاقوامی معاہدہ کس نام سے جانا جاتا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The Treaty of Madina is also known as the Constitution of Madina. Misaq e Madinawas the first written constitution of the world **** The Constitution of Medina, written on behalf of the Islamic prophet Muhammad in 622 CE written agreement (Meesaq e Madina) was signed between the Muslims and Jews. In Misaq e Madina total articles are 47 The first Islamic State was established by Muhammad in Medina under the Constitution of Medina. ******

mcqs.question_en: Who establishes Bait Ul Mal?
mcqs.question_ur: بیت المال کس نے قائم کیا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Bayt al-mal in Arabic term can be translated as “House of Money” or “House of Wealth .” The Bayt al-Mal was formally established during the second Caliph, Umar al-Khattab Hazrat Umar appointed Abdullah Bin Masud as custodian of Bait Ul Mal while Pakistan Bait-ul-Mal (PBM), is an autonomous body set up through the 1991 Act. ND11-2-2023

mcqs.question_en: Siege of Taif was laid in which of the following Hijri?
mcqs.question_ur: طائف کا محاصرہ درج ذیل میں سے کس ہجری میں ہوا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The Siege of Taif was a military expedition led by the Prophet Muhammad (Peace Be Upon Him) in the year 8 A.H. (629-630 CE). The siege was an attempt to capture the city of Taif , which was a strategic location in Arabia , but it was unsuccessful . Despite the failure , the expedition marked an important turning point in the Prophet's military campaigns and the spread of Islam.

mcqs.question_en: Which holy book is called ‘Gospel’?
mcqs.question_ur: کس مقدس کتاب کو 'انجیل' کہا جاتا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The Injeel was the holy book revealed by Allah to Hazrat Esa (AS). Injeel means good news. Injeel is also called Gospel . Gospel means truth . Injeel was revealed in Hebrew .

mcqs.question_en: By whom were the Bani Israel prevented by Allah (SWT)?
mcqs.question_ur: بنی اسرائیل کو اللہ سبحانہ وتعالیٰ نے کس کے ذریعے روکا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation According to Islamic belief, Allah (SWT) rescued the Bani Israel from the tyranny of Pharaoh , who had enslaved them. Through miracles, including parting the Red Sea , Allah (SWT) allowed them to escape his oppression.

mcqs.question_en: "Muhammad is the messenger of Allah" is stated in Surah _____?
mcqs.question_ur: محمد اللہ کے رسول ہیں سورہ _____ میں بیان کیا گیا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation " Muhammad is the Messenger of Allah ; and those with him are forceful against the disbelievers, merciful among themselves ." - Surah Al-Fath, verses 29. The name ‘ Muhammad ‘ is mentioned four times in the Holy Quran : Aal Imraan 3:144 , Al-Ahzaab 33:40 , Muhammad 47:2 , and Al-Fatah 48:29 . The name ‘ Ahmad ‘ is mentioned once in Al-Saff 61:6. Al-Fath , the 48th chapter of the Quran with 29 verses. It was revealed in Madinah in the sixth year of Hijrah , on the occasion of the Treaty of Hudaybiyyah.

mcqs.question_en: Holy Prophet used to go to a Mosque on every 17th Ramadan, state the name of Mosque?
mcqs.question_ur: حضور ﷺ ہر 17 رمضان کو جس مسجد میں تشریف لے جاتے تھے، اسں مسجد کا نام بتائیں
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The Holy Prophet (PBUH) used to visit Quba Mosque on the 17th of Ramadan . It holds significance as the first mosque built in Islam. It is located in Medina .

mcqs.question_en: According to the teachings of Quran how many witnesses are required for the financial affairs of transaction?
mcqs.question_ur: قرآنی تعلیمات کے مطابق لین دین کے مالی معاملات کے لیے کتنے گواہوں کی ضرورت ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The Quran specifies that for financial transactions, "two men" should serve as witnesses. Alternative option: If two men are not available, the requirement can be fulfilled by "one man and two women".

mcqs.question_en: Which term is used for the longest Ayah (Verse) of the Holy Quran?
mcqs.question_ur: قرآن مجید کی طویل ترین آیت کے لیے کون سی اصطلاح استعمال ہوتی ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Surah Al Baqrah is the longest Surah of Holy Quran. Ayat E Mudayana of Al-Baqara is the longest verse at the longest chapter in Quran.

mcqs.question_en: How many clauses did the treaty of Hudaybiyyah contain?
mcqs.question_ur: صلح حدیبیہ کے معاہدے کی کل کتنی شرائط تھیں ؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Al-Hudaibiyah Treaty was scribed by Ali Al-Murtaza (R.A). The Treaty of Hudaybiyyah was an event that took place during the time of the Islamic prophet Muhammad. It was a pivotal treaty between Muhammad, representing the state of Medina , and the Qurayshi tribe of Mecca Sulah e Hudaibiya is called Fatah Al-Mubeen in Surah Al-Fatah Sulah e Hudaibiya Was Signed In The Year 628/ 6H. Sule e Huabaibiya Was Signed For 10 Years. The Treaty of Hudaybiyyah took place in March 628 Dhu al-Qi’dah 7 clauses did the treaty of Hudaybiyyah contain Hudabia is the name of the tree. Hazrat Muhammad ﷺ , representing the state of Medina Suhail bin Amar signed the Treaty of Hudaibiya on behalf of the Quraish Mecca. ND-21-5-2023

mcqs.question_en: During Ghazwa ____ to Tayammum was revealed?
mcqs.question_ur: غزوہ ____ کے دوران تیمم نازل ہوا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Tayammum is the Islamic act of dry Ritual purification using purified sand or dust The verse of Tayammum (dry ablution) was revealed during Battle of Banu Al-Mustaliq in Al-Ma'idah contains the order of wuzu, Ghusal, and Tayammum Tayammum is valid only for one obligatory Salah Tayammum is obligatory on 4 (AH) while Wazu is obligatory on 5(AH ) ND23-6-2023

mcqs.question_en: When the Holy Quran First Translated into Latin?
mcqs.question_ur: قرآن پاک کا سب سے پہلے لاطینی میں ترجمہ کب ہوا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation In 1143 Robert of Ketton produced the first Latin translation of the Qur'an. This translation, extant in 24 manuscripts while The Holy Quran was first time translated into Urdu: Shah Abdul Qadir and Shah Rafiuddin (Mozah Al-Quran) The Holy Quran was first time translated into Punjabi : Tauqir Amaan Khan The Holy Quran was first time translated into Sindhi : Aakhund Azzizullah The Holy Quran first time translated into English : George Sale Holy Quran was translated for the first time in India Sindhi Holy Quran was translated for the first time in World Persian ND23-6-2023

mcqs.question_en: Najashi became Muslim at the hand of ______?
mcqs.question_ur: نجاشی ______ کے ہاتھ پر مسلمان ہوا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Najashi is also known as Ashama ibn Abjar. He was the King of Abyssinia (modern-day Ethiopia) who became a Muslim at the hands of Hazrat Jafar ibn Abi Talib , a cousin of the Prophet Muhammad (SAW). Hazrat Jafar ibn Abi Talib recited the Quran to Najashi , who was impressed by its beauty and truth, and subsequently accepted Islam .

mcqs.question_en: The cover of the Kaaba is called _____?
mcqs.question_ur: غلاف کعبہ کو _____ کہتے ہیں؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Kiswah is the cloth that covers the Kaaba in Mecca, Saudi Arabia. It is draped annually on the 9th day of the month of Dhu al-Hijjah, the day pilgrims leave for the plains of Mount Arafat during the Hajj. The term kiswah is Arabic for 'pall', the cloth draped over a casket.

mcqs.question_en: When Hazrat Umar conquered Bait Ul Maqdas in ____ A.H.
mcqs.question_ur: جب حضرت عمر رضی اللہ عنہ نے ____ ہجری میں بیت المقدس فتح کیا۔
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Umar ibn Abd al-Aziz, commonly known as Umar II, was the eighth Umayyad caliph Umar ibn Abd al-Aziz called the first Mujaddid and sixth righteous caliph of Islam after Hasan Ibn Ali Umar ibn Abd al-Aziz was Born 2 November 682 in Medina, Umayyad Caliphate Died 5 February 720 (aged 37) Hazrat Umar conquered Bait Ul Maqdas in 16 A.H. ND18-5-2023

mcqs.question_en: Who was the pupil of Hazrat Abu Hurairah (RA)?
mcqs.question_ur: حضرت ابوہریرہ رضی اللہ عنہ کے شاگرد کون تھے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Hazrat Abu Hurairah (RA) was a companion of the Prophet Muhammad (SAW) and a renowned scholar. Among his pupils was Hazrat Hammam ibn Munabbih , who was a well-known scholar and narrator of hadith (Prophetic traditions).

mcqs.question_en: How many Salats were made obligatory during the Mairaj?
mcqs.question_ur: معراج میں کتنی نمازیں فرض ہوئیں؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Five prayers were declared compulsory in the 10th Nabvi Namaz commanded in Quran 700 times. Salat was made compulsory at the event of 27 Rajab ( Miraj ) **** Salat Juma became Farz in Madina. Hajj was made compulsory in the 09th Hijri.

mcqs.question_en: What was the relationship between Imam Bukhari and Imam Hanbal?
mcqs.question_ur: امام بخاری اور امام حنبل کا آپس میں کیا تعلق تھا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Imam Bukhari (810-870 CE) was a renowned Islamic scholar and compiler of the hadith collection " Sahih al-Bukhari ". Imam Ahmad ibn Hanbal (780-855 CE) was a prominent Islamic scholar and founder of the Hanbali school of thought. Imam Bukhari was a student of Imam Ahmad ibn Hanbal. He attended Imam Hanbal's lectures and learned from him. Imam Bukhari is said to have greatly respected Imam Hanbal and considered him as one of his teachers .

mcqs.question_en: حضرت عیسیٰ علیہ السلام کا معجزہ کیا تھا؟
options: کوڑھ میں مبتلا کو ٹھیک کرنا
mcqs.explanation: Explanation حضرت عیسیٰ علیہ السلام کے معجزات میں نابینا کو بینا کرنا، کوڑھ میں مبتلا لوگوں کو ٹھیک کرنا اور مردوں کو زندہ کرنا شامل ہیں۔

mcqs.question_en: ام القریٰ کس شہر کو کہا جاتا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation مکہ مکرمہ کو "ام القریٰ" کہا جاتا ہے کیونکہ یہ دنیا کے سب سے اہم اور مقدس شہروں میں سے ایک ہے اور اسلامی تاریخ کا اہم مرکز ہے۔

mcqs.question_en: حضرت موسیٰ علیہ السلام نے کس امت میں ہونے کی خواہش ظاہر کی؟
options: حضرت محمد صلی اللہ علیہ وسلم امت
mcqs.correct_answer: حضرت محمد صلی اللہ علیہ وسلم امت
mcqs.explanation: Explanation حضرت موسیٰ علیہ السلام نے حضرت محمد صلی اللہ علیہ وسلم کی امت میں ہونے کی خواہش ظاہر کی کیونکہ اس امت کو فضیلت دی گئی۔

mcqs.question_en: Which prophet was a carpenter?

options: See the answer to this question in the explanation section
mcqs.correct_answer: See the answer to this question in the explanation section
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The Prophet Zakariya (peace be upon him) was the patron of Mary He was the trustee of Hekal . He worked as a carpenter and earned his livelihood . The Prophet Zakariya (peace be upon him) kept the torch of Mosaic law burning.

mcqs.question_en: Hajr-e-Aswad is installed on the wall of Kaaba. What is the meaning of Aswad?
mcqs.question_ur: خانہ کعبہ کی دیوار پر حجرِ اسود نصب ہے، اسود کا کیا مطلب ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Aswad means کالا یا سیاہ رنگ کا Hajr-e-Aswad is a rock set into the eastern corner of the Kaaba, the ancient building in the center of the Grand Mosque in Makkah .

mcqs.question_en: Which battle led to the birth of the Khawarij?
mcqs.question_ur: خوارج کی پیدائش کس جنگ سے ہوئی؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The Khawarij sect emerged as a result of the Battle of Siffin ( 657 CE). It was fought between the forces of Caliph Hazrat Ali and those of Muawiyah ibn Abu Sufyan. The battle ended in a stalemate , and the arbitration process that followed led to a group of rebels , who would later become known as the Khawarij , to break away from Hazrat Ali's camp.

mcqs.question_en: What is Jobbery?
options: Conduct of public business for private gain
mcqs.correct_answer: Conduct of public business for private gain
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Jobbery is a noun that refers to the act of using one's public office or position for personal gain or benefit , often through corrupt or unethical means. This can include: Using one's position to secure contracts or business deals for personal benefit Accepting bribes or kickbacks Misusing public funds or resources for personal gain Engaging in nepotism or favoritism

mcqs.question_en: The great book "Al-Itqan fi Uloom al-Quran" was composed by whom?
mcqs.question_ur: عظیم کتاب "الاتقان فی العلوم القرآن" کس کی تالیف ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Al-Itqan fi Uloom al-Quran was composed by Jalal uddin Suyati . He was a scholar and writer . In this book, he explained the revelation time of Surahs and Ayats of the Holy Quran.

mcqs.question_en: Which Prophet of Allah had minimum age?
mcqs.question_ur: اللہ کے کس نبی کی کم سے کم عمر تھی؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Hazrat Easa (AS) was around 33 years old. Hazrat Ibrahim (AS) was around 195 years old. Hazrat Muhammad (SAW) was around 63 years old. Hazrat Musa (AS) was around 125 years old. Hazrat Adam (AS) was around 1000 years old.

mcqs.question_en: Hazrat Ali (R.A) was martyred in which month of Islamic calendar?
mcqs.question_ur: حضرت علی رضی اللہ عنہ کو اسلامی کیلنڈر کے کس مہینے میں شہید کیا گیا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Hazrat Ali (R.A) was attacked with a poisoned sword On 19th Ramazan 40th Hijri , before the time of FAJAR prayers to the mosque of Kufa. He died on the 21st of Ramadan 40 A.H or 28 January 661 CE . He was buried in Najaf al-Ashraf (Iraq). *** ND23-2-2023

mcqs.question_en: Which Muslim Caliph had all his four sons caliph too?
mcqs.question_ur: کس مسلمان خلیفہ کے چاروں بیٹے بھی خلیفہ تھے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Abdul Malik bin Marwan ( 5th Umayyad Caliph) Had 4 sons who became Caliphs: Al-Walid I Sulayman Yazid II Hisham

mcqs.question_en: Among the following Prophets, whose nation was awarded with the Mann-o-Salwa?

mcqs.explanation: Explanation Mann-o-Salwa is a type of food that was gifted to Bani Israel ( people of Prophet Musa A.S ). There were two foods: One was “Mann” and the other was “Salwa”. Mann was a kind of sweet Salwa was a kind of Bird

mcqs.question_en: Name the first foster mother of the Prophet Muhammad (PBUH)?
mcqs.question_ur: نبی کریم صلی اللہ علیہ وسلم کی پہلی رضاعی والدہ کا نام بتائیں؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The first foster mother of Prophet Muhammad (PBUH) was Hazrat Sobia (RA) Hazrat Sobia (RA) was a slave woman of Abu Lahab. She nursed the Prophet (PBUH) after his birth before he was later cared for by Hazrat Haleema (RA).

mcqs.question_en: The Holy Quran contains the Makki and Madni Surah’s. The Madni surah’s have a general emphasis on _____?
mcqs.question_ur: قرآن پاک میں مکی اور مدنی سورتیں ہیں۔  مدنی سورتوں میں _____ پر عام زور ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The Madni Surahs , revealed in Madina , focus on: The social and religious laws Values for the Muslim community Including rules for personal and collective behavior, worship, and relationships. Makki Surahs , revealed in Mecca , focus on: The Oneness of God (Tawheed) The Hereafter (Akhirah) The Prophethood of Muhammad (PBUH) The struggle against polytheism and disbelief The basic principles of faith and morality

mcqs.question_en: How many times the mother of Hazrat Ismail (AS) ran from Hill of Safa and Marwa in search of Water?
mcqs.question_ur: حضرت اسماعیل علیہ السلام کی والدہ کتنی بار صفا و مروہ کی پہاڑی سے پانی کی تلاش میں بھاگی؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Hazrat Hajra, the mother of Hazrat Ismail (AS) , ran between the hills of Safa and Marwa seven times in search of water. This act is commemorated during the Hajj pilgrimage, specifically in the ritual of Sa'i. The running b/w Safa and Marwa seven times is called Sayee.

mcqs.question_en: Abu Ul Bashar Sani is the title of?

mcqs.explanation: Explanation Abu Ul Bashar Sani is the title of Hazrat Nooh (Noah) A.S. Meaning of Title: "Abu Ul Bashar Sani" translates to "The Father of Humanity II,"

mcqs.question_en: خطیب الانبیاء کس کا لقب ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation خطیب الانبیاء کا لقب حضرت شعیب علیہ السلام کو دیا گیا ہے۔ حضرت شعیب علیہ السلام: آپ بنی مدین کی طرف بھیجے گئے نبی تھے۔ پیغام: آپ نے اپنی قوم کو اللہ کی عبادت کرنے، بے انصافی اور دھوکہ دہی سے بچنے کی تلقین کی۔ خطابت کی خصوصیت: آپ کی خطابت کی صلاحیت اور قوت بیان کی وجہ سے آپ کو "خطیب الانبیاء" کا لقب دیا گیا۔ قرآن میں ذکر: آپ کا ذکر مختلف آیات میں کیا گیا ہے، جہاں آپ کے پیغام اور قوم کی طرف آپ کی جدوجہد کو بیان کیا گیا ہے

mcqs.question_en: Name the daughters and sons of Holy Prophet?

mcqs.question_en: Which surah is called “Babul Quran”?
mcqs.question_ur: باب القرآن کس سورت کو کہتے ہیں؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Surah Fatiha (Chapter 1 of the Quran) is often referred to as " Babul Quran ," meaning " The Gate of the Quran " or " The Opening of the Quran ." It is the opening chapter. It is recited in every unit of prayer (rak'ah) in Muslim worship. Surah Fatiha is also known by several other names, including : Umm al-Kitab (Mother of the Book) Umm al-Quran (Mother of the Quran) Al-Sab'a al-Mathani (The Seven Oft-Repeated Verses) Al-Hamd (The Praise) As-Salah (The Prayer) Al-Fatiha al-Khabira (The Great Opening) Al-Fatiha al-'Udhma (The Mighty Opening)

mcqs.question_en: Mujadid Alif Sani belong to _____?
mcqs.question_ur: مجدد الف ثانی کا تعلق کس سے ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Mujadid Alif Sani is the title of Sheikh Ahmad Sirhindi , an Indian Islamic scholar, Hanafi jurist, and member of the Naqshbandī Sufi order. He is known for countering unorthodox Sufism and mystic beliefs , with notable works including Isbat-ul-Nabat and Risal-i-Nabuwat.

mcqs.question_en: Who was the first Muslim Nobel Prize laureate?

mcqs.question_en: Order is the law of civilization as chaos is the law of the ______. The most appropriate word to be filled in is:
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Order is the law of civilization as chaos is the law of the Wilderness. This pairing contrasts the structured nature of civilization with the untamed aspects of the wilderness.

mcqs.question_en: "Seek knowledge even if you have to go to ____."
mcqs.question_ur: "علم حاصل کرو چاہے تمہیں ____ جانا پڑے۔"
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The phrase "Seek knowledge even if you have to go to China " is a famous saying attributed to the Prophet Muhammad (SAW). This saying emphasizes the importance of seeking knowledge and education , even if it requires traveling to distant lands. In this case, China was considered a far-off land , symbolizing the idea that one should be willing to go to great lengths to acquire knowledge.

mcqs.question_en: Which Surah was revealed when the Prophet (PBUH) was taunted for having no son?
mcqs.question_ur: وہ کون سی سورت نازل ہوئی جب نبی کریم صلی اللہ علیہ وسلم کو اولاد نہ ہونے پر طعنہ دیا گیا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Surah Kausar was revealed when the Prophet (PBUH) was taunted for not having a son. It is a message of comfort , promising abundant blessings and countering the taunts of his enemies.

mcqs.question_en: Who was the last Caliph of the Umayyad Dynasty?

mcqs.explanation: Explanation Marwān II was the last Umayyad caliph, ruling from 744 until he died in 750

mcqs.question_en: What happened on 27 Rajab?  MARKS 2

mcqs.question_en: Who is Abdullah ibne saba?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Abd Allah ibn Saba was a Yemenite Jew from the Arab Himyar tribe who converted to Islam during Uthman's reign

mcqs.question_en: _____ is called Sayeed-ul-Ayam?
mcqs.question_ur: سید الایام کہلاتا ھے؟ _____
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Friday is considered a sacred day in Islam. It is often referred to as " Sayeed-ul-Ayam ". It means " the master/king of days ". This is because Friday is considered a day of gathering , worship, and spiritual renewal for Muslims. It is marked by the congregational prayer ( Jumu'ah ) in mosques.

mcqs.question_en: Al-Azhar Mosque was completed in which year?
mcqs.question_ur: مسجد الازہر کس سال مکمل ہوئی؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Al-Azhar Mosque is located in Cairo , Egypt. It was completed in 972 AD during the Fatimid dynasty. It is one of the oldest and most important mosques in the Islamic world. It is considered a center of Islamic learning and culture .

mcqs.question_en: What is the real meaning of Qiyas?
mcqs.question_ur: قیاس کا اصل معنی کیا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Qiyas (قياس) is an Arabic term that refers to the process of analogical reasoning or deduction in Islamic jurisprudence (fiqh). It involves judging a particular case or situation by comparing it to a similar case or principle established in the Quran or Hadith , and applying the same ruling or principle to the new case.

mcqs.question_en: The portion of the wall of Kaba which is between its door and Hajr-e-Aswad is called ____?
mcqs.question_ur: خانہ کعبہ کی دیوار کا وہ حصہ جو اس کے دروازے اور حجر اسود کے درمیان ہے ____ کہلاتا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Multazam is basically an area which is bordered by Hajr-e-Aswad on one side and the door of Kaaba on the other. Multazim is a part of Holy Kaaba

mcqs.question_en: Which tribe was from the generation of Hazrat Ismaeel (A.S.)?
mcqs.question_ur: حضرت اسماعیل علیہ السلام کی نسل سے کون سا قبیلہ تھا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The Banu Quraysh tribe , which is the tribe of the Prophet Muhammad (PBUH), is indeed descended from Hazrat Ismaeel (A.S.). Hazrat Ismail (AS) is called 'Zabeeh Ullah' (Zabiullah). Hazrat Ismail (A.S) was Son of Hazrat Ibrahim (A.S) & Hazrat Hajra (A.S). Prophet Ismail (AS) and Prophet Ishaq (AS) are Brothers.

mcqs.question_en: The father's name of Hazrat Yaqoob (A.S.)?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Yaqub was also known as Israel . He is the son of Ishaq (father) and Rafqa (mother)‎ He was the grandson of Hazrat Ibrahim A.S. Hazrat Ishaq was the younger brother of Hazrat Ismail A.S He has 12 Childre n including Yusuf and Binyamin His name mentioned 16 times in the Quran He was born in Palestine , He met his son Hazrat Yousaf (AS) after a period of 40 years The Holy Qur'an has mentioned his story in a beautiful chapter entitled " Surah Yusuf".

mcqs.question_en: How many Ansaar from Madina embraced Islam in 11th Nabvi year?
mcqs.question_ur: گیارہویں نبوی میں مدینہ کے کتنے انصار نے اسلام قبول کیا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Six Ansaar from Madina embraced Islam in the 11th year of Nabvi during the Prophet Muhammad's (PBUH) time. They were among the first people from Madina to accept Islam and helped pave the way for the spread of Islam in the city. Hazrat Suwaid bin Samit R.A was the first person from Madina to accept Islam .

mcqs.question_en: While reciting Kalima Shahadat, a Muslim takes oath that _____?
mcqs.question_ur: کلمہ شہادت پڑھتے ہوئے مسلمان قسم کھاتا ہے کہ _____؟
options: There is no god but Allah, and Muhammad (PBUH) is His Messenger
Allah is the creator of the universe
The Quran is the final revelation
mcqs.correct_answer: There is no god but Allah, and Muhammad (PBUH) is His Messenger
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Reciting the Kalima Shahadat , also known as the Shahada, a Muslim declares: " La ilaha illallah, Muhammadur rasulullah " Which translates to: " There is no god but Allah, and Muhammad (PBUH) is His Messenger " This declaration affirms the fundamental belief in Islam, affirming the oneness of Allah (Tawhid) and accepting Muhammad (PBUH) as the final Prophet and messenger of Allah.

mcqs.question_en: Mention the category in which human beings will be divided on the Day of Judgement?
mcqs.question_ur: قیامت کے دن انسانوں کو کس زمرے میں تقسیم کیا جائے گا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation On the Day of Judgment , humanity will be divided into three main categories: The Believers (Al-Mu'minun): Those who believed in Allah and lived righteously. The Disbelievers (Al-Kafirun): Those who rejected Allah and His teachings. The Hypocrites (Al-Munafiqun): Those who pretended to be Muslims but lacked true faith. Each group's fate will be determined, with the Believers entering Paradise , the Disbelievers in Hell , and the Hypocrites facing severe punishment .

mcqs.question_en: Name the person who shall step into Jannat first of all?
mcqs.question_ur: سب سے پہلے جنت میں قدم رکھنے والے شخص کا نام بتائیں؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation According to Islamic belief, the Holy Prophet Muhammad (PBUH) will be the first person to enter Jannat (Paradise) on the Day of Judgment . This is based on various hadiths (sayings) of the Prophet Muhammad (PBUH), which state that he will be the first to enter Paradise. This followed by his companions and other righteous believers.

mcqs.question_en: At what occasion all the six kalimahs are recited by the Muslims?
mcqs.question_ur: مسلمان تمام چھ کلمے کس موقع پر پڑھتے ہیں؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The Six Kalimas are broadly speaking taken from hadiths , now not from the Qur'an. The Six Kalimahs (from Arabic كلمة‎ kalimah "word") in Islam in South Asia are six significant elements of 1's non secular perception, typically taken from hadiths (in some traditions, six phrases, then called the six kalimas). six kalimas are recited in Nikah

mcqs.explanation: Explanation Azab of Mosquitoes was sent to the nation of Hazrat Ibrahim (AS).

mcqs.question_en: Where is Shaikh Abdul Qadir Jilani buried?
mcqs.question_ur: شیخ عبدالقادر جیلانی کہاں مدفون ہیں؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Shaikh Abdul Qadir Jilani known as Muḥyī l-Dīn Abū Muḥammad Shaikh Abdul Qadir Jilani Born: March 23, 1078, Gilan Province, Iran Shaikh Abdul Qadir Jilani Died: February 1166, Baghdad, Iraq Shaikh Abdul Qadir Jilani Place of burial: The Holy Shrine Of Shekh Abdul Qadir Gilani, Baghdad, Iraq.

mcqs.question_en: "And you see that people are entering Allah's religion in crowds" the following verse in the part of which surah?
mcqs.question_ur: اور تم دیکھ رہے ہو کہ لوگ ہجوم کے ساتھ اللہ کے دین میں داخل ہو رہے ہیں۔ درج ذیل آیت کس سورت کے حصے میں ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The verse "And you see that people are entering Allah's religion in crowds" is from Surah Al-Nasr (Chapter 110 , Verse 2 ). This surah is the 110th chapter of the Quran and has only 3 verses . It is a short surah that discusses the victory of Islam and the large numbers of people embracing the faith. Surah Al-Nasr is also known as the " Surah of Victory " or " Surah of Help ". It is often recited as a du'a (supplication) for guidance and support.

mcqs.question_en: During drought, which Namaz is performed?
mcqs.question_ur: خشک سالی میں کون سی نماز پڑھی جاتی ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Salat ul istasqa is a prayer to ask God for rain . It consists of two Rakat. Salatul-Istisqaa is no Adhan or Iqamah – only recitation of the Quran in both rakats out loud. Al-Istisqa'means seek water (rain) from Alla during times of low rainfall. ***** while Namaz-e-Khasoof ( نماز خسوف) is offered at the time of Lunar eclipse Namaz-e-Kasoof (نماز کسوف) is offered at the time of Solar eclipse *** ND27-12-2022 ND03-12-2022 ND22-6-2023

mcqs.question_en: In which parah do we find Surah Al-Noor?
mcqs.question_ur: سورۃ النور ہمیں کس پارہ میں ملتی ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Surah Al-Noor is found in the 18th Parah (Juz) of the Quran. It has 64 verses . It is divided into 9 Rukus . It focusing on social laws and morality .

mcqs.question_en: انتہا پسندی کے خاتمے کے لیے تعلیم کی کیا اہمیت ہے؟
mcqs.explanation:
Explanation سوال 1: انتہا پسندی کے خاتمے کے
لیے تعلیم کی کیا اہمیت ہے؟ تعلیم انتہا پسندی کے خاتمے میں
کلیدی کردار ادا کرتی ہے۔ جب لوگوں کو معیاری اور بامعنی تعلیم ملتی ہے، تو وہ
فرقہ واریت، شدت پسندی، اور منفی نظریات سے آگاہ ہوتے ہیں۔ تعلیم فرد کو تنقیدی
سوچ کی صلاحیت فراہم کرتی ہے، جو انتہا پسندانہ نظریات کی مخالفت میں مددگار ثابت
ہوتی ہے۔ تعلیم سے عوام میں تنگ نظری کی بجائے تنوع کی قبولیت کی طرف رجحان بڑھتا
ہے اور سماجی ہم آہنگی میں اضافہ ہوتا ہے۔

mcqs.question_en: What is the meaning of Al Hadi mentioned in the Holy Quran?
mcqs.question_ur: قرآن پاک میں الہادی کا کیا مطلب ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation In the Holy Quran, " Al-Hadi " means "The Guide or The Way ." It refers to Allah as the one who guides humanity to the right path and truth.

mcqs.question_en: Who was the leader/spokesman of second migration to Habsha during Prophet's (SAW) stay in Makkah?
mcqs.question_ur: مکہ میں رسول اللہ (ص) کے قیام کے دوران حبشہ کی طرف دوسری ہجرت کا رہنما/ ترجمان کون تھا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Jaafer ibn Abi Talib led the second migration to Habsha (Abyssinia). He acted as the spokesman when the Muslim refugees were questioned by the king, Najashi . In Surah, Anfal mentions the migration of the Holy Prophet The first migration to Habshah (Abyssinia) took place in 613 A.D The relatives of Prophet Muhammad (PBUH) in the first migration to Abyssinia were Usman Ghani (R.A) and Ruqaiyah (R.A) There were 12 men and 4 women in the first migration to Abyssinia ************* The second migration to Habshah took place in 616 A.D The group of emigrants' second  migrations time comprised 83 men and 18 to 19 women ND5-2-2023

mcqs.explanation: Explanation Zuhar , one of the five daily prayers in Islam. It is preceded by the Azaan , which is the call to prayer.

mcqs.question_en: From which matter, Allah created the first human being?
mcqs.question_ur: اللہ نے سب سے پہلے انسان کو کس چیز سے پیدا کیا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Allah created the first human being, Adam , from clay . In Surah Al-Hijr (15:26) , it says: "And We did certainly create man out of clay from an altered black mud ."

mcqs.question_en: Sir Creek is located between ______?
mcqs.question_ur: سر کریک کس کے درمیان واقع ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Sir Creek is located between Pakistan & India *** Sir Creek is located along the southeastern border of the Sindh province of Pakistan and the western border of the Gujarat province in India. This area is called the Greater Rann of Kutch, a marshland situated along the Arabian Sea. *** Sir Creek is important to Pakistan because: It is environmentally important to prevent coastal wetlands from degradation About 90 km2 of the lake comes under Pakistan, whilst the majority of the lake i.e. 210 km2, lies within India .

mcqs.question_en: The word 'Wahi' is derived from the word 'Waha' which means?
mcqs.question_ur: لفظ 'وہی' لفظ 'وہا' سے ماخوذ ہے جس کے معنی ہیں؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The word " Wahi " is derived from the Arabic word " Waha ". It means to convey a message secretly or to give an inspiration quietly and subtly . The literal meaning of "Wahi" is: Allah's Message 2 kinds of Wahi are there 1 Wahee-e-Matlu: It means the revelation which God has transmitted in His own words and speech 2 Wahee-e-Ghair Matlu: It is the revelation that Allah projected in the heart of the Holy Prophet.

Abu Ayyub al-Ansari أبو أيوب الأنصاري The patronym Abu Ayyub, means father (abu) of Ayyub. Abu Ayyub died of illness during the First Arab Siege of Constantinople. mcqs.question_ur: حضور نبی اکرم صلی اللہ علیہ وآلہ وسلم کے سامنے وہ عمل یا قول جس پر حضور صلی اللہ علیہ وآلہ وسلم نے خاموشی اختیار کی اسے کیا کہتے ہیں؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Taqreer refers to the Holy Prophet's (SAW) silent approval or consent to a statement or action. Hadith is the Saying (قول), Action (عمل), and Taqrer (تقرير)  of Prophet Mohammad (SAW). There are three types of Ahaddis: Saying Action Taqreer

mcqs.question_en: Who was the first male martyr( Shaheed) of Islam?
mcqs.question_ur: اسلام کے پہلے مرد شہید کون تھے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Hazrat Haris bin Halla (RA) is the first male martyr (Shaheed) of Islam . Sumayyah became the first ever shaheed, the first martyr in Islam. mcqs.question_en: Which child of Hazrat Muhammad (S.A.W) passed away first?
mcqs.question_ur: حضرت محمد صلی اللہ علیہ وسلم کا کون سا بچہ سب سے پہلے فوت ہوا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Hazrat Qasim was the first (elder) son of Hazrat Muhammad ﷺ and Hazrat Khadijah He died at the age of only 3 and was buried in Jannat al Mualla in Makkah. Hazrat Abdullah 7. Hazrat Ibrahim All of his children were born to Hazrat Khadijah (RA) except one son Ibrahim , who was born to Hazrat Maria al-Qibtiyah (RA).

mcqs.question_en: The real name of Umm-ul-Momineen “Bibi Umm-e-Habiba” is _____?

mcqs.question_en: When Hazrat Umar (R.A) assumed the caliphate?
mcqs.question_ur: حضرت عمر رضی اللہ عنہ نے کب خلافت سنبھالی؟

mcqs.question_en: Which caliph of the Muslims ordered the compilation of Ahadith and send to the conquered territories?
mcqs.question_ur: احادیث کی تالیف اور مفتوحہ علاقوں میں بھیجنے کا حکم کس نے دیا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Umar ibn Abd al-Aziz , was the eighth Umayyad caliph. mcqs.question_en: Who was the leader of Muslim in the Battle of Badr (Jang-e-Qasiyah)?
mcqs.question_ur: جنگ بدر میں مسلمانوں کا سردار کون تھا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The leader of the Muslims in the Battle of Badr was Prophet Muhammad (PBUH).
