mcqs.question_en: Which sin will not be forgiven by Allah?
mcqs.question_ur: کون سا گناہ اللہ معاف نہیں کرے گا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation شرک تمام گناہوں میں سب سے گھناؤنا اور سب سے کبیرہ گناہ ہے

mcqs.question_en: World's first 3D-printed mosque has been unveiled in which country?
mcqs.question_ur: دنیا کی پہلی تھری ڈی پرنٹ شدہ مسجد کی نقاب کشائی کس ملک میں ہوئی؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation World's First-Ever 3D Printed Mosque Opened in Saudi Arabia. The Kingdom of Saudi Arabia is now home to the world's first 3D-printed mosque, spanning an area of 5,600 sqm. World's first 3D-printed mosque has been unveiled in Jeddah in 2024 . ****

mcqs.question_en: What does the term "Hypocrite" refer to?
mcqs.question_ur: اصطلاح "منافق" سے کیا مراد ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation A hypocrite is someone who presents a false appearance of being virtuous or loyal. But actually harbors different intentions or beliefs.

mcqs.question_en: Who among the followings performed first ever Hajj?
mcqs.question_ur: درج ذیل میں سے سب سے پہلے حج کس نے کیا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Hazrat Adam (A.S) and Hazrat Hawa (A.S) performed first ever Hajj. لیکن کچھ جگہ پر حضرت ابراہیم کا بھی آیا ہے۔ درست جواب حضرت آدم ہی ہے

mcqs.question_en: In Holy Torat which name Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) Mentioned:
mcqs.question_ur: تورات مقدس میں  رسول اللہ صلی اللہ علیہ وسلم نے . . . کا ذکر کیا ہے
mcqs.explanation: Explanation In the Holy Torah (Torat), Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) is referred to by the name " Ahmad " Torah and the Zabur were revealed in Hebrew. The name “ Muhammad ”, is four times mentioned in the whole Quran. 1. Surah ali-Imran: ayat 144. 2. Surah al-Ahzab: ayat 40. 3. Surah Muhammad: ayat 2. 4. Surah al-Fath: ayat 29. The name “ Ahme d ”, is one time mentioned in the whole Quran s-Saff: Ayat 6.

mcqs.question_en: Which one was in practice on the previous Prophets followers before Islam?
mcqs.question_ur: اسلام سے پہلے سابقہ ​​انبیاء پر کون سا عمل رائج تھا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Salat (prayer) was in practice among the followers of previous prophets before Islam. Regular prayer was a common element of worship in the monotheistic traditions of earlier prophets.

mcqs.question_en: Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal was born in ______?
mcqs.question_ur: امام احمد بن حنبل کی ولادت کس سن میں ہوئی؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal was born in 164 A.H in Baghdad. He passed away in 241 A.H . He was a notable Islamic scholar . He was the founder of the Hanbali school of jurisprudence , having studied under Imam Shafi'i.

mcqs.question_en: From which country did the famous companion Hazrat Sohaib bin Sinan Rumi (RA) belong?
mcqs.question_ur: مشہور صحابی حضرت صہیب بن سنان رومی رضی اللہ عنہ کا تعلق کس ملک سے تھا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Hazrat Sohaib bin Sinan Rumi (RA) belonged to Rome . He was born around 592 CE in Mosul, Mesopotamia. He was died around 659 CE in Medina. Despite his Roman origins , he was of Arab ethnicity. He is buried in Jannat al-Baqi' , Hejaz (modern-day Saudi Arabia).

mcqs.question_en: Who performed the Nikah khutba (marriage sermon) of Hazrat Muhammad SAW and Hazrat Khadija RA?
mcqs.question_ur: Hazrat Khadija RA? Hazrat Abu Talib (RA), Varqa bin Nophel, Hazrat Umar (RA), None
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The Nikah khutba (marriage sermon) of Hazrat Muhammad SAW and Hazrat Khadija RA was performed by Hazrat Abu Talib (RA) . He was the uncle of the Prophet Muhammad SAW. He was acted as the guardian during the marriage.

mcqs.question_en: What was the name of the king of Abyssinia?
mcqs.question_ur: حبشہ کے بادشاہ کا نام کیا تھا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The king of Abyssinia (modern-day Ethiopia) was Najashi . He is noted for his favorable reception of early Muslim refugees during the time of the Prophet Muhammad SAW.

mcqs.question_en: Name the Uncle of the Holy Prophet (PBUH) who was martyred in the battle of Uhud?
mcqs.question_ur: جنگ احد میں شہید ہونے والے حضور صلی اللہ علیہ وسلم کے چچا کا نام بتائیں؟
mcqs.explanation:
Explanation Uncle of the Holy Prophet (PBUH) named Hazrat Hamza (RA) was martyred in the battle of Uhad . Abyssinian slave Wahshi ibn Harb martyred Hazrzat Hamza
bin Abdul Mutalib (RA) Hazrat Hamza Died: on 22 March 625; Mount Uhud , Medina,
Arabia Additional info Battle of Uhad was fought in third Hijra in the month of Shawal . ****

mcqs.question_en: To whom Hazrat Khadija (R.A) took to the Holy Prophet (SAW) after discussing firstly about the prophethood?
mcqs.question_ur: نبوت کے بارے میں سب سے پہلے بات کرنے کے بعد حضرت خدیجہ رضی اللہ عنہا حضور صلی اللہ علیہ وسلم کے پاس کس کے پاس گئیں؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Khadija (R.A) took the Holy Prophet (SAW) to Warqa bin Nofal after discussing firstly about the prophethood. Waraqah ibn Nawfal was the cousin Uncle of Hazrat Khadija (RA). Hazrat Khadija (RA) took him to Waraqah bin Naufal who was a Christian convert and used to read the Gospel in Arabic. Khadija (RA) was the first wife of the Holy Prophet (PBHU). Additional Info Prophethood has been finished on the Prophet Hazrat Muhammad (PBUH) The Prophethood is belief in All the Prophets of Allah. Prophethood is attained by Bestowed by Allah ***

mcqs.question_en: How many days Hazrat Muhammad PBUH stayed during Tabook Battle?
mcqs.question_ur: جنگ تبوک میں حضرت محمد صلی اللہ علیہ وسلم نے کتنے دن قیام کیا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The Battle of Tabuk , the last major expedition of the Prophet Muhammad (PBUH). It was fought against the Romans in 9 Hijri (630 AD). It took place in the region of Tabuk during Rajab and Sha'ban. The Prophet Muhammad (PBUH) stayed there for 20 days.

mcqs.question_en: Which surah is called "Al-Hamd'?
mcqs.question_ur: الحمد کس سورت کو کہتے ہیں؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Surah Al-Fatiha is also known as Al-Hamd (The Praise). It has 7 verses, 29 words, and 139 letters. It is also referred to as: As-Salah (The Prayer) Umm al-Kitab (Mother of the Book) Umm al-Quran (Mother of the Quran) Sab'a min al-Mathani (Seven Repeated Ones) Ash-Shifa' (The Cure).

mcqs.question_en: Hazrat Umar (RA) was Caliph for______years.
mcqs.question_ur: حضرت عمر رضی اللہ عنہ کتنے سال خلیفہ رہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Hazrat Umar ibn al-Khattab was the second caliph of Islam. He was ruled for 10 years from 634 CE to 644 CE. He succeeded Hazrat Abu Bakr. He was instrumental in expanding the Islamic state.

mcqs.question_en: اشاروں کنایوں  کے الفاظ سے جو طلاق دی جائے کہلا تی ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation اشاروں اور کنایات کے الفاظ سے دی جانے والی طلاق کو "طلاق کنائی" یا "طلاق بائن" کہا جاتا ہے۔ طلاق بائن وہ طلاق ہے جو کسی بھی دوبارہ رجوع (تعلق بحال) کے بغیر ایک بار دی جائے۔ طلاق کنائی میں شوہر ایسے الفاظ استعمال کرتا ہے جو براہ راست طلاق کا اعلان نہیں کرتے، بلکہ اشارہ یا کنایہ ہوتا ہے کہ تعلق ختم ہو چکا ہے۔ طلاق بائن کی اقسام طلاق بائن صغری: جب شوہر پہلی یا دوسری بار طلاق دیتا ہے اور اس کے بعد عدت گزر جاتی ہے، تو یہ طلاق بائن صغری کہلاتی ہے۔ طلاق بائن کبری: جب شوہر تیسری بار طلاق دیتا ہے، تو یہ طلاق بائن کبری کہلاتی ہے اور اس کے بعد شوہر اور بیوی کے درمیان دوبارہ نکاح ممکن نہیں ہوتا جب تک کہ بیوی کسی اور سے نکاح نہ کرے۔ مثالیں: "تم آزاد ہو" "اب ہم الگ ہو چکے ہیں" "تم میرے لیے نہیں ہو"

mcqs.question_en: پہلا جنگی بحری بیڑا کس نے تیار کیا تھا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation حضرت عثمان بن عفان نے اسلامی سلطنت میں پہلا جنگی بحری بیڑا تیار کیا۔ یہ بیڑا 29 ہجری میں تیار کیا گیا تھا اور اس کا مقصد بحری جنگی کی صلاحیت کو بہتر بنانا تھا۔

mcqs.question_en: تالمود کس مزہب کی کتاب ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation تالمود یہودیت کی مقدس کتاب ہے۔ یہ کتاب یسراٰئیلی (یہودی) قوانین، روایات، اور فلسفے کا مجموعہ ہے۔ تالمود دو بنیادی حصوں پر مشتمل ہے میشنا : یہ حصہ ابتدائی یہودی قوانین اور احکام پر مشتمل ہے، جو پہلے صدیوں میں تحریر کیے گئے۔ گیمارا : یہ حصہ مشنا کی تشریحات اور تبصرے پر مشتمل ہے، جو بعد کے صدیوں میں تحریر کیا گیا۔

mcqs.question_en: Where the torait was revealed on Hazrat Musa (AS)?
mcqs.question_ur: حضرت موسیٰ علیہ السلام پر توریت کہاں نازل ہوئی؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The Torah was revealed to Hazrat Musa (AS) at Koh-e-Toor (Mount Sinai). It comprises the five books of Musa. It known in Hebrew as Chameesha Choomshey Torah. The word 'Torait' appears 18 times in the Quran. Hazrat Musa's name is mentioned 136 times. The four Holy Books are the : Torah (Musa) Zabur (Dawud) Injil (Isa) Quran (Muhammad).

mcqs.question_en: Who among the companion (Sahaba) listened to the whole of the Quran from the Prophet Muhammad (SAW)?
mcqs.question_ur: صحابی (صحابہ) میں سے کس نے رسول اللہ صلی اللہ علیہ وسلم سے پورا قرآن سنا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Abdullah bin Masud was the companion who listened to the entire Quran from Prophet Muhammad (SAW). He was a renowned scholar and memorizer of the Quran among the Sahaba.

mcqs.question_en: The place chosen to sacrifice Hazrat Ismail (AS) was ____?
mcqs.question_ur: حضرت اسمٰعیل علیہ السلام کی قربانی کے لیے کون سا مقام منتخب کیا گیا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The place chosen to sacrifice Hazrat Ismail (AS) was Mina . This site, near Mecca, is integral to the Hajj rituals. Allah (SWT) provided a ram to be sacrificed instead of Ismail (AS).

mcqs.question_en: Which prophet was tilted as 'Zabeeh Ullah' (Zabiullah)?
mcqs.question_ur: کس نبی کو ذبیح اللہ کہا جاتا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Hazrat Ismail (AS) is called 'Zabeeh Ullah' (Zabiullah). Hazrat Ismail (A.S) was Son of Hazrat Ibrahim (A.S) & Hazrat Hajra (A.S). Prophet Ismail (AS) and Prophet Ishaq (AS) are Brothers.

mcqs.question_en: Aitekaaf (Seclusion) during the month of Ramzan is ____?
mcqs.question_ur: رمضان کے مہینے میں اعتکاف ___ ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Aitekaaf (seclusion) during Ramadan is considered Sunnah Muakkadah , an emphasized Sunnah . While not obligatory for every Muslim. It is highly recommended and carries significant spiritual benefits.

mcqs.question_en: Which article of the constitution of 1973 is related to the affairs of Zakat?
mcqs.question_ur: سن 1973 کے آئین کا کون سا آرٹیکل زکوٰۃ کے معاملات سے متعلق ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Article 31 of the 1973 Constitution of Pakistan deals with Zakat. It establishing a system to support the welfare of the needy.

mcqs.question_en: Hijri calendar was started in :
mcqs.question_ur: ہجری کیلنڈر کا آغاز .... میں ہوا
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The Hijri calendar was started in 622AD Islamic Calendar starts from Hijri Islamic calendar officially established by: Hazrat Umar (R.A) ibn al-Khattab. The Prophet's migration or hijra in 622AD marks the beginning of the Hijri year calendar and gives the calendar its name. The Islamic calendar is based on 12 luna r months یہ سوال ضرور پڑھیں Current Hijri Year is ______?

mcqs.question_en: When the battle of Trench was fought?
mcqs.question_ur: خندق کی جنگ کب لڑی گئی؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The battle of Trench was fought in fifth Hijr i The Battle of the Trench, also known as the Battle of Khandaq and the Battle of the Confederates. It is 27-day -long defense . Muslims of Yathrib from Arab and Jewish tribes.

mcqs.question_en: Jizya means _____?
mcqs.question_ur: جزیہ کا مطلب کیا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Jizya is a poll tax historically imposed on non-Muslims in Muslim states. In India , Qutb-ud-din Aibak was the first to impose Jizya. The tax was abolished by Mughal ruler Akbar in the 16th century but reintroduced by Aurangzeb in the 17th century. Kharaj was a land tax imposed on non-Muslim cultivators and landlords.

mcqs.question_en: المساکین کس ام المومنین کا لقب ہے ؟
options: حضرت زینب بنت خزیمہ رضی اللہ عنہا
mcqs.correct_answer: حضرت زینب بنت خزیمہ رضی اللہ عنہا
mcqs.explanation: Explanation ام المساکین حضرت زینب بنت خزیمہ رضی اللہ عنہا کا لقب ہے ۔ ان کا یہ لقب ان کی سخاوت اور غریبوں اور مسکینوں کی مدد کی وجہ سے مشہور ہوا حضرت زینب بنت خزیمہ رضی اللہ عنہا کو "ام المساکین" کا لقب ان کے زمانے کے لوگوں نے دیا تھا۔

mcqs.question_en: On 1st Shawwal, 8th Hijra a strong Islamic force approached the valley of Hunain?
mcqs.question_ur: یکم شوال، 8 ہجری کو ایک مضبوط اسلامی فوج وادی حنین کے قریب کتنے مسلمانوں کے ساتھ پہنچی؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation On 1st Shawwal, 8th Hijra (630 CE) , a force of 12,000 Muslims approached the valley of Hunain. The Battle of Hunain, fought near al-Ta'if. The Battle of Hunain resulted in a Muslim victory over the Bedouin tribes.

mcqs.question_en: Which companion of the Holy Prophet is known as Tarjuman-ul-Quran?
mcqs.question_ur: حضور ﷺ کے کس صحابی کو ترجمان القرآن کہا جاتا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Hazrat Abdullah bin Abbas , the cousin of the Holy Prophet (P.B.U.H). He is known as Tarjuman-ul-Quran ( "Interpreter of the Quran "). He is regarded as the greatest mufassir (interpreter) of the Quran.

mcqs.question_en: In which year did Hazrat Umar (R.A) embrace Islam?
mcqs.question_ur: حضرت عمر رضی اللہ عنہ نے کس سال اسلام قبول کیا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Umar ibn al-Khattab was the second Rashidun caliph. He was ruling from August 634 until his assassination in 644. He was born in 584 AD. He was the father-in-law of the Prophet Muhammad SAW. He was the first Muslim to openly pray at the Kaaba. He participated in nearly all battles. He embraced Islam in 616 AD (6th Nabvi) at about 32 years old, after hearing verses from Surah Taha.

mcqs.question_en: The nation of _______ was exterminated through the scourge of floods.
mcqs.question_ur: کی قوم سیلاب کی لعنت سے ختم ہو گئی۔ _____
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The nation of Hazrat Nooh (A.S) was exterminated through the scourge of floods. The flood is also known as Tofaan-e-Noah. It was a divine punishment for their disbelief and corruption. The duration of the Toofan-e-Noah (Flood of Noah) was around 6 months. The event occurred 2,242 years after Hazrat Adam (AS). About 80 people were with him in the boat. The boat of Hazrat Noah (A.S) is referred to as the Ark. Hazrat Noah (A.S) and those with him remained in the Ark for about six months. After the floodwaters receded , the Ark is believed to have come to rest on Mount Judi in Turkey. The nation of Noah worshiped five idols: Wadh Suwa Yaghuth Yauq Nas Hazrat Noah (AS) lived for 950 years. He was sent to Iraq . He is called the predecessor , Naji Ullah, and Shaikh ul Ambiya. His title is Abu ul Bashr Sani. After the flood, the city of Khasran was established.

mcqs.question_en: Who made Soap for the first time?
mcqs.question_ur: پہلی بار صابن کس نے بنایا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Hazrat Saleh invented Soap . Hazrat Saleh was a prophet of the nation Samood. Hazrat Saleh is buried in Lebonan .

mcqs.question_en: Nation of Hazrat Noah (AS) worshiped ___ idols.
mcqs.question_ur: حضرت نوح کی قوم کتنے بتوں کی عبادت کیا کرتی تھی؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The nation of Noah worshiped five idols: Wadh Suwa Yaghuth Yauq Nas The duration of the Toofan-e-Noah (Flood of Noah) was around 6 months. The event occurred 2,242 years after Hazrat Adam (AS). About 80 people were with him in the boat. Hazrat Noah (AS) lived for 950 years. He was sent to Iraq . He is called the predecessor , Naji Ullah, and Shaikh ul Ambiya. His title is Abu ul Bashr Sani. After the flood, the city of Khasran was established.

mcqs.question_en: Adam is a word of which language?
mcqs.question_ur: آدم کس زبان کا لفظ ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The height of Hazrat Adam (AS) was 90 feet. Adam is a word of Herbew language. Hebrew is official language in Israel. He was the first Muslim , as the Quran states that all the Prophets preached the same faith of Islam. Known for being the first human being. His spouse was Hawwā (حواء). Hazrat Adam (AS) was 130 years old when Shees (AS) was born. He spoke the language in the Garden of Eden. His total age was 930 years. Hazrat Adam (AS) met with the Holy Prophet ﷺ on the 1st heaven. He had 3 sons. His grave is located in Sri Lanka.

mcqs.question_en: The Grand Mosque at Damascus is located in ____?
mcqs.question_ur: دمشق کی عظیم الشان مسجد  کہاں واقع ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The Great Mosque of Damascus is also known as the Umayyad Mosque . It was built by the Umayyad Caliph al-Walīd I between 705 and 715 CE. It is located in the old city of Damascus. It is the capital of Syria. It is one of the largest and oldest mosques in the world. The mosque opened in 715 AD.

mcqs.question_en: Ayat-ul-Kursi is verse number in Surah Baqrah is _____?
mcqs.question_ur: آیات الکرسی سورہ بقرہ کی آیت نمبر _____ ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Ayatul Kursi is the 255th verse of the 2nd surah of the Quran , Al-Baqarah . It is located in the third para named "تِلْكَ ٱلْرُّسُلُ." It is also known as Sardar ul Ayat or The Throne Verse. Surah Al-Baqarah is the longest Surah of the Qur'an. It revealed after the Prophet ﷺ migrated to Madinah.

mcqs.question_en: Which one out of the following is a renowned biographer of the Holy Prophet (PBUH)?
mcqs.question_ur: مندرجہ ذیل میں سے کون سیرت نبوی صلی اللہ علیہ وسلم کا نامور مصنف ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Michael H. Hart , renowned for his biography of the Holy Prophet (PBUH). He authored " The 100: A Ranking of the Most Influential Persons in History ," first published in 1978. In this book, Muhammad (PBUH) was ranked as the most influential person in history, ahead of Jesus or Moses. The book has two editions : the first in 1978 and the second in 1992.

mcqs.question_en: How many vowels does Arabic Language have?
mcqs.question_ur: عربی زبان میں کتنے حرف ہوتے ہیں؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The Arabic language has three vowels : /a/, /i/, and /u/. These vowels, which can be short or long , affect the pronunciation and meaning of words. Vowels were inserted in the Quran in 43 Hijri.

mcqs.question_en: Hazrat Haroon (A.S) met with Holy Prophet ﷺ on the ______ heaven?
mcqs.question_ur: حضرت ہارون علیہ السلام آسمان پر حضور صلی اللہ علیہ وسلم کے ساتھ؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Who met with Holy Prophet PBUH on the Haven? 1 st Heaven met Adam (AS) 2 nd Heaven met Isa (AS) and Yahya (AS) 3 rd Heaven met Yusuf (AS) 4 th Heaven met Idris (AS) 5 th Heaven met Haroon (AS) 6 th Heaven met Musa (AS) 7 th Heaven met Ibrahim (AS) Hazrat Musa (Kaleemullah) and Hazrat Haroon (A.S) were brothers and prophets of God. Hazrat Musa (A.S) is buried in Ohud, KSA. Hazrat Haroon (A.S) is buried in Jordan. Hazrat Haroon (A.S) met the Holy Prophet ﷺ on the 5th heaven. Zubaida, wife of Haroon ur Rasheed. She was the mother of Al-Ameen and Al-Haroon.

mcqs.question_en: Fulfillment of valid needs causes ____?
mcqs.question_ur: جائز ضروریات کی تکمیل ____ کا سبب بنتی ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation "Fulfillment of valid needs causes satisfaction ." Meeting genuine needs leads to a sense of contentment and well-being.

mcqs.question_en: You are in the parking lot of a grocery store. You notice a couple loading their groceries into their car. You see them getting into their car, leaving a bottle of 10 liters of cooking oil on the bottom of the trolley. What will you do?
mcqs.question_ur: آپ گروسری اسٹور کی پارکنگ میں ہیں۔  آپ نے دیکھا کہ ایک جوڑے اپنی کار میں گروسری لوڈ کر رہے ہیں۔  آپ انہیں اپنی گاڑی میں سوار ہوتے ہوئے دیکھتے ہیں، 10 لیٹر کوکنگ آئل کی بوتل ٹرالی کے نیچے چھوڑ کر۔  آپ کیا کریں گے؟
options: Carry the oil back into the store and tell the storekeeper
Leave the oil there without doing anything
Approach the car before they pull away and tell them that they left their oil in the trolley
mcqs.correct_answer: Approach the car before they pull away and tell them that they left their oil in the trolley
mcqs.explanation: Explanation " Approach the car before they pull away and tell them that they left their oil in the trolley " is the best action. This response is ethical and considerate. It ensuring the couple retrieves their forgotten item.

mcqs.question_en: Which of the following action depicts the "keeping of principle"?
mcqs.question_ur: مندرجہ ذیل میں سے کون سا عمل "اصول کی پاسداری" کو ظاہر کرتا ہے؟
options: Destructive role of ethics in society
In the absence of supervisor doing wrongs
Doing such action which is ethically necessary to do
mcqs.correct_answer: Doing such action which is ethically necessary to do
mcqs.explanation: Explanation " Doing such action which is ethically necessary to do " depicts the "keeping of principle." This means adhering to ethical standards and principles even without external enforcement or supervision.

mcqs.question_en: Laws of nature are different from laws of ethics in which regard?
mcqs.question_ur: فطرت کے قوانین کس حوالے سے اخلاقیات کے قوانین سے مختلف ہیں؟
options: Laws of nature can be broken
Laws of nature can be amended
Laws of nature cannot be broken
Human interference is included in it
mcqs.correct_answer: Laws of nature cannot be broken
mcqs.explanation: Explanation " Laws of nature cannot be broken " distinguishes them from laws of ethics. Natural laws describe consistent , unbreakable phenomena in the physical world. Whereas ethical laws can be violated by human actions.

mcqs.question_en: How can one become a good human being?
mcqs.question_ur: ایک اچھا انسان کیسے بن سکتا ہے؟
options: For getting happiness doing all sort of works
mcqs.explanation: Explanation " By following God's order " is how one can become a good human being. Aligning actions with divine guidance often encourages moral and ethical behavior. It contributing to personal and communal well-being.

mcqs.question_en: What is one's good ethical character?
mcqs.question_ur: کسی کا اچھا اخلاقی کردار کیا ہے؟
options: To do good because it's a right action
To do good in love of relatives
To do good in greed of money
mcqs.correct_answer: To do good because it's a right action
mcqs.explanation: Explanation " To do good because it's a right action " reflects one's good ethical character. Acting rightly based on moral principles.

mcqs.question_en: All regions resemble resembles in which basic point?
mcqs.question_ur: تمام خطوں میں مشابہت کس بنیادی نکتے میں ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation All regions and religions resemble each other in the belief in the Oneness of God. This fundamental concept transcends geographical and cultural boundaries. It emphasizing the unity and singularity of the divine.

mcqs.question_en: Which of the following sajdah is performed at the end of a prayer if a mistake is made while performing a prayer?
mcqs.question_ur: اگر نماز پڑھتے وقت غلطی ہو جائے تو نماز کے آخر میں کون سا سجدہ ادا کیا جاتا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation " Sajda-e-Sahw " is the sajdah performed at the end of a prayer if a mistake is made while performing a prayer. This prostration is done to compensate for errors or omissions in the prayer.

mcqs.question_en: What is the standard of respect in Islam?
mcqs.question_ur: اسلام میں احترام کا معیار کیا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The standard of respect in Islam is piety . In Islam, respect and honor are based on an individual's piety and righteousness.

mcqs.question_en: The best way of living is ____?
mcqs.question_ur: زندگی گزارنے کا بہترین طریقہ ___ ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Moderation suggests a balanced and reasonable approach to life. It avoiding extremes and excesses.

mcqs.question_en: Where did prophet Muhammad PBUH and Abu Bakar take shelter before proceeding to Madina?
mcqs.question_ur: رسول اللہ صلی اللہ علیہ وسلم اور ابوبکر نے مدینہ جانے سے پہلے کہاں پناہ لی؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation During the migration from Makkah to Medina, the Holy Prophet (PBUH) and Hazrat Abu Bakar Siddique (R.A) took shelter in the Cave of Soor On September 24, 622 , the prophet Muhammad completes his Hegira, or “flight, ” from Mecca to Medina to escape persecution.

mcqs.question_en: What is called that place where Hazrat Ibrahim (AS) stood while constructing the Kaaba?
mcqs.question_ur: اس جگہ کو کیا کہتے ہیں جہاں حضرت ابراہیم علیہ السلام تعمیر کعبہ کے وقت کھڑے ہوئے تھے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Maqam Ibrahim is the place where Hazrat Ibrahim (AS) stood while constructing the Kaaba. It is located near the Kaaba in Makkah. It is sacred and associated with the footprint of Prophet Ibrahim (AS).

mcqs.question_en: Who was the commanders of the Infidels in the Battle of Uhud?
mcqs.question_ur: جنگ احد میں کفار کے کمانڈر کون تھے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The Battle of Uhud occurred on Saturday, 23 March 625 AD (3 Hijri) in the valley north of Mount Uhud. Prophet Muhammad (PBUH) led around 1000 Muslims in the Battle of Uhud. They faced 3000 Qurayshi Meccans commanded by Abu Sufyan ibn Harb . Abdullah bin Jubair was appointed by Prophet Muhammad (PBUH) to lead the 50 skilled archers positioned on Uhud Mountain.

mcqs.question_en: Abu-al-Hikam is the title of?
mcqs.question_ur: ابو الحکم کس کا لقب ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Abu Jahal , commonly known as Abu Hakam (“ Father of Wisdom ”) among the Quraysh, was considered a wise man. He was fatally wounded in the Battle of Badr by Mu'adh ibn 'Afrā' and Mu'ādh ibn 'Amr. He was finally killed by Abdullah ibn Masud. He was born in 570 A.D. Abu Jahal died by beheading at the Battle of Badr. He was one of the Meccan polytheist pagan leaders from the Quraysh.

mcqs.question_en: When the first migration to Abyssinia took place?
mcqs.question_ur: حبشہ کی طرف پہلی ہجرت کب ہوئی؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Surah Anfal mentions the migration of the Holy Prophet SAW. The first migration to Abyssinia (Habshah) took place in 613 A.D. Including Prophet Muhammad's relatives Usman Ghani (R.A) and Ruqaiyah (R.A). This group comprised 12 men and 4 women. The second migration to Abyssinia occurred in 616 A.D. This group comprised 83 men and 18 to 19 women.

mcqs.question_en: The comb was invented by Prophet?
mcqs.question_ur: کنگھی  کس نبی ﷺ نے ایجاد کی تھی؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Hazrat Ibrahim (AS) is a prominent example of faith in Judaism, Christianity, and Islam. He is also credited with inventing the comb .

mcqs.question_en: What was the name of town in Israel which was the home of Hazrat Issa (AS) in his youth?
mcqs.question_ur: بنی اسرائیل کی اس بستی کا کیا نام تھا جو حضرت عیسیٰ علیہ السلام کی جوانی میں گھر تھا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The town in Israel that was the home of Hazrat Issa (AS) in his youth is Nazareth . It is known as the place where Jesus (AS) grew up.

mcqs.question_en: Hazrat Abu Bakr (R.A) belonged to the tribe of _____?
mcqs.question_ur: حضرت ابوبکر رضی اللہ عنہ کا تعلق _____ قبیلے سے تھا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Hazrat Abu Bakr (RA) was born on 27 October 573 CE in Mecca to a wealthy family of the Banu Taym tribe of the Quraysh. His father, Uthman , was given the laqab Abu Quhafa , and his mother, Salma bint Sakhar , was given the laqab Umm ul-Khair . He had sons named Abdullah ibn Abi Bakr and Abdul-Rah.

mcqs.question_en: Which Sahabi was known as Brain of Arab?
mcqs.question_ur: کس صحابی کو عرب کا دماغ کہا جاتا تھا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The Holy Prophet (PBUH) gave the title Brain of Arab to Hazrat Amr bin al-Aas R.A. Hazrat Amr bin Al-Aas was the Arab commander. He led the Muslim conquest of Egypt. He served as Egypt's governor in 640–646 and 658–664. Hazrat Amr bin Al-Aas embraced Islam in 629 AD. He was Born : 573 AD Mecca, Hejaz. He was Died: 664 AD (aged 90–91) Egypt, Umayyad Caliphate.

mcqs.question_en: During Which prayer, the change of Qibla happened?
mcqs.question_ur: کس نماز کے دوران قبلہ کی تبدیلی ہوئی؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The change of Qibla from Jerusalem to the Kaaba in Mecca occurred during the Zuhr (midday) prayer in 624 CE . This significant event took place in the second (2nd) year of the Hijra.

mcqs.question_en: Bird Hudhud (Woodpecker) is mentioned in which Surah?
mcqs.question_ur: چڑیا ہُدّد کا ذکر کس سورہ میں آیا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The bird Hudhud (hoopoe) appears twice in Surah An-Naml (27th chapter) of the Quran. It played a crucial role in carrying messages between Prophet Sulayman (AS) and the Queen of Sheba.

mcqs.question_en: How many Umahaat ul Momineen were Hufaaz (memorizers of the Quran)?
mcqs.question_ur: کتنے امہات المومنین حفاظ (قرآن کے حافظ) تھے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Three Umahaat ul Momineen (Mothers of the Believers) were Hufaaz (memorizers of the Quran): Hazrat Aisha (RA) Hazrat Hafsa (RA) Hazrat Umm Salama (RA) They were known for their deep knowledge and preservation of the Quranic verses.

mcqs.question_en: Qaroon was a treasurer, he was in the reign of which Prophet?
mcqs.question_ur: قارون خزانچی تھا، کس نبی کے دور میں تھا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Qaroon was a treasurer during the reign of Prophet Musa (AS). He is often remembered for his immense wealth and arrogance. This ultimately led to his downfall as recounted in the Quran.

mcqs.question_en: In which Islamic Battle Angeles helped the Muslims?
mcqs.question_ur: کس اسلامی جنگ میں اینجلس نے مسلمانوں کی مدد کی؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The Battle of Badr is also known as The Day of the Criterion. Day of the Criterion means کسوٹی کا دن It took place on Tuesday, 13 March 624 CE (17 Ramadan, 2 AH) near the city of Badr. Prophet Muhammad SAW , commanding his Sahaba , defeated the Quraysh army led by Abu Jahl (Amr ibn Hishām). The Kufar forces numbered 1,000. Fourteen Muslims were killed , while 70 Kufar were killed and 70 captured. Surah Al-Anfal mentions that Allah promised to reinforce the Muslims with 1,000 angels.

mcqs.question_en: Which Surah of the following Quran is known as "Surah of Patience"?
mcqs.question_ur: درج ذیل قرآن کی کون سی سورت "صبر کی سورت" کے نام سے مشہور ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Surah Yusuf is known as the " Surah of Patience " in the Quran. It narrates the story of Prophet Joseph (Yusuf). It highlighting patience as a central theme throughout his trials and tribulations.

mcqs.question_en: Who led Muslims in the Battle of Yarmouk?
mcqs.question_ur: یرموک کی جنگ میں مسلمانوں کی قیادت کس نے کی؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Battle of Yarmouk : Fought between the Byzantine Empire and Muslim forces under Khalid bin Waleed . Dates : August 15 to August 20, 636 AD. Location : Near the Yarmouk River. Caliphate : During the reign of Hazrat Umar (RA). Result : Decisive victory for the Muslims , marking the end of Byzantine rule in Syria.

mcqs.question_en: Which Pious Caliph had to fight against those who refuse to pay zakat?
mcqs.question_ur: زکوٰۃ دینے سے انکار کرنے والوں سے کس خلیفہ کو لڑنا پڑا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Hazrat Abu Bakr , the first Caliph, engaged in Jihad over the issue of Zakat. During the Ridda Wars in July 632 , he dispatched envoys to rebellious tribes demanding payment of Zakat, but they refused. Name (in Arabic) Born (CE) Reigned from (CE) Died Relationship with Muhammad House Abu Bakr (أبو بكر الصديق) 573 8 June 632 22 August 634 Father of Aisha,  Muhammad's wife Banu Taim

mcqs.question_en: Torat (Torah) means ________?
mcqs.question_ur: تورات کا مطلب کیا ہے ؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation " Torah " means " Law " in Hebrew . The Torah has a range of meanings. It refers to the first five books of the Hebrew Bible. It is also known as the Five Books of Moses or Chameesha Choomshey Torah in Hebrew. It encompasses the laws and teachings given to the Israelites. The Torah contains 187 chapters and 5,852 verses.

mcqs.question_en: Hazrat Musa (A.S) met with Holy Prophet ﷺ on the ______ heaven?
mcqs.question_ur: حضرت موسیٰ علیہ السلام کی ______ ملاقات حضور صلی اللہ علیہ وسلم سے جنت میں ہوئی؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Who met with Holy Prophet PBUH on the Haven? 1 st Heaven met Adam (AS) 2 nd Heaven met Isa (AS) and Yahya (AS) 3 rd Heaven met Yusuf (AS) 4 th Heaven met Idris (AS) 5 th Heaven met Haroon (AS) 6 th Heaven met Musa (AS) 7 th Heaven met Ibrahim (AS)

mcqs.question_en: Where is the grave of Hazrat Noah (AS)?
mcqs.question_ur: حضرت نوح علیہ السلام کی قبر کہاں ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Grave of Hazrat Noah (AS) is situated in Jordan. Hazrat Noah saved life at the mythic enormous flood on the earth.

mcqs.question_en: No of Kufars (Non Muslims Forces) in Battle of Badr were _______?
mcqs.question_ur: جنگ بدر میں کفار کی تعداد _____ تھی؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation " Badr " means " full moon " in Arabic. The Battle of Badr , also called Furqan . The Battle of Badr is also known as The Day of the Criterion. Day of the Criterion means کسوٹی کا دن It took place on Tuesday, 13 March 624 CE (17 Ramadan, 2 AH) near the city of Badr . Prophet Muhammad SAW , commanding his Sahaba, defeated the Quraysh army led by Abu Jahl (Amr ibn Hishām). The Kufar forces numbered 1,000 . It was the first battle of Islam , with 313-317 Muslims. The Muslim forces included 82-85 Muhajirun and 231 Ansar ( 61 from Aws and 170 from Khazraj ). They had 2 horses and 70 camels. Fourteen Muslims were killed , while 70 Kufar were killed and 70 captured. Surah Al-Anfal mentions that Allah promised to reinforce the Muslims with 1,000 angels.

mcqs.question_en: How many verses in Surah Al-Baqrah?
mcqs.question_ur: سورہ بقرہ میں کتنی آیات ہیں؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Al-Baqarah (The Cow or The Heifer) is the second and longest chapter of the Quran , with 286 verses. It derives its name from the story of the cow (vv. 67-73). Verse 282, the longest verse, is known as 'āyatu d-dayn. It consists of 25,500 letters and is positioned in Juzʼ 1–3. The chapter has 40 Rukus and is classified as Medinan. Hazrat Ibrahim (علیہ السلام) is mentioned 13 times. The verse 183 describes the obligation of fasting (soam).

mcqs.question_en: How many disciples of Hazrat Essa (AS) assisted him in preaching?
mcqs.question_ur: حضرت عیسیٰ علیہ السلام کے کتنے شاگردوں نے تبلیغ میں ان کی مدد کی؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Twelve companions assisted Hazrat Isa (AS). He was born in Bethlehem. He is known as Rohullah. The Injeel was revealed to him.

mcqs.question_en: In which Surah of the Holy Quran, the regulations for prisoners of war mentioned?
mcqs.question_ur: قرآن پاک کی کس سورہ میں جنگی قیدیوں کے لیے احکام بیان ہوئے ہیں؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Surah An-Nisa (Chapter 4) of the Holy Quran contains regulations for various aspects of life, including the treatment of prisoners of war (Verse 4:76). It emphasizes treating prisoners with kindness and respect , and provides guidance on their release and ransom. This Surah also focuses on social justice, women's rights, and compassion. Quran 76:8 supports the position that prisoners must be fed in a dignified manner and not forced to beg.

mcqs.question_en: When did Ottoman Sultan Muhammad II Fateh capture the Roman Empire Capital, Constantinople?
mcqs.question_ur: عثمانی سلطان محمد ثانی فاتح نے رومی سلطنت کے دارالحکومت قسطنطنیہ پر کب قبضہ کیا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Constantinople قسطنطنیہ Ottoman Sultan Muhammad II Fateh captured Constantinople on May 29, 1453. This marking the end of the Byzantine Empire. It establishing Ottoman control over the city.

mcqs.question_en: How many obligatory Acts of Hajj are there?
mcqs.question_ur: حج کے کتنے فرض ہیں؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation There are three obligatory acts of Hajj , known as the pillars of Hajj: Ihram WUF Tawaf al-Ifadah Additional Information : Hajj means "to intend." Hajj was made compulsory in 9 A.H ., with the first Hajj offered in the same year. Hajj is ordained in Surah Al-Baqarah. The Prophet Muhammad performed only one Hajj in 10 A.H. There are three types of Hajj. One Tawaf of Kaaba is known as a Shoot, which begins from the Shoot. There are three Jamarat. The mosque in Mina is Kheef. At Meekat, Hujjaj assume the state of Ihram. Kalima Tauheed is recited during Hajj. The ritual of offering sacrifice is performed at Mina.

mcqs.question_en: Fatwa Kazi Khan is the authentic fatwa of which sect?
mcqs.question_ur: فتویٰ قاضی خان کس مسلک کا مستند فتویٰ ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation " Fatwa Kazi Khan " is an authoritative fatwa collection of the Fiqah Hanfia (Hanafi) sect. The Fatwa-e-Qazi Khan consists of two volumes. It containing 500 verses from the Holy Qur'an and 290 Traditions of the Holy Prophet SAW. It covering marriage, dower, divorce, legitimacy , and guardianship of minors.

mcqs.question_en: Which was the first institution of Islam?
mcqs.question_ur: اسلام کا پہلا ادارہ کون سا تھا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The Suffah was originally in the northeast corner of the Mosque. When Muhammad SAW was ordered by Allah to change the Qibla towards Mecca in the south. The Suffah was left at the rear of the mosque , where it remained.

mcqs.question_en: In Masjid-e-Aqsa the word Aqsa means _____?
mcqs.question_ur: مسجد اقصیٰ میں لفظ اقصیٰ کا مطلب ______ ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Al-Aqsa Mosque , located in the Old City of Jerusalem , means " far away ." Hazrat Ibrahim (A.S) first laid its foundation. Al-Masjid Al-Aqsa was the first qibla in Islam. It was built 40 years after Al-Masjid Al-Haram in Makkah.

mcqs.question_en: What is the meaning of Quranic Surah Al-Nas?
mcqs.question_ur: قرآنی سورۃ الناس کا کیا مطلب ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The last chapter (sūrah) of the Quran. It is named " An-Nas ," which means "people" or "mankind."

mcqs.question_en: Name the Surah in Ahl-E-Kitab and Munafqeen are mentioned.
mcqs.question_ur: اہل کتاب اور منافقین کےنام کس سورہ میں درج ہیں۔
mcqs.explanation: Explanation In Makki Ahl-E-Kitab and Munafqeen are mentioned *** Ahl-E-Kitab and Munafqeen are mentioned in Surah Munafqun Surah Munafiqun is the 63 Surah of the Quran and consists of 11 verses. ** Christians and Jews are referred to as Ahl al-Kitab, Jesus alone is mentioned in the Qur'an more than 30 times .

mcqs.question_en: How many Rukus are there in Surah Al-Baqrah?
mcqs.question_ur: سورہ بقرہ میں کتنے رکوع ہیں؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Al-Baqarah (The Cow or The Heifer) is the second and longest chapter of the Quran , with 286 verses. It derives its name from the story of the cow (vv. 67-73). Verse 282, the longest verse, is known as 'āyatu d-dayn. It consists of 25,500 letters and is positioned in Juzʼ 1–3. The chapter has 40 Rukus and is classified as Medinan. Hazrat Ibrahim (علیہ السلام) is mentioned 13 times. The verse 183 describes the obligation of fasting (soam).

mcqs.question_en: In which Surah of Quran mentioned that the number of months are Twelve?
mcqs.question_ur: قرآن مجید کی کس سورت میں مہینوں کی تعداد بارہ بتائی گئی ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Surah Al-Tauba (Surah 9) mentions in verse 36 that " Verily, the number of months with Allah is twelve months ." This verse confirms the fixed lunar calendar in Islam.

mcqs.question_en: Who was the first writer of “Wahi” in Quraish?
mcqs.question_ur: قریش میں "وحی" کا پہلا مصنف کون تھا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Hazrat Zaid bin Sabit (RA) was the first to record "Wahi" among the Quraish. Hazrat Abu Bakar (R.A) appointed Zaid bin Sabit to compile the Holy Quran at the request of Hazrat Umar (R.A). Sharjeel-ibn-Hasana Kandi was the first to transcribe revelations in Makkah. The last revelation was written by Abi Ibn Kaaf. Prophet Idrees (عليه السلام) was the first to write with a pen.

mcqs.question_en: The biggest Islamic country by area is _____?
mcqs.question_ur: رقبے کےلحاظ سے سب سے بڑا اسلامی ملک کونسا ہے۔
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Largest Muslim country by area is Kazakhstan . Largest Muslim country by Population is Indonesia. *** World Largest country by area is Russia. World Largest Country by Population is India.

mcqs.question_en: Hazrat Sara (RA) the wife of Hazrat Ibrahim (AS) and the mother of Hazrat Ishaq (AS) and the sister of Prophet ____?
mcqs.question_ur: حضرت سارہ رضی اللہ عنہا حضرت ابراہیم علیہ السلام کی بیوی اور حضرت اسحاق علیہ السلام کی والدہ اور کس نبی کی بہن ہیں؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Hazrat Saarah was the First wife of Hazrat Ibrahim (A.S). She was the mother of Hazrat Ishaq (A.S) Hazrat Saarah was the sister of Prophet Loot The name of Hazrat Saarah is mentioned in two suras of the Qur'an. Hazrat Saarah is one of the Muhaddatha women (to whom the angels spoke). Hazrat Saarah passed away long afterward at the age of 127 in Hebron (al-Khalil). Sarah married her cousin, Ibrahim (a) when he was 37 years old.

mcqs.question_en: Amir Muawiya transferred his capital form Kufa to _____?
mcqs.question_ur: امیر معاویہ نے اپنا دار الحکومت کوفہ _____ منتقل کیا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Amir Muawiya transferred his capital from Kufa to Damascus Mu'awiya I was the founder and first caliph of the Umayyad Caliphate serving from 661 until his death. He became caliph less than thirty years after the death of the Islamic prophet Muhammad Muawiyah was appointed as the Governor of Syria after his brother Yazid ibn Abu Sufyan died Ameer Muawiyah (R.A) established Postal System Hazrat Abu Sufyan, Hazrat Ameer Muawiyah, and Abu Kahafa (R.A) accepted Islam at the time of the Conquest of Makkah **** nd9-2-2023 RY30012023

mcqs.question_en: When Hazrat Usman (RA) accepted Islam, what was his age?
mcqs.question_ur: جب حضرت عثمان رضی اللہ عنہ نے اسلام قبول کیا تو ان کی عمر کیا تھی؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Hazrat Usman (RA), also known as Uthman ibn Affan . He accepted Islam at the age of 34 , in the year 616 CE. He went on to become the third Rashidun Caliph of Islam.

mcqs.question_en: Medina was a center of which of the following?
mcqs.question_ur: مدینہ درج ذیل میں سے کس کا مرکز تھا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Medina is generally considered to be the "cradle of Islamic culture and civilization".

mcqs.question_en: Which member of Ashra Mubashra was the son of Hazrat Safia Bint-e-Abdul Mutalib (R.A.)?
mcqs.question_ur: عشرہ مبشرہ کا کون سا رکن حضرت صفیہ بنت عبدالمطلب رضی اللہ عنہ کے صاحبزادے تھے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Hazrat Zubair (R.A) was the son of Hazrat Safia bint Abdul Muttalib (R.A.), making him the nephew of the Prophet Muhammad (P.B.U.H.). He was one of the prominent companions of the Prophet SAW and a member of the Ashra Mubashra, the ten companions who were promised Paradise.

mcqs.question_en: Al-Jaleel is one of the names of Allah, and it means?
mcqs.question_ur: الجلیل اللہ کے ناموں میں سے ایک نام ہے اور اس کا مطلب کیا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Al-Jaleel is one of the 99 names of Allah in Islam. It means "The Majestic" or "The Glorious"you. It is used to describe Allah's greatness and majesty.

mcqs.question_en: In which Para (Chapter) of the Holy Quran is the verse "Wa Iza Samiu" found?
mcqs.question_ur: قرآن پاک کے کس پارہ (باب) میں آیت "واعضاء سمیع" موجود ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation "Wa Iza Samiu" is a verse in the 7th Para (Chapter) of the Holy Quran. Specifically in Surah Al-A'raf (Chapter 7), Verse 175.

mcqs.question_en: What does the Arabic title "Al-Hakeem" mean?
mcqs.question_ur: عربی لقب "الحکیم" کا کیا مطلب ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation " Al-Hakeem " is one of the names of Allah in Islam. It means "The Wise" or "The All-Wise".

mcqs.question_en: First Migration to Habsha was in _______ Nabvi.
mcqs.question_ur: حبشہ کی طرف پہلی ہجرت _______ نبوی میں ہوئی۔
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The First Migration to Abyssinia (Ethiopia) 613 CE (4th Nabvi) Participants: A group of twelve men and four women The relatives of Prophet Muhammad (PBUH) in the first migration to Abyssinia were Usman Ghani (R.A) and Ruqaiyah (R.A) Also known as :Hijrah il-al-Habshah ***Additional Information*** The 1st Migration to Abyssinia (Ethiopia) 613 CE The 2nd Migration to Abyssinia (Ethiopia) 616 CE The Ethiopian Empire also formerly known by the exonym Abyssinia

mcqs.question_en: The word "deen" is mentioned how many times in the Holy Quran?
mcqs.question_ur: لفظ "دین" قرآن پاک میں کتنی بار آیا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The word "deen" (دين) is mentioned 79 times in the Quran. It is an Arabic term that encompasses various meanings , including religion, faith, law, judgment, way, and obedience.

mcqs.question_en: What does "Yum-ul-Talaq" mean?
mcqs.question_ur: یوم التلاق سے کیا مراد ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation "Yum-ul-Talaq" means the Day of Gathering. It refers to the day when all humans will be gathered for judgment, emphasizing the event of collective assembly before God.

mcqs.question_en: After which Companions did the Caliphate end?
mcqs.question_ur: کن صحابہ کے بعد خلافت کا خاتمہ ہوا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The Rashidun Caliphate ended with the martyrdom of Hazrat Ali (RA), the fourth caliph , in 661 CE. He was the last of the rightly guided caliphs. After his death marked the beginning of the Umayyad Caliphate, which was established by Muawiyah.

mcqs.question_en: Those who have hoarded gold and silver and do not spend it in the way of God, give them the good news of a painful punishment. This is the translation of the verse of which Holy Quran?
mcqs.question_ur: جن لوگوں نے سونا چاندی جمع کر رکھا ہے اور اسے راہ خدا میں خرچ نہیں کرتے انہیں دردناک عذاب کی خوشخبری سنا دو۔  یہ کس قرآن پاک کی آیت کا ترجمہ ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation This verse (Surah Tauba, Verse 34). It warns those who hoard wealth and fail to spend it in the way of God, promising them a painful punishment in the hereafter. It emphasizes the importance of charity and generosity in Islam.

mcqs.question_en: How many Angels are mentioned in Holy Quran?
mcqs.question_ur: قرآن پاک میں کتنے فرشتوں کا ذکر ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation There are 7 Angels are mentioned in Holy Quran. 1. Gabriel (upon whom be peace): Gabriel is the angel whose task is to convey the revelation from Allah to His Messengers. 2. Mikaa’eel (upon whom be peace): Mikaa’eel is the angel responsible for distribution of sustenance wherever Allah wishes. 3. Israafeel (upon whom be peace): Israfeel (a.s.) is the angel who is charged with blowing the trumpet on the Day of Judgment. 4. Azraeel (upon whom be peace): He is the Angel of death to take the souls with the order of Allah swt. He is mentioned in the hadiths and ayahs as “Angel of Death.” 5. Kiram al Katibin: “Keepers” mentioned in the ayahs (Surah al Infitar; 10-12) and (Surah al An’am, 61) are the “kiram al katibin” angels that are the two angels recording the deeds. 6. Hafaza (The Guardian Angels) “Witnesses” are the hafaza angels who are charged with guarding. 7. Hamalat al-‘Arsh: They are the angels carrying the arsh (throne).

mcqs.question_en: In Which city does Pakistan run an electric public bus?

mcqs.explanation: Explanation Sindh Information Minister Sharjeel Inam Memon on Friday announced the launch of Pakistan's first electric bus service in Karachi . The bus service is being started from Tank Chowk near Jinnah Avenue The project will begin with 10 bus stops. ND10-3-2023

mcqs.question_en: How many Surahs of the Holy Quran start with the word ‘Inna‘?
mcqs.question_ur: قرآن پاک کی کتنی سورتیں لفظ انا سے شروع ہوتی ہیں؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Holy Qur'an, certainly words from Allah (swt) contains four Surah/Chapter which starts with the word 'Inna' and chapters are the following: 1) Fath a. 2) Nuh. 3) Qad'r. 4) Kausar.

mcqs.question_en: After how many months of migration of Prophet (PBUH) to Madina the change of Qibla occurred?
mcqs.question_ur: مدینہ منورہ کی طرف ہجرت کے کتنے مہینے بعد قبلہ کی تبدیلی واقع ہوئی؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The change of Qibla occurred after the 18 months of migration of the Holy Prophet (PBUH) to Madina the change of Qibla occurred In 624 AD During the Zohar prayer , the change of Qibla happened . In 2 Hijri years , Qibla has changed Masjid al-Qiblatain is one of the three oldest mosques in Islamic history The first Qibla Muslims prayed for is Al-Aqsa mosque المسجد الأقصى (Bait Al-Maqdis بيت المقدس ) ***

mcqs.question_en: Which was the first person who informed Hazrat Ayesha (RA) about the eveent of Afak?
mcqs.question_ur: سب سے پہلے کون سا شخص تھا جس نے حضرت عائشہ رضی اللہ عنہا کو واقعہ آفاق کی اطلاع دی؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The first person who informed Hazrat Ayesha (RA) about the slander (known as the Event of Ifk) was Umm Mistah bint Abi Ruhm. incident occurred during a period when Hazrat Ayesha (RA) was left behind on an expedition and later accused of infidelity.

mcqs.question_en: the last caliph of Ummayyads was:
mcqs.question_ur: امویوں کا آخری خلیفہ تھا
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Marwan II  was the last of the Umayyad caliphs (reigned 744–750) Marwan ibn Muhammad ibn Marwan known as Marwan II He was the fourteenth and last caliph of the Umayyad Caliphate He was killed while fleeing the forces of Abu al-Abbas as-Saffaḥ

mcqs.question_en: Maqam-e-Ibrahim is the place which contains the imprints of the feet of Hazrat Ibrahim (AS). Where it is located?
mcqs.question_ur: مقام ابراہیم وہ جگہ ہے جس میں حضرت ابراہیم علیہ السلام کے قدموں کے نشانات ہیں۔  یہ کہاں واقع ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Maqam-e-Ibrahim is located in Makkah , Saudi Arabia, in front of the Kaaba. The stone is encased in a glass and metal enclosure. It is situated in the Mataf area where pilgrims perform Tawaf . It is about 13 meters (43 feet) east of the Kaaba.

mcqs.question_en: What was the name of Sword of Hazrat Muhammad SAW?
mcqs.question_ur: حضرت محمد ﷺ کی تلوار کا نام کیا تھا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Hazrat Muhammad (SAW) had several swords , but the most famous ones were: Azb (أزب) : Also known as Azab, it was a sword given to him by his cousin, Ali ibn Abi Talib (RA). Zulfiqar (ذو الفقار) : This was a sword given to him by Allah (SWT) through the angel Jibril (AS) and was considered a divine gift. It was also used by Ali ibn Abi Talib (RA) in the Battle of the Trench .

mcqs.question_en: Mutfqa Alea is known as _____?

mcqs.explanation: Explanation Bukhari is a famous Islamic scholar who compiled the hadith collection known as Sahih al-Bukhari . mcqs.question_en: Hazrat Abu Bakr (R.A), the first Caliph of Islam, fought for the establishment and propagation of Islam. What was his primary focus during his leadership?
mcqs.question_ur: اسلام کے پہلے خلیفہ حضرت ابوبکر رضی اللہ عنہ نے اسلام کے قیام اور تبلیغ کے لیے جدوجہد کی۔ ان کی قیادت کے دوران ان کی بنیادی توجہ کیا تھی؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Hazrat Abu Bakr (R.A), the first Caliph of Islam after the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him), was known for his unwavering commitment to justice. During his leadership, he prioritized fairness and equity, ensuring that the Islamic principles were upheld in all matters.

mcqs.question_en: Hazrat Imam Hussain's (RA) title was _____?
mcqs.question_ur: حضرت امام حسین رضی اللہ عنہ کا لقب _____ تھا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Hazrat Imam Hussain (RA) , the grandson of Prophet Muhammad (PBUH) and son of Hazrat Ali (RA) and Hazrat Fatimah (RA). He is often referred to by the title " Shabbir ," which means "patient" or "enduring."

mcqs.question_en: Hijra (migration) from Makkah to Madina started in which Nabvi year?
mcqs.question_ur: مکہ سے مدینہ کی طرف ہجرت کس نبوی سال میں شروع ہوئی؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The Hijra, or migration of Prophet Muhammad (PBUH) and his followers from Makkah to Madina. It took place in the 13th year of the Prophethood. It marking the beginning of the Islamic calendar.

mcqs.question_en: Which Holy Book is called the New Testament?
mcqs.question_ur: کس مقدس کتاب کو نیا عہد نامہ کہا جاتا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The New Testament is the second half of the Christian Bible. Christians consider the Old Testament (or Hebrew Bible/Jewish Scriptures) The New Testament is the sacred canon of Scripture.

mcqs.question_en: Prophet Muhammad Attributes as Rahmatan for:

mcqs.question_en: The last War fought against non-believers in ERA of Prophet (PBUH) was ________
mcqs.question_ur: آخری جنگ رسول اللہ صلی اللہ علیہ وسلم کے دور میں کافروں کے خلاف لڑی گئی۔
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The Battle of Tabuk, also known as Ghazwa e Tabuk. was the last military expedition led by Muhammad before his death in 632. According to al-Mas'udi, the Prophet (s)'s ghazwas were 26, but some people took their number to be 27. Prophet ( ﷺ) set out for Tabuk, appointing Ali al-Murtaza as his caliph to administer Madinah. According to Rajab 9 AH, the Holy Prophet ( ﷺ) embarked on this journey on Thursday, 630 AD , according to all historians.

mcqs.question_en: Abdullah bin Abbas (R.A) was given the title of?
mcqs.question_ur: عبداللہ بن عباس رضی اللہ عنہ کو کیا لقب دیا گیا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Abdullah ibn Abbas (R.A.) was nephew of the Maymoonah bint Al-Harith (R.A.), who later became Ummul-Muminin [Mohammad's (S.A.W.) wife]. He was known as “Sea of Knowledge” and one of the early Quran scholars.

mcqs.question_en: Who ruled Ottoman Turkey in the 16th century?
mcqs.question_ur: سولویں صدی میں سلطنت عثمانیہ پر کس نے حکومت کی؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation In the 16th century, Ottoman Turkey was primarily ruled by Suleiman the Magnificent, reigning from 1520 to 1566. He was succeeded by his son Selim II , who ruled from 1566 to 1574, continuing his father's policies. During the 16th and 17th centuries, the Ottoman Empire was controlling much of Southeast Europe, Western Asia, the Caucasus, North Africa, and the Horn of Africa.

mcqs.question_en: Which is first Madni Surah in Quran?

mcqs.question_en: What is the penalty for the thief?
mcqs.question_ur: چور کی کیا سزا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation In Islamic law (Sharia), the penalty for theft (Sariqa) is amputation of the hand , specifically the right hand , as mentioned in the Quran ( Surah Al-Ma'idah, verse 38 ). This punishment is applied in cases where the theft is proven and meets certain conditions , and is intended to serve as a deterrent and a means of rehabilitation.

mcqs.question_en: Deen e Hanif is the old name of____?
mcqs.question_ur: دین حنیف ____ کا پرانا نام ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The history of Islam concerns the political, social, economic and cultural developments of Islamic civilization . Most historians accept that Islam originated in Mecca and Medina at the start of the 7th century CE.

mcqs.question_en: What was the title of Hazrat Ayesha (رضہ)?
mcqs.question_ur: حضرت عائشہ رضی اللہ عنہا کا لقب کیا تھا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Hazrat Ayesha ( رضہ ) was the daughter of Hazrat Abu Baker & Wife Of Hazrat Muhammad (PBUH) Aisha was married to Muhammad in Mecca in 624 CE, after the Battle of Badr. Resting place Jannat al-Baqi , Medina Hazrat Ayesha Remained alive 46 years after the demise of Muhammad (PBUH). Siddiqa was the title of Hazrat Ayesha (رضہ) meaning 'the t ruthful woman, daughter of the truthful man Hazrat Ayesha is also known for narrating 2,210 hadiths "Hazrat Muhammad PBUH Had 11th Wives. 1. HAZRAT KHADEJA, 2. HAZRAT SAUDA 3. HAZRAT AYESHA 4. HAZRAT HAFSA 5. HAZRAT ZAINAB KHUZEMA 6. HAZRAT UMM E SALMA 7. HAZRAT ZAINAB BINT E JAHESH 8. HAZRAT JAVERIA 9. HAZRAT UMM E HABIBA 10. HAZRAT SAFIA 11. HAZRAT MEMONA RA ND29-5-2023

mcqs.question_en: Which prophet died while standing with the support of a stick?
mcqs.question_ur: وہ کون سے نبی عَلَيْهِ ٱلسَّلَامُ تھے  جو لاٹھی کے سہارے کھڑے کھڑے وفات پائی؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Prophet Sulaiman عَلَيْهِ ٱلسَّلَامُ died  in 931 B.C. Hazrat Suleman A.S died while standing with the support of a stick the title of Hazrat Suleman AS is King of Israel Hazrat Suleman knew the language of birds, to both animals and jinn The Mausoleum of Prophet Sulaiman (PBUH) can be found within the compound of Masjid-Al-Aqsa

mcqs.question_en: Hajj was ordered in_____?
mcqs.question_ur: حج کا حکم کس سورت میں دیا گیا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation * Hajj means to intend. • Hajj made compulsory in 9 A.H. • First Hajj offered in 9 A.H. • Hajj ordained in Surah Bakr. • The holy prophet performed only 1 Hajj in 10th A.H. • There are 3 types of Hajj. • One tawaf of Kaaba is known as a Shoot. • Tawaf begins from Shoot. • Number of Jamarat is 3. • Mosque located in Mina is Kheef. • At Meekat, Hujjaj assumes the state of Ihram. • Kalima Tauheed is recited during Hajj. • At Mina the ritual of offering sacrifice is performed

mcqs.question_en: The Prophet Muhammad (SAW) first migration was to ______.
mcqs.question_ur: حضرت محمد ﷺ نے پہلی ہجرت کہاں کی؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The Migration to Abyssinia ( Ethiopia ) The relatives of Prophet Muhammad (PBUH) in the first migration Usman Ghani (R.A) and Ruqaiyah (R.A) Also known as: Hijrah il-al-Habshah Dated 6 BH (613/14 CE). Participants : A group of twelve men and four women

mcqs.question_en: Which Ghazawa is mentioned in Surah Taubah?
mcqs.question_ur: سورہ توبہ میں کس غزوہ کا ذکر ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The Ghazawa of Tabuk is mentioned in Surah At-Tawbah , which is the ninth chapter of the Quran. The Ghazawa of Tabuk took place in October 630 CE and was the last military expedition led by the Prophet Muhammad (SAW).

mcqs.question_en: It was Will of Allah that Hazrat Muhammad PBUH married to?
mcqs.question_ur: یہ اللہ کی مرضی تھی کہ حضرت محمد صلی اللہ علیہ وسلم سے شادی ہوئی؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation It was Will of Allah that Hazrat Muhammad PBUH married to Hazrat Zainab Bint Jahsh RA.

mcqs.question_en: Duration of revelation of Holy Quran is?
mcqs.question_ur: قرآن مجید کے نزول کا دورانیہ کیا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The duration of the revelation of the Holy Quran is 22 years, 02 months, and 22 days , between 610 to 632 AD.

mcqs.question_en: How many Hufaaz were martyred in the battle against Musailimah Kazab, the false prophet-hood claimant?
mcqs.question_ur: نبوت کے جھوٹے دعویدار مسیلمہ کزاب کے خلاف جنگ میں کتنے حفاظ شہید ہوئے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Seventy (70) Hufaaz were martyred in the battle against Musailimah Kazab, the false prophet-hood claimant.

mcqs.question_en: What was the real name of Mujjaddid-e-Alf Sani?
mcqs.question_ur: مجدد الف ثانی کا اصل نام کیا تھا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The real name of Mujaddid-e-Alf Sani was Ahmad. Ahmad Sirhindi , also known as Mujaddid-i-Alf-i-Thani, was an Indian Islamic scholar , a Hanafi jurist and a member of the Naqshbandī Sufi order . He was born in 1564 and died in 1624 . He was a prominent figure in the Mughal Empire and played a significant role in promoting Islamic orthodoxy.

mcqs.question_en: In which year Hajr-e-Aswad was stolen?
mcqs.question_ur: حجر اسود کس سال چوری ہوئی؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The Black Stone was stolen in 930 CE by the Qarmatians , who held it for ransom and returned it 23 years later. The Black Stone is a rock set into the eastern corner of the Kaaba , the ancient building in the center of the Grand Mosque in Mecca, Saudi Arabia.

mcqs.question_en: First Takbir (Allah Akbar) in Prayers is called?
mcqs.question_ur: نماز میں پہلی تکبیر (اللہ اکبر) کہی جاتی ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Takbirah al Ihram , also known as the "First Takbir", is the initial declaration of "Allahu Akbar" (الله أكبر) that marks the beginning of the Islamic prayer (Salah). It is called Takbirah al Ihram because it is the threshold between the state of not praying and entering into the prayer.

mcqs.question_en: When the Ghazwa of Badr Al-Sughra took place?
mcqs.question_ur: غزوہ بدر الصغیرہ کب ہوا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Ghazwa-e-Sughra , refers to the Battle of Badr al-Sughra, which took place in 4 AH (626 CE).

mcqs.question_en: What are the three "White Days" in Islam?
mcqs.question_ur: اسلام میں تین "سفید دن" کون سے ہیں؟
options: 13th 14th and 15th days of every month in the Islamic calendar
mcqs.correct_answer: 13th 14th and 15th days of every month in the Islamic calendar
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The " White Days " (Ayyam al-Beedh) refer to the 13th, 14th, and 15th days of every month in the Islamic calendar, which are considered special days for fasting, prayer, and charity . These days are considered "white" because the moon is full and bright during this time.

mcqs.question_en: Who made the silver encasement of Hajr e Aswad for the first time?
mcqs.question_ur: حجر اسود کی چاندی کی چادر پہلی بار کس نے بنوائی؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The silver encasement of Hajr e Aswad was made for the first time by Abdullah bin Zubair (RA). Abdullah bin Zubair (RA) was the first person to put a silver container around the Hajr e Aswad to protect it from any future attacks, as it had been damaged by catapults during the Umayyad siege of Mecca in 683 CE.

mcqs.question_en: How many salaah will the Takbeer-e-Tashreeq be recited?
mcqs.question_ur: تکبیرِ تشریق کتنی صلاۃ پڑھی جائے گی؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The Takbeer-e-Tashreeq will be recited after 23 Salaah. The Takbeer-e-Tashreeq is a declaration of faith recited by Muslims during the days of Hajj and Eid Al-Adha. It is recited after every Fardh Salah, starting on the 9th of Dhul Hijjah, the day of Arafah , and continues until the Asr prayer on the 13th of Dhul Hijjah.

mcqs.question_en: Who was given the title of "Khair-ut-Tabeen"?
mcqs.question_ur: "خیر التبین" کا لقب کس کو دیا گیا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Awais Karni (RA) was given the title " Khair-ut-Tabeen " due to his extraordinary virtues and merits.

mcqs.question_en: Hazrat Bilal (RA) was buried in?
mcqs.question_ur: حضرت بلال رضی اللہ عنہ کو دفن کیا گیا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Hazrat Bilal (RA) was buried in Damascus, Syria .

mcqs.question_en: The battle of Nehruwan was fought between Hazrat Ali (R.A) and_______?
mcqs.question_ur: نہروان کی جنگ حضرت علی رضی اللہ عنہ اور _______ کے درمیان لڑی گئی؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The Battle of Nahrawan was fought in 658 CE (17 Ramadan 37 AH) between the forces of Hazrat Ali ibn Abi Talib (R.A) and the Kharijites.

mcqs.question_en: Approximately 22 lakh and 51 thousand square miles area was brought under the Muslim control during the reign of?
mcqs.question_ur: تقریباً 22 لاکھ 51 ہزار مربع میل کا علاقہ کس کے دور حکومت میں مسلمانوں کے زیر تسلط آیا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Approximately 22 lakh and 51 thousand square miles area was brought under Muslim control during the reign of Hazrat Umar (R.A).

mcqs.question_en: Shah Wali ullah was influenced by?
mcqs.question_ur: شاہ ولی اللہ کس سے متاثر تھے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Shah Waliullah (1703-1762) was deeply influenced by the writings and ideas of Ibn-e-Tamia (1263-1328), a prominent Islamic scholar and theologian from Syria. Ibn-e-Tamia's works on Islamic jurisprudence, theology, and philosophy had a significant impact on Shah Waliullah's thoughts and reforms.

mcqs.question_en: Which famous Ghazwa is mentioned in Surah Al-Furqan?
mcqs.question_ur: سورہ فرقان میں کس مشہور غزوہ کا ذکر ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The famous Ghazwa mentioned in Surah Al-Furqan is the Battle of Badr. Note : According to SPSC Battle of Badr is right answer.

mcqs.question_en: Which city of Italy has been mentioned in the Quran?
mcqs.question_ur: قرآن مجید میں اٹلی کے کس شہر کا ذکر آیا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Rome is the city of Italy mentioned in the Quran . The Quran mentions the Roman Empire , which had its capital in Rome, in several verses, including Surah Ar-Rum (Chapter 30) , which is named after the Romans.

mcqs.question_en: Abu Turab was his family name?
mcqs.question_ur: ابو تراب ان کا خاندانی نام تھا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Abu Turab was his family name of Hazrat Ali (RA).

mcqs.question_en: One pair of books is not among the Sahahe Sitta?
mcqs.question_ur: کیا کتابوں کا ایک جوڑا صحاح ستہ میں نہیں ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The Sahahe Sitta (Six Authentic Books) are: Sahih Bukhari Sahih Muslim Sunnan Tirmizi Sunnan Abu Dawud Jami' at-Tirmidhi (also known as Sunnan Tirmizi) Sunnan Ibne Maja Sahih Bukhari, Shamail Tirmizi is not among the Sahahe Sitta, as it is a different book written by Imam Tirmidhi.

mcqs.question_en: Hazrat Salma (RA) was Hazrat Abu Bakr's (RA) Mother. She was given the title?
mcqs.question_ur: حضرت سلمہ رضی اللہ عنہا حضرت ابوبکر رضی اللہ عنہ کی والدہ تھیں۔  کیا اسے لقب دیا گیا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Hazrat Salma (RA) was given the title Umm-ul-Khair , meaning " Mother of Goodness ."

mcqs.question_en: The first book of Hadith that was complied by any one?
mcqs.question_ur: حدیث کی پہلی کتاب جس کی تعمیل کسی نے کی؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The first book of Hadith compiled by anyone is " Mauta Imam Malik ."

mcqs.question_en: Arafat is about?
mcqs.question_ur: عرفات کے بارے میں ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation It is a rocky hill within the plain of Mount Arafat , located approximately 20 kilometers (12 miles) east of Mecca, Saudi Arabia .

mcqs.question_en: Who has given more than five thousand Ahadith?
mcqs.question_ur: پانچ ہزار سے زیادہ احادیث کس نے دی ہیں؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Hazrat Abu Hurairah (RA) is known for narrating more than five thousand ahadith.

mcqs.question_en: Imam Bukhari was born in____and died in____?
mcqs.question_ur: امام بخاری کی پیدائش ______ میں ہوئی اور وفات ______ میں؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Imam Bukhari was born in 194 AH and died in 256 AH.

mcqs.question_en: To whom did the Holy Prophet Hazrat Muhammad (PBUH) give the good news of wearing the bracelet of Kasra?
mcqs.question_ur: حضور اکرم صلی اللہ علیہ وسلم نے کسریٰ کا کنگن پہننے کی بشارت کس کو دی؟
options: Hazrat Saraqa bin Jaishm bin Malik (RA)
mcqs.correct_answer: Hazrat Saraqa bin Jaishm bin Malik (RA)
mcqs.explanation: Explanation To Hazrat Saraqa bin Jaishm bin Malik (RA) did the Holy Prophet Hazrat Muhammad (PBUH) give the good news of wearing the bracelet of Kasra.

mcqs.question_en: During the Jahiliyyah (pre-Islamic era), which tribe held the post of embassy in Makkah?
mcqs.question_ur: جاہلیت (قبل از اسلام) کے دوران مکہ مکرمہ میں سفارت خانہ کا عہدہ کس قبیلے کے پاس تھا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation During the Jahiliyyah (pre-Islamic era), the tribe that held the post of embassy in Makkah was Banu Adi .

mcqs.question_en: What is the name of the person who shows the way in migration?
mcqs.question_ur: ہجرت میں راستہ دکھانے والے کا نام کیا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The person who shows the way in migration is Hazrat Abdullah bin Ariqat (RA).

mcqs.question_en: Who is the author of "Al-Adab al-Mufrad"?
mcqs.question_ur: "الادب المفرد" کا مصنف کون ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The author of "Al-Adab al-Mufrad" is Imam Bukhari .

mcqs.question_en: Which Prophet's community faced calamity due to cheating in measurement and weightage of things?
mcqs.question_ur: ناپ تول میں دھوکہ دہی کی وجہ سے کس پیغمبر کی امت کو مصیبت کا سامنا کرنا پڑا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The Prophet's community that faced calamity due to cheating in measurement and weightage of things is Prophet Shoaib's (AS) community.

mcqs.question_en: What is meant by "Ayam Arab"?
mcqs.question_ur: "ایام عرب" سے کیا مراد ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation "Arab Civil Wars" is meant by " Ayam Arab ."

mcqs.question_en: According to Shah Wali Allah, how many verses in the Quran are considered abrogated?
mcqs.question_ur: شاہ ولی اللہ کے نزدیک قرآن مجید کی کتنی آیات منسوخ ہیں؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation According to Shah Wali Allah, five verses in the Quran are considered abrogated.

mcqs.question_en: What is a hadith that is directly narrated by a Tabi called?
mcqs.question_ur: وہ حدیث کیا ہے جو براہ راست کسی تابعی نے روایت کی ہو؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation A hadith that is directly narrated by a Tabi is called " Maqtoo ."

mcqs.question_en: What is the name of the campaign known as "Jaish-ul-Asra"?
mcqs.question_ur: "جیش العصرہ" کے نام سے جانی جانے والی مہم کا کیا نام ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The campaign known as " Jaish-ul-Asra " (Army of Difficulty) refers to the Battle of Tabuk , which took place in 9 AH (630 CE). This battle was the last military campaign led by the Prophet Muhammad (PBUH) and was fought against the Byzantine Empire.

mcqs.question_en: In which year of Hijri was the order to demolish Masjid Zarar?
mcqs.question_ur: مسجد ضرار کو گرانے کا حکم کس سال ہجری میں آیا؟
options: 2 AH after the Battle of Badr
5 AH after the Battle of Uhud
7 AH after the Treaty of Hudaybiyyah
9 AH after the Battle of Tabuk
mcqs.correct_answer: 9 AH after the Battle of Tabuk
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Masjid al-Dirar , also known as Masjid Zarar, was built in Medina by a monk named Abu Amir and 12 hypocrites close to Masjid Quba. Masjid e Zarar is mentioned in Surah at-Tobah of the Holy Quran. In October 630 CE (9 A.H) , Prophet Muhammad (SAW) ordered its destruction while returning from the Expedition to Tabouk. Prophet Muhammad (SAW) was told that the Mosque was promoting anti-Islamic elements.

mcqs.question_en: "Al-Hawi" is written by whom?
mcqs.question_ur: "الحاوی" کس نے لکھا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation "Al-Hawi" or "The Comprehensive Book on Medicine" is a medical book written by Abu Bakr Zakaria Razi, also known as Rhazes or Rasis, in the 10th century. The book is divided into 23 volumes, each covering specific parts or diseases of the body.

mcqs.question_en: The punishments of locusts, frogs, and storms were revealed to which nation?
mcqs.question_ur: ٹڈی دل، مینڈک اور طوفان کے عذاب کس قوم پر نازل ہوئے؟
options: The people of Hazrat Musa (AS) and Bani Israel
mcqs.correct_answer: The people of Hazrat Musa (AS) and Bani Israel
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The punishments of locusts, frogs, and storms were revealed to the people of Hazrat Musa (AS) and Bani Israel.

mcqs.question_en: Sam, Ham, and Yapheth were sons of which prophet?
mcqs.question_ur: سام، حام اور یافث کس نبی کے بیٹے تھے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Sam, Ham, and Yapheth were sons of Hazrat Noah (AS).

mcqs.question_en: Who built Darulandah?
mcqs.question_ur: دارلندہ کس نے بنایا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Darulandah was built by Qasi bin Kalab .

mcqs.question_en: What is the minimum amount of gold required for Zakat?
mcqs.question_ur: زکوٰۃ کے لیے سونے کی کم از کم کتنی مقدار درکار ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Nisab is the minimum amount of net capital that a Muslim must possess in order to be eligible to pay Zakat, which is prescribed as the equivalent of 87.48 grams (7.5 tola) of gold and 612.36 grams (52.5 tola) of silver, respectively.

mcqs.question_en: Who was the first to breastfeed the Holy Prophet (PBUH) among the maidservants?
mcqs.question_ur: خادمہ میں سب سے پہلے حضور صلی اللہ علیہ وسلم کو دودھ کس نے پلای
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Hazrat Sobia (RA) was the first maidservant to breastfeed the Holy Prophet (PBUH) after his birth.

mcqs.question_en: Who is the author of "The Declaration of Signatories"?
mcqs.question_ur: " دستخط کنندگان کا اعلان" کا مصنف کون ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation "The Declaration of Signatories" (Al-'Aqidah Al-Waasitiyah) is a famous book written by Imam Ibn Qayyim Al-Jawziyya (1292-1350 CE), a renowned Islamic scholar and theologian. The book is a concise and authoritative exposition of Islamic creed and doctrine.

mcqs.question_en: On the occasion of Hajj in 9 Hijri, which companion was sent to Makkah by the Holy Prophet (PBUH) as a messenger?
mcqs.question_ur: نو ہجری میں حج کے موقع پر حضور صلی اللہ علیہ وسلم نے کس صحابی کو رسول بنا کر مکہ بھیجا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation On the occasion of Hajj in 9 Hijri, Hazrat Ali ibn Abi Talib (RA) was sent to Makkah by the Holy Prophet (PBUH) as a messenger.

mcqs.question_en: Whose testimony was considered equal to that of two men among the companions?
mcqs.question_ur: صحابہ میں سے کس کی گواہی دو آدمیوں کے برابر سمجھی جاتی تھی؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Hazrat Khuzaima ibn Thabit (RA) had his testimony considered equal to that of two men.

mcqs.question_en: How many copies of the Quran did Shah Wali Allah write?
mcqs.question_ur: شاہ ولی اللہ نے قرآن مجید کے کتنے نسخے لکھے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Shah Wali Allah wrote three handwritten copies of the Quran, which are considered priceless treasures of Islamic calligraphy and scholarship. One copy is preserved in the National Archives of India , while the other two are in private collections.

mcqs.question_en: Ghazwa Banu Qurayzah was fought immediately after which battle?
mcqs.question_ur: غزوہ بنو قریظہ کس جنگ کے فوراً بعد لڑی گئی؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Ghazwa Banu Qurayzah was fought immediately after the Battle of Khandaq (Trench).

mcqs.question_en: In which Surah of the Holy Quran are women commanded to cover themselves?
mcqs.question_ur: قرآن پاک کی کس سورت میں عورتوں کو پردہ کرنے کا حکم دیا گیا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Women are commanded to cover themselves in Surah An-Nur, verse 31.

mcqs.question_en: Who did the Prophet Muhammad (PBUH) send a letter to on the occasion of Hajj in 9 Hijri?
mcqs.question_ur: نو ہجری میں حج کے موقع پر رسول اللہ صلی اللہ علیہ وسلم نے کس کو خط بھیجا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation In 9 Hijri , the Prophet Muhammad (PBUH) sent letters to the rulers of neighboring countries, including the Roman Emperor Heraclius, the Persian Emperor Khosrau, and others , inviting them to accept Islam and warning them of the consequences of rejecting the truth.

mcqs.question_en: Who was given the title Zaat un Nataqin?
mcqs.question_ur: ذات النطقین کا لقب کس کو دیا گیا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Hazrat Asma (RA) was given the title Zaat un Nataqin. Which means "She of the Two Belts" Her nickname was given to her by Muhammad during the migration to Medina She prepared food for this journey. She tied the food on the camel's back with her belt , as nothing else could be found She was Abu Bakr's daughter. Her mother was Qutaylah bint Abd al-Uzza She was half-sisters were Aisha and Umm Kulthum bint Abi Bakr,

mcqs.question_en: In which Surah is the mention of Hajj, Fasting etc?
mcqs.question_ur: حج، روزہ وغیرہ کا ذکر کس سورت میں ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The mention of Hajj, fasting, and other religious obligations is found in: Surah Al-Baqarah .

mcqs.question_en: What was the relation between Hazrat Shoaib and Hazrat Musa (AS)?
mcqs.question_ur: حضرت شعیب اور حضرت موسیٰ علیہ السلام کے درمیان کیا تعلق تھا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Hazrat Shoaib, also known as Jethro , was the father of Safura , whom Musa married. Therefore, Shoaib was Musa's father-in-law.

mcqs.question_en: When did Hazrat Imam Tirmazy die?
mcqs.question_ur: حضرت امام ترمذی کی وفات کب ہوئی؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Muhammad ibn Isa al-Tirmidhi , often referred to as Imām at-Termezī or Tirmidhī , was an Islamic scholar who died on October 9, 892 CE.

mcqs.question_en: How many words exist in Quran Majeed
mcqs.question_ur: قرآن مجید میں ٹوٹل کتنے حروف ہیں
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The Quran Majeed contains approximately 77,432 words. The number of verses is generally agreed to be 6,236, excluding the Bismillah, or 6,348

mcqs.question_en: Before invading Sindh, bin Qasim was the governor of?
mcqs.question_ur: سندھ پر حملہ کرنے سے پہلے بن قاسم کس کا گورنر تھا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Before invading Sindh, bin Qasim was the governor of Fars .

mcqs.question_en: Who levied taxes on new converts to Islam?
mcqs.question_ur: نئے اسلام قبول کرنے والوں پر ٹیکس کس نے لگایا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Jizya tax was imposed on Non-Muslims during the Holy Prophet's (PBUH) life But it was formalized during Caliph Umar bin Khatab.

mcqs.question_en: Mualim Thani is also known as?
mcqs.question_ur: معلم تھانی کے نام سے بھی جانا جاتا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Mualim Thani is also known as Minhaj Siraj .

mcqs.question_en: When was the Battle of Nahrawan fought?
mcqs.question_ur: جنگ نہروان کب لڑی گئی؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The Battle of Nahrawan was fought on July 17, 658 AD (Safar 38 AH). The Battle of Nahrawan was fought between Hazrat Ali (RA) and the Kharjis.

mcqs.question_en: Who wrote the book "Taqat e Nasri"?
mcqs.question_ur: کتاب "تقت ناصری" کس نے لکھی؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation "Taqat e Nasri" was written by Minhaj Siraj .

mcqs.question_en: Which false prophet was killed during the life of Holy Prophet Muhammad (SAW)?
mcqs.question_ur: حضور نبی اکرم صلی اللہ علیہ وآلہ وسلم کی زندگی میں کس جھوٹے نبی کو قتل کیا گیا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Musaylimah was a false prophet who claimed prophethood during the lifetime of Holy Prophet Muhammad (SAW) He was killed in the Battle of Yamama in 632 CE . Musailama al Kazzab False Prophet Was Called The Liar’ By The Holy Prophet Wahshi ibn Harb killed Muslema Kazab (Musailamah al Kazzab)

mcqs.question_en: What was the approximate year when the Umayyad rule in Spain ended?
mcqs.question_ur: اسپین میں اموی حکومت ختم ہونے کا اندازاً کون سا سال تھا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The Umayyad rule in Spain ended in 1031 CE .

mcqs.question_en: When did the Prophet Muhammad (SAW) perform Umrah after the Treaty of Hudaybiyah?
mcqs.question_ur: صلح حدیبیہ کے بعد رسول اللہ صلی اللہ علیہ وسلم نے کب عمرہ کیا؟
options: The same year as the treaty
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The Treaty of Hudaybiyah was signed in 628 CE , and the Prophet Muhammad (SAW) performed Umrah in 629 CE , the following year. This was part of the agreement reached in the treaty, which allowed the Muslims to perform Umrah in Mecca.

mcqs.question_en: Who was the Persian general in the Battle of al-Qādisiyyah?
mcqs.question_ur: القدسیہ کی جنگ میں فارسی جرنیل کون تھا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The Persian general in the Battle of al-Qādisiyyah was Rostam Farrokhzād.

mcqs.question_en: What was the Expedition of Usra?
mcqs.question_ur: غزوہ اسراء کیا تھا؟
options: A military expedition led by the Prophet Muhammad (SAW)
A diplomatic mission sent by the Prophet Muhammad (SAW)
A trade caravan led by the Prophet Muhammad (SAW)
A pilgrimage led by the Prophet Muhammad (SAW)
mcqs.correct_answer: A military expedition led by the Prophet Muhammad (SAW)
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The Expedition of Usra, also known as the Expedition of Usra ibn al-Huqaq . Here are some key points about the Expedition of Usra: Date : 6th Hijri year (627 CE) Leader: Prophet Muhammad (SAW) Purpose : To defend against a potential threat from the tribe of Usra Outcome: Successful defeat of the tribe Location : Usra (a place near Medina)

mcqs.question_en: Which Surah was revealed after the Battle of Badr?
mcqs.question_ur: جنگ بدر کے بعد کون سی سورت نازل ہوئی؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Surah Al-Anfal : This Surah was revealed after the Battle of Badr and contains verses that relate to the battle , including 8:5-19, 8:42-48 , 8:70-71.

mcqs.question_en: Who built Bait al Hikmat?
mcqs.question_ur: بیت الحکمت کس نے بنایا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Bait al-Hikmat , also known as the House of Wisdom, was a renowned library and intellectual center in Baghdad, Iraq , during the Islamic Golden Age. It was built during the reign of Caliph Mamoon Rashid ( 813-833 CE ), who was a patron of learning and scholarship.

mcqs.question_en: In which battle did the Prophet SAW appoint three generals?
mcqs.question_ur: رسول اللہ صلی اللہ علیہ وسلم نے کس جنگ میں تین جرنیل مقرر کیے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The Prophet SAW appointed Khalid ibn al-Walid, Abu Ubaidah ibn al-Jarrah and Abu Amr ibn al-As as generals in the Battle of Hunain.

mcqs.question_en: What was the number of main clans of the Quraish tribe?
mcqs.question_ur: قبیلہ قریش کے اہم قبیلوں کی تعداد کتنی تھی؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation There are 10 main clans of the Quraish tribe: Hāshim, the clan of the Prophet himself Zuhra, the clan of the Prophet's mother Taim, the clan of the first caliph, Abū Bakr ʿAdī, the clan of the second caliph, ʿUmar I Umayya, the clan of the third caliph, ʿUthmān, and his relatives, the dynasty of the Umayyad caliphs Banu al-Harith Banu Lu'ayy ibn Ghalib Banu 'Amir Banu Ka'b Banu Adi

mcqs.question_en: What was the name of the leader of the non-Muslim forces during the Battle of Hunain?
mcqs.question_ur: جنگ حنین کے دوران غیر مسلم افواج کے سربراہ کا نام کیا تھا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Malik bin ‘Awf was the supreme commander of the Hawazin tribe, which allied with the Bani Thaqif to fight against the Muslims in the Battle of Hunain .

mcqs.question_en: What was the father's name of Bibi Halima (RA), the wet nurse of the Prophet Muhammad (PBUH)?
mcqs.question_ur: رسول اللہ صلی اللہ علیہ وسلم کی نرس بی بی حلیمہ رضی اللہ عنہا کے والد کا نام کیا تھا؟
