mcqs.explanation: Explanation Bibi Halima (RA) was the wet nurse of the Prophet Muhammad (PBUH) and her father's name was Harith bin Abdul Uzza . She played an important role in the early life of the Prophet (PBUH) and is considered a respected figure in Islamic history.

mcqs.question_en: How many Ghazwa was fought in the month of Ramadan?
mcqs.question_ur: ماہ رمضان میں کتنے غزوے ہوئے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The four Ghazwa fought in the month of Ramadan are: Ghazwa Badr Ghazwa Buwat Ghazwa Khandak Ghazwa Hamra-al-Asad

mcqs.question_en: Hazrat Khadija (R.A) bore all the children of Prophet Muhammad (PBUH) except?
mcqs.question_ur: حضرت خدیجہ رضی اللہ عنہا نے سوائے رسول اللہ صلی اللہ علیہ وسلم کے تمام بچے پیدا کیے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The children of Hazrat Muhammad SAW are said to have been born to his first wife Khadija bint Khuwaylid, except his son Ibrahim , who was born to Maria al-Qibtiyya .

mcqs.question_en: The Ghazwa-e-Badr is also known as?
mcqs.question_ur: غزوہ بدر کو کس نام سے بھی جانا جاتا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Ghazwa-e-Badr is also known as Ghazwa-e-Kubra , which means " The Great Battle of Badr ". This battle took place on 17th Ramadan, 2 AH (624 CE) and was a decisive victory for the Muslims led by the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) against the Meccan polytheists.

mcqs.question_en: Which tribes accepted Islam after the Ghazwa-e-Mota?
mcqs.question_ur: غزوہ موتہ کے بعد کن قبائل نے اسلام قبول کیا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Banu Aos and Khazraj embraced Islam after Ghazwa-e-Mota.

mcqs.question_en: Which surah of the Quran is named after cow?
mcqs.question_ur: قرآن کی کس سورت کا نام گائے کے نام پر رکھا گیا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Surah Bakra is named after a cow. "The Heifer" or "The Cow" It has been named after the story of the Cow (vv. 67-73). It is the second and longest chapter of the Quran . 282 verse is the longest in this surah is known as ayatu d-dayn Position : Juz 1–3 No. of Rukus : 40 They consist of 25,500 letters Additional information: There are six chapters of the Quran are named after animals or insects : Surat 2 , Al Baqarah ( The Cow ) Surat 6 , Al Anaam ( The Cattle ) Surat 16 , Al Nahl (The Bees ) Surat 27 , Al Naml ( The Ants ) Surat 29 , Al Ankabut ( The Spider ) Surat 105 , Al-Fil ( The Elephant ).

mcqs.question_en: Which Muslim pious caliph conquered Iran?
mcqs.question_ur: کس مسلمان پرہیزگار خلیفہ نے ایران کو فتح کیا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Umar was the second Muslim caliph ( from 634 ), Under whom Arab armies conquered Mesopotamia and Syria And began the conquest of Iran and Egypt. Additional information: The Pious Caliphs were the first four Caliphs. They were:  Abu Bakr  Umar  Uthman  Ali Name (in Arabic) Born (CE) Reigned from (CE) Died Relationship with Muhammad House Abu Bakr (أبو بكر الصديق) 573 8 June 632 22 August 634 Father of Aisha,  Muhammad's wife Banu Taim Umar (عمر بن الخطاب) 584 23 August 634 3 November 644 (assassinated by Abu Lu'lu'a Firuz) Father of Hafsa,  Muhammad's wife Banu Adi Uthman (عثمان بن عفان) 579 11 November 644 20 June 656 (assassinated at the end of a siege upon his house; see First Fitna) Husband of Muhammad's daughters, Ruqayya and later Umm Kulthum, and grandson of Muhammad's paternal aunt Banu Ummaya Ali (علي بن أبي طالب) 601 20 June 656 29 January 661    (assassinated while praying in the Mosque of Kufa; see First Fitna) Muhammad's cousin, and husband of Fatimah, Muhammad's daughter and Umamah bint Zainab, Muhammad's granddaughter Banu Hashim

mcqs.question_en: The term “Riba” literally means?
mcqs.question_ur: ربا کا لفظی معنی کیا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The term " Riba " literally means " Any excess ."

mcqs.question_en: قرآن میں سب سے زیادہ زکر کس پیغمبر کا آیا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation قرآن مجید میں سب سے زیادہ ذکر حضرت موسیٰ (علیہ السلام) کا آیا ہے ۔ حضرت موسیٰ کی کہانی اور ان کے واقعات قرآن میں مختلف سورۃٰں اور آیات میں تفصیل سے بیان ہوئے ہیں ، اور ان کا ذکر 136 بار سے زیادہ آیا ہے۔ یہ ذکر مختلف مواقع پر آیا ہے، جیسے کہ ان کی نبوت، فرعون کے ساتھ ان کا مقابلہ، اور بنی اسرائیل کو مصر سے نکالنا وغیرہ۔

mcqs.question_en: What is the name of the Holy book of Sikhism?
mcqs.question_ur: سکھ مت کی مقدس کتاب کا نام کیا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The Guru Granth Sahib is the name for the holy book of Sikhs. It contains 5867 sacred hymns or Shabads . It is made up of 1430 pages The language of the holy book is Gurmukhi ‘Ik Onkar’ is the first line of the holy book of Sikh which means ‘there is only one god’.

mcqs.question_en: Najashi belong to which country?
mcqs.question_ur: نجاشی کا تعلق کس ملک سے ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Najashi belong to Negash, Kingdom of Axum ( present-day Ethiopia ) He is a Muslim Boy Name. He gave shelter to Muslim emigrants from Mecca, around 615–616 at Axum H3 reigned for almost 17 years from 614–630 CE

mcqs.question_en: Nation of Hazrat Hood (AS) destroyed by?
mcqs.question_ur: حضرت ہود علیہ السلام کی قوم کو اللہ تعالیٰ نے کس چیز سے تباہ کیا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The nation of Prophet Hood (A.S) was destroyed by continuous rain and storm after seven days.

mcqs.question_en: Who may rightly be called the saviour of Islam?
mcqs.question_ur: کسے بجا طور پر اسلام کا نجات دہندہ کہا جا سکتا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Hazrat Abu Bakr is called the Saviour of Islam because he saved Islam After the death of Prophet Muhammad, He was the closest companion of the holy Prophet. The holy Prophet called him Al-Siddiq. Additional information: Abu Bakr's kunniyat was Abu Abdullah He was the father-in-law of the Islamic prophet Muhammad His daughter Aisha married with prophet Muhammad His real name was Abdullah Ibn Abi Quhafa. First Caliph Hazrat Abu Bakr Siddiq (R.A) He belonged to the Tribe: Quraysh (Banu Taym) His father's name is Uthman Abu Quhafa. His Mother 's name is Salma Ummul-Khair. Place of burial : Al Masjid an Nabawi, Al-Madinah al-Munawwarah, Saudi Arabia

mcqs.question_en: Giving salaries to the scholars and teachers was started in the time of Caliph?
mcqs.question_ur: کیا خلفائے راشدین کے زمانے میں علماء اور اساتذہ کو تنخواہیں دینا شروع کی گئی تھیں؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Giving salaries to scholars and teachers was started during the time of Caliph Umar (RA). Hazrat Umar ibn al-Khattab was the second caliph of Islam. He was ruled for 10 years from 634 CE to 644 CE. He succeeded Hazrat Abu Bakr. He was instrumental in expanding the Islamic state.

mcqs.question_en: What is the significance of Eid-ul-Fitr in Islam?
mcqs.question_ur: اسلام میں عیدالفطر کی کیا اہمیت ہے؟
options: Remembrance of the sacrifice of Prophet Ibrahim (AS)
Commemoration of the first revelation of the Quran
Marking the end of the Ramadan and the fasting period
mcqs.correct_answer: Marking the end of the Ramadan and the fasting period
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Eid al-Fitr also called the "Festival of Breaking the Fast" Eid al-Fitr marks the end of Ramadan, and is celebrated during the first three days of Shawwal, Shawal is the 10th month of the Islamic calendar. Eid ul Fitr first performed on 2 AH ***

mcqs.question_en: امام احمد کی کتاب کا کیا نام ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Ahmad ibn Hanbal was a Sunni Muslim scholar, jurist, theologian, traditionist, ascetic. Eponym of the Hanbali school of Islamic jurisprudence ne of the four major orthodox legal schools of Sunni Islam. Born: November 780 AD,  Iraq Died: August 2, 855 AD Iraq

mcqs.question_en: Who is the current Religious Affairs minister of KPK?
mcqs.question_ur: کے پی کے کے موجودہ وزیر مذہبی امور کون ہیں؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Muhammad Adnan Qadri is the current Religious Affairs minister of Khyberpahthtun Khwa (KPK) Appointed in March 2024.

mcqs.question_en: Who is the current Communication & Works minister of KPK?
mcqs.question_ur: کے پی کے کا موجودہ وزیر مواصلات و تعمیرات کون ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Shakeel Ahmad is the current Communication & Works minister of Khyberpahthtun Khwa (KPK) Appointed in March 2024.

mcqs.question_en: The principle of non-maleficence primarily focuses on?
mcqs.question_ur: غیر خرابی کا اصول بنیادی طور پر توجہ مرکوز کرتا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The principle of non-maleficence primarily focuses on avoiding harm to others. It emphasizes the importance of preventing harm and minimizing risks to individuals.

mcqs.question_en: In the context of medical ethics, informed consent is primarily associated with which ethical principle?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation In the context of medical ethics, informed consent is primarily associated with the ethical principle of autonomy . It emphasizes the right of individuals to make informed decisions about their own medical treatment, free from coercion or undue influence.

mcqs.question_en: According to utilitarianism, an action is morally right if it?
mcqs.question_ur: افادیت پسندی کے مطابق کوئی عمل اخلاقی طور پر درست ہے تو؟
options: Produces the greatest good for the greatest number
mcqs.correct_answer: Produces the greatest good for the greatest number
mcqs.explanation: Explanation According to utilitarianism, an action is morally right if it produces the greatest good for the greatest number of people.

mcqs.question_en: What is the primary focus of virtue ethics?
mcqs.question_ur: فضیلت اخلاقیات کا بنیادی مرکز کیا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The primary focus of virtue ethics is the development of moral character. It emphasizes cultivating virtuous traits and habits to lead a morally good life, rather than focusing solely on the consequences of actions, moral duties and obligations, or the maximization of happiness.

mcqs.question_en: Which ethical principle advocates treating all individuals with equal respect and dignity?
mcqs.question_ur: کون سا اخلاقی اصول تمام افراد کے ساتھ مساوی عزت اور وقار کے ساتھ برتاؤ کرنے کا حامی ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The ethical principle that advocates treating all individuals with equal respect and dignity is the Principle of justice.

mcqs.question_en: The concept of "justice as fairness" is associated with which ethical philosopher?
mcqs.question_ur: "انصاف بطور انصاف" کا تصور کس اخلاقی فلسفی سے وابستہ ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The concept of "justice as fairness" is associated with the ethical philosopher John Rawls . He developed this idea in his influential work " A Theory of Justice ," where he proposed principles of justice based on the notion of fairness, particularly through the veil of ignorance.

mcqs.question_en: According to Kantian ethics, an action is morally right if?
mcqs.question_ur: کانٹیان کی اخلاقیات کے مطابق کوئی عمل اخلاقی طور پر درست ہے اگر؟
options: It maximizes happiness for the greatest number of people
It aligns with a person's virtues
It is performed out of duty and follows the categorical imperative
It serves the self-interest of the individual
mcqs.correct_answer: It is performed out of duty and follows the categorical imperative
mcqs.explanation: Explanation According to Kantian ethics, an action is morally right if it is performed out of duty and follows the categorical imperative. It emphasizes the importance of acting in accordance with universal principles or maxims, regardless of the consequences or personal desires.

mcqs.question_en: Which ethical theory prioritizes the intrinsic value of actions rather than their consequences?
mcqs.question_ur: کون سا اخلاقی نظریہ اعمال کی اندرونی قدر کو ان کے نتائج کی بجائے ترجیح دیتا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Deontology prioritizes the intrinsic value of actions rather than their consequences. It judges the morality of actions based on principles, duties, or rules, regardless of the outcomes or consequences.

mcqs.question_en: Which ethical theory emphasizes the importance of one's intentions in determining the morality of an action?
mcqs.question_ur: کون سا اخلاقی نظریہ کسی عمل کی اخلاقیات کا تعین کرنے میں کسی کے ارادے کی اہمیت پر زور دیتا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Deontology emphasizes the importance of one's intentions in determining the morality of an action. It focuses on the inherent rightness or wrongness of actions based on principles or rules, rather than solely on the consequences of those actions.

mcqs.question_en: Which ethical theory emphasizes the importance of the consequences of actions?
mcqs.question_ur: کون سا اخلاقی نظریہ اعمال کے نتائج کی اہمیت پر زور دیتا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Utilitarianism emphasizes the importance of the consequences of actions. It evaluates the morality of an action based on its ability to produce the greatest overall happiness or well-being for the greatest number of people.

mcqs.question_en: The theory which not justify capital punishment is?
mcqs.question_ur: وہ نظریہ جو سزائے موت کا جواز نہیں رکھتا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The theory which does not justify capital punishment is the Reformative theory.

mcqs.question_en: The right which justify the Capital punishment is?
mcqs.question_ur: سزائے موت کا جواز کون سا حق ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The right which justifies Capital punishment is the Right to Live.

mcqs.question_en: ‘Eye for an eye’,- ‘tooth for a tooth’,- is the motto of?
mcqs.question_ur: ’آنکھ کے بدلے آنکھ‘، ’دانت کے بدلے دانت‘، کا نصب العین ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation "Eye for an eye, tooth for a tooth" is the motto of the Retributive theory of punishment.

mcqs.question_en: The punishment theory which is supported by criminology is?
mcqs.question_ur: سزا کا نظریہ جس کی تائید کریمینالوجی سے ہوتی ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The punishment theory supported by criminology is the Reformative theory .

mcqs.question_en: The aim of punishment is to educate the offender himself- this theory of punishment is called?
mcqs.question_ur: سزا کا مقصد خود مجرم کو تعلیم دینا ہے- سزا کے اس نظریہ کو کیا کہتے ہیں؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The theory of punishment that aims to educate the offender himself is called the Reformative theory of punishment.

mcqs.question_en: Which theory justifies capital punishment?
mcqs.question_ur: کون سا نظریہ سزائے موت کا جواز پیش کرتا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The Retributivism theory justifies capital punishment.

mcqs.question_en: The aim of_______theory of punishment is to prevent or deter others from committing similar offences.
mcqs.question_ur: سزا کے نظریہ_______ کا مقصد دوسروں کو اسی طرح کے جرائم کرنے سے روکنا یا روکنا ہے۔
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The aim of the Deterrent theory of punishment is to prevent or deter others from committing similar offenses.

mcqs.question_en: Aristotle divides justice into two; one is distributive justice and the other is?
mcqs.question_ur: Aristotle divides justice into two; one is distributive justice and the other is?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Aristotle divides justice into two: distributive justice and corrective justice.

mcqs.question_en: According to Aristotle______belongs to the rational soul.
mcqs.question_ur: ارسطو کے مطابق _____ عقلی روح سے تعلق رکھتا ہے۔
mcqs.explanation: Explanation According to Aristotle, Intellectual virtue belongs to the rational soul.

mcqs.question_en: Who made the distinction between intellectual virtue and moral virtue?
mcqs.question_ur: فکری فضیلت اور اخلاقی فضیلت میں فرق کس نے کیا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Aristotle made the distinction between intellectual virtue and moral virtue.

mcqs.question_en: "Virtue is the habit of choosing the relative mean". Who holds this view?
mcqs.question_ur: "فضیلت رشتہ دار مطلب کو منتخب کرنے کی عادت ہے"۔  یہ نظریہ کون رکھتا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Aristotle holds the view that "Virtue is the habit of choosing the relative mean."

mcqs.question_en: According to Plato_______is the special virtue of the traders.
mcqs.question_ur: افلاطون کے مطابق ___ تاجروں کی خاص خوبی ہے۔
mcqs.explanation: Explanation According to Plato, Temperance is the special virtue of the traders.

mcqs.question_en: According to Plato courage is the special virtue of the?
mcqs.question_ur: افلاطون کے نزدیک جرأت کی خاص خوبی ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation According to Plato, courage is the special virtue of the Fighting class.

mcqs.question_en: According to Plato Wisdom is the special virtue of the?
mcqs.question_ur: افلاطون کے مطابق حکمت کی خاص خوبی ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation According to Plato, Wisdom is the special virtue of the Ruling class.

mcqs.question_en: Which comprehends all cardinal virtues?
mcqs.question_ur: جو تمام بنیادی خوبیوں کو سمجھتا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Justice comprehends all cardinal virtues.

mcqs.question_en: Which of the following is not a Cardinal virtue?
mcqs.question_ur: مندرجہ ذیل میں سے کون سی بنیادی فضیلت نہیں ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation " Goodness " is not considered a Cardinal virtue.

mcqs.question_en: 'Cardinal virtues'-related with?
mcqs.question_ur: 'کارڈینل فضیلت' سے متعلق؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation 'Cardinal virtues' are related to Plato .

mcqs.question_en: "Virtue is knowledge"-related with?
mcqs.question_ur: "فضیلت علم ہے" سے متعلق؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Virtue as knowledge is a concept related to Socrates .

mcqs.question_en: Virtue is a permanent state of mind. Who holds this position?
mcqs.question_ur: فضیلت دماغ کی ایک مستقل حالت ہے۔  کون اس عہدے پر فائز ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Aristotle holds the position that virtue is a permanent state of mind.

mcqs.question_en: Which is the habit of deliberate choice of wrong actions?
mcqs.question_ur: جان بوجھ کر غلط کاموں کے انتخاب کی عادت کون سی ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The habit of deliberate choice of wrong actions is called Vice .

mcqs.question_en: Which is expressed in the commission of sins?
mcqs.question_ur: جس کا اظہار گناہوں کے کمیشن میں ہوتا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Vice is expressed in the commission of sins.

mcqs.question_en: Virtue is the habit of deliberate choice of?
mcqs.question_ur: فضیلت جان بوجھ کر انتخاب کی عادت ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Virtue is the habit of deliberate choice of Right actions.

mcqs.question_en: Which is the excellence of character?
mcqs.question_ur: کردار کی فضیلت کون سی ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The excellence of character is Virtue .

mcqs.question_en: Virtue denotes a?
mcqs.question_ur: فضیلت ایک کی طرف اشارہ کرتا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Virtue denotes a Good Character.

mcqs.question_en: Duties are turned into virtues by?
mcqs.question_ur: فرائض کو فضائل میں تبدیل کیا جاتا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Duties are turned into virtues by Habit .

mcqs.question_en: Duties of imperfect obligation are called?
mcqs.question_ur: نامکمل واجبات کو کیا کہتے ہیں؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Duties of imperfect obligation are called Virtues .

mcqs.question_en: ‘Vir’ means?
mcqs.question_ur: ویر" کا مطلب ہے؟"
mcqs.explanation: Explanation 'Vir' means Man/Hero .

mcqs.question_en: We should cultivate fellow feelings-related with?
mcqs.question_ur: ہم ساتھی جذبات کاشت کرنا چاہئے سے متعلق؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation "We should cultivate fellow feelings" is related to Respect for World Harmony.

mcqs.question_en: We should maintain the social system to which we belong. We should not revolt against the State and produce chaos-related with?
mcqs.question_ur: ہمیں اس سماجی نظام کو برقرار رکھنا چاہیے جس سے ہمارا تعلق ہے۔  کیا ہمیں ریاست کے خلاف بغاوت اور افراتفری پیدا نہیں کرنی چاہیے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation "We should maintain the social system to which we belong. We should not revolt against the State and produce chaos" is related to Respect for Society.

mcqs.question_en: We should keep our promises and fulfil our contracts-related with?
mcqs.question_ur: کیا ہمیں اپنے وعدوں کو پورا کرنا چاہیے اور اپنے ساتھ کیے گئے معاہدوں کو پورا کرنا چاہیے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation "We should keep our promises and fulfill our contracts" is related to Respect for Truth.

mcqs.question_en: "Be a person and respect others as persons". Assertion is related with?
mcqs.question_ur: "ایک شخص بنیں اور دوسروں کا احترام کریں۔"  دعوی کے ساتھ تعلق ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation " Be a person and respect others as persons ". Assertion is related with Hengel .

mcqs.question_en: “Thou shall not kill”. The maxim related with?
mcqs.question_ur: ’’تم قتل نہ کرو‘‘۔  کے ساتھ متعلق زیادہ سے زیادہ؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation "Thou shall not kill" is a maxim related to Respect for Life .

mcqs.question_en: The right of contract necessarily arises out of the?
mcqs.question_ur: معاہدہ کا حق لازمی طور پر اس سے پیدا ہوتا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The right of contract necessarily arises out of the Right of Property .

mcqs.question_en: Right to employment should be recognised by every?
mcqs.question_ur: روزگار کا حق ہر ایک کو تسلیم کیا جانا چاہیے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Right to employment should be recognized by every Welfare state.

mcqs.question_en: Rights of property are essentially personal. Who hold this position?
mcqs.question_ur: جائیداد کے حقوق بنیادی طور پر ذاتی ہیں۔  کون اس عہدے پر فائز ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Hegel held the position that "Rights of property are essentially personal."

mcqs.question_en: The sacredness of life should be recognised in?
mcqs.question_ur: زندگی کے تقدس کو تسلیم کیا جائے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The sacredness of life should be recognized in the Right to live.

mcqs.question_en: The first right of man is?
mcqs.question_ur: انسان کا پہلا حق کیا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The first right of man is generally considered to be the right to live.

mcqs.question_en: Rights and duties are?
mcqs.question_ur: حقوق و فرائض کیا ہیں؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Rights and duties are Correlative to each other.

mcqs.question_en: Which are indispensible for the realization of the highest good and common good?
mcqs.question_ur: اعلیٰ ترین بھلائی اور عام بھلائی کے حصول کے لیے کون سے ناگزیر ہیں؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Moral rights are indispensable for the realization of the highest good and common good.

mcqs.question_en: Duties are?
mcqs.question_ur: فرائض ہیں؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Duties are Obligations .

mcqs.question_en: Right is a?
mcqs.question_ur: ٹھیک ہے ایک؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Right is a Justifiable claim.

mcqs.question_en: Duties are_________of individuals recognised by society.
mcqs.question_ur: فرائض معاشرے کی طرف سے تسلیم شدہ افراد کے ________ ہیں۔
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Duties are Obligations of individuals recognized by society.

mcqs.question_en: Rights are________of individuals recognised by society.
mcqs.question_ur: حقوق معاشرے کی طرف سے تسلیم شدہ افراد کے ______ ہیں۔
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Rights are Moral claims of individuals recognized by society.

mcqs.question_en: Sidgwick considers knowledge, beauty, and virtue are?
mcqs.question_ur: سڈگ وِک علم، حسن اور خوبی کو سمجھتے ہیں؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Sidgwick considers knowledge, beauty, and virtue as Means to pleasure .

mcqs.question_en: Sidgwick holds that_______is the only intrinsic value.
mcqs.question_ur: سڈگ وِک مانتا ہے کہ ______ واحد داخلی قدر ہے۔
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Sidgwick holds that Pleasure is the only intrinsic value.

mcqs.question_en: Hennery Sidgwick’s ethical position is known as?
mcqs.question_ur: ہینری سڈگوک کی اخلاقی حیثیت کو کیا جانا جاتا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Henry Sidgwick's ethical position is known as " Rational Utilitarianism ."

mcqs.question_en: Rogers calls Butler’s doctrine as?
mcqs.question_ur: راجرز بٹلر کے نظریے کو کہتے ہیں؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Rogers calls Butler's doctrine " Autonomic intuitionism ."

mcqs.question_en: “Man is a law to himself”. Who asserts this?
mcqs.question_ur: ’’انسان اپنے لیے ایک قانون ہے‘‘۔  یہ دعویٰ کون کرتا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation "Man is a law to himself" is indeed asserted by Butler .

mcqs.question_en: According to Butler Conscience is?
mcqs.question_ur: بٹلر کے مطابق ضمیر ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation According to Butler, Conscience is Categorical .

mcqs.question_en: Bishop Butler regarded_______as the highest principle in human nature.
mcqs.question_ur: بشپ بٹلر نے _____ کو انسانی فطرت میں اعلیٰ ترین اصول قرار دیا۔
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Bishop Butler regarded Conscience as the highest principle in human nature.

mcqs.question_en: Butler’s ethical position is called as?
mcqs.question_ur: بٹلر کی اخلاقی پوزیشن کو کیا کہا جاتا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Butler's Intuitionism posits that moral principles are known intuitively through introspection rather than through reason or empirical observation. It emphasizes the importance of moral intuition as the foundation for ethical judgments. According to Butler, humans possess a natural faculty that allows them to discern right from wrong intuitively, without relying on external sources or complex reasoning processes.

mcqs.question_en: Moral progress is the gradual reproduction of divine perfection in man. Who holds this view?
mcqs.question_ur: اخلاقی ترقی انسان میں الہی کمال کی بتدریج تولید ہے۔  یہ نظریہ کون رکھتا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation T.H. Green holds the view that "moral progress is the gradual reproduction of divine perfection in man."

mcqs.question_en: T. H. Green holds that there is a_______in nature.
mcqs.question_ur: ٹی ایچ گرین کا خیال ہے کہ فطرت میں ایک _____ موجود ہے۔
mcqs.explanation: Explanation T. H. Green holds that there is a spiritual principle in nature.

mcqs.question_en: To realise the completely rational universe is to realize the true self. Who holds this view?
mcqs.question_ur: مکمل طور پر عقلی کائنات کا ادراک کرنا حقیقی نفس کا ادراک کرنا ہے۔  یہ نظریہ کون رکھتا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation T.H. Green holds this view. He emphasizes the importance of realizing the completely rational universe as a means to realizing the true self.

mcqs.question_en: Spencer argues that absolute ethics deals with the absolute morality in______society.
mcqs.question_ur: اسپینسر کا استدلال ہے کہ مطلق اخلاقیات ______ معاشرے میں مطلق اخلاقیات سے متعلق ہے۔
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Spencer argues that absolute ethics deals with the absolute morality in a perfect society.

mcqs.question_en: Spencer argues that Relative ethics deals with relative morality in______society.
mcqs.question_ur: اسپینسر کا استدلال ہے کہ رشتہ دار اخلاقیات ______ معاشرے میں رشتہ دار اخلاقیات سے متعلق ہے۔
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Spencer argues that Relative ethics deals with relative morality in an imperfect society.

mcqs.question_en: Spencer distinguishes between Absolute ethics and?
mcqs.question_ur: اسپینسر مطلق اخلاقیات کے درمیان فرق کرتا ہے اور؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Spencer distinguishes between Absolute ethics and Relative ethics.

mcqs.question_en: According to Herbert Spencer Self-preservation and race- preservation are the ultimate ends of?
mcqs.question_ur: ہربرٹ اسپینسر کے مطابق سیلف پرزرویشن اور ریس پرزرویشن کے حتمی انجام ہیں؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation According to Herbert Spencer, self-preservation and race-preservation are the ultimate ends of biological evolution.

mcqs.question_en: Thus pleasure is both______and ethically good.
mcqs.question_ur: اس طرح خوشی _____ اور اخلاقی طور پر اچھی ہے۔
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Thus pleasure is both biologically and ethically good.

mcqs.question_en: According to F. H. Bradley, performance of duties appropriate to ones station will leads to?
mcqs.question_ur: ایف ایچ بریڈلی کے مطابق، اپنے اسٹیشن کے لیے مناسب فرائض کی انجام دہی کا باعث بنے گا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation According to F.H. Bradley, the performance of duties appropriate to one's station will lead to self-realization .

mcqs.question_en: 'My station and its Duties' is related with?
mcqs.question_ur: 'میرا اسٹیشن اور اس کے فرائض' کا کیا تعلق ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation "My station and its Duties" is related to F.H. Bradley . He explored this concept in his ethical philosophy, emphasizing the idea that moral obligations are determined by an individual's social role or position.

mcqs.question_en: Perfectionism is also called?
mcqs.question_ur: کیا پرفیکشنزم بھی کہا جاتا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Perfectionism is also called Eudemonism .

mcqs.question_en: Pleasure-giving acts are life-sustaining; pain-giving acts are life-destroying. Who holds this position?
mcqs.question_ur: خوشی دینے والے اعمال زندگی کو برقرار رکھنے والے ہیں؛  درد دینے والے اعمال زندگی کو تباہ کر دیتے ہیں۔  کون اس عہدے پر فائز ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Herbert Spencer holds this position. He argues that pleasure-giving acts sustain life, while pain-giving acts destroy life.

mcqs.question_en: Pleasure in an index of increase of life; pain is an index of decrease of life. Who advocates this view?
mcqs.question_ur: زندگی کے اضافے کے اشاریہ میں خوشی؛  درد زندگی کی کمی کا ایک اشاریہ ہے۔  اس نقطہ نظر کی وکالت کون کرتا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Herbert Spencer advocates this view. He argues that pleasure indicates an increase in life or vitality, while pain indicates a decrease in life or vitality.

mcqs.question_en: Spencer defines______as the adjustment of acts to ends.
mcqs.question_ur: اسپینسر ______ کی تعریف کرتا ہے جیسے اعمال کو انجام تک ایڈجسٹ کرنا۔
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Spencer's definition of conduct implies that it involves the deliberate alignment of actions with specific goals or purposes. It suggests a conscious effort to achieve desired outcomes through one's behavior. This perspective emphasizes the intentional aspect of human actions in achieving their objectives.

mcqs.question_en: Morality is a product of evolution. Who holds this view?
mcqs.question_ur: اخلاقیات ارتقا کی پیداوار ہے۔  یہ نظریہ کون رکھتا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Spencer is known for holding the view that morality is a product of evolution.

mcqs.question_en: Spencer deduces hedonism from the law of?
mcqs.question_ur: اسپینسر کے ھیدونیزم قانون سے اخذ کیا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Spencer deduces hedonism from the law of biological evolution .

mcqs.question_en: Who deduces hedonism from the law of biological evolution?
mcqs.question_ur: حیاتیاتی ارتقاء کے قانون سے ھیدونیزم کو کون اخذ کرتا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Herbert Spencer is known for deducing hedonism from the law of biological evolution. He argued that the evolution of organisms is driven by a pursuit of pleasure and avoidance of pain, aligning with the principles of hedonism.

mcqs.question_en: Herbert Spencer deduces moral laws from?
mcqs.question_ur: ہربرٹ اسپینسر نے اخلاقی قوانین کو کس سے اخذ کیا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Herbert Spencer deduced moral laws from biological laws . He believed that ethical principles could be derived from observations of biological processes and principles, which he termed "biological laws."

mcqs.question_en: ‘Data of Ethics’ is related with?
mcqs.question_ur: 'اخلاقیات کا ڈیٹا' کس سے متعلق ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The concept of the " Data of Ethics " is associated with Herbert Spencer . Herbert Spencer, a British philosopher and sociologist , discussed the "data of ethics" in his work "The Principles of Ethics." He explored how ethical principles could be derived from observable social and biological phenomena.

mcqs.question_en: The hedonism of Herbert Spencer is called?
mcqs.question_ur: ہربرٹ اسپینسر کی ذات پرستی کہلاتی ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Herbert Spencer's " Evolutionary hedonism " posits that pleasure and pain drive human behavior and are subject to evolutionary pressures. According to Spencer, individuals seek pleasure and avoid pain in ways that promote their survival and reproductive success, aligning with the principles of natural selection. This perspective suggests that hedonistic tendencies have evolved over time to enhance fitness and adaptation, shaping human behavior in response to environmental challenges and opportunities.

mcqs.question_en: Bradley argues that morality is?
mcqs.question_ur: بریڈلی نے دلیل دی کہ اخلاقیات ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation F. H. Bradley asserts that morality is objective , meaning it is grounded in universal principles and truths that apply universally to all individuals regardless of personal beliefs or preferences. According to Bradley, moral standards exist independently of subjective opinions or individual perspectives , guiding ethical conduct based on inherent principles of right and wrong. This objective view of morality emphasizes the importance of adhering to timeless moral principles that transcend individual preferences and cultural differences, promoting consistency and coherence in ethical decision-making.

mcqs.question_en: Bradley means by self-realization, realization of the?
mcqs.question_ur: بریڈلی کا مطلب ہے خود شناسی، کا ادراک؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Bradley's concept of self-realization involves transcending the limitations of the finite self and connecting with a deeper, more expansive aspect of one's being, which he refers to as the " Infinite self ." This notion suggests that true self-realization entails recognizing and embracing the boundless potential and interconnectedness of the human spirit beyond individual limitations. By attaining awareness of the Infinite self, individuals can achieve a profound sense of fulfillment and alignment with universal truths, contributing to their holistic development and spiritual growth.

mcqs.question_en: According to F. H. Bradley personal morality apart from social morality is an?
mcqs.question_ur: ایف ایچ بریڈلی کے مطابق سماجی اخلاقیات کے علاوہ ذاتی اخلاقیات کیا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation F. H. Bradley contends that personal morality divorced from social morality exists merely as an abstraction , lacking practical significance or efficacy. In his view, morality is inherently social, shaped by collective norms, values, and interactions within society.

mcqs.question_en: F. H. Bradley claims that_____is never possible apart from society.
mcqs.question_ur: ایف ایچ بریڈلی کا دعویٰ ہے کہ _____ معاشرے کے علاوہ کبھی بھی ممکن نہیں ہے۔
mcqs.explanation: Explanation F.H. Bradley argues that individuals achieve self-realization through their interactions and connections within society, as it provides the necessary context for personal growth and development. According to Bradley, the fulfillment of one's potential and the realization of one's true self are inherently linked to participation in social structures and relationships. Thus, he asserts that self-realization is a product of communal engagement and cannot be fully attained in isolation from society.

mcqs.question_en: The highest personal good is in harmony with the highest social good. Who claims this notion?
mcqs.question_ur: اعلیٰ ترین ذاتی بھلائی اعلیٰ ترین سماجی بھلائی کے ساتھ ہم آہنگ ہے۔  اس تصور کا دعویٰ کون کرتا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation F.H. Bradley asserts that individual fulfillment and societal well-being are inherently intertwined, suggesting that pursuing one's highest personal good naturally aligns with promoting the highest social good. This perspective emphasizes the interconnectedness of personal flourishing and the welfare of the broader community, highlighting the importance of harmonizing individual pursuits with collective interests for the greater benefit of society. Bradley's notion underscores the idea that achieving personal fulfillment is not at odds with contributing positively to the welfare of others and society as a whole.

mcqs.question_en: According to F. H. Bradley different_____are organs of the moral organism.
mcqs.question_ur: ایف ایچ بریڈلی کے مطابق اخلاقی حیاتیات کے مختلف _____ اعضاء ہیں۔
mcqs.explanation: Explanation According to F. H. Bradley , different " Individuals " are organs of the moral organism.

mcqs.question_en: F. H. Bradley asserts that, society is a?
mcqs.question_ur: ایف ایچ بریڈلی نے دعویٰ کیا کہ معاشرہ ایک ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation F. H. Bradley conceptualizes society as a " moral organism ," suggesting that it functions akin to a living entity with its own moral character and principles. In this view, society operates according to collective moral standards and values that guide its actions and interactions. Bradley emphasizes the interconnectedness of individuals within society, highlighting how their moral conduct contributes to the overall moral fabric of the collective entity. This perspective underscores the importance of moral considerations in understanding and evaluating societal dynamics and behavior.

mcqs.question_en: His duties are determined by his station in society. Who said this?
mcqs.question_ur: اس کے فرائض معاشرے میں اس کے مقام سے متعین ہوتے ہیں۔  یہ کس نے کہا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation F.H. Bradley argues that an individual's duties are intrinsically tied to their social position or station in society. According to Bradley, one's role within the social hierarchy dictates the specific obligations and responsibilities they have towards others and the community. This perspective implies that each person has distinct duties based on their station, and fulfilling these duties contributes to the overall harmony and functioning of society.

mcqs.question_en: F. H. Bradley argues that each member has a particular station in society determined by his peculiar?
mcqs.question_ur: ایف ایچ بریڈلی کا استدلال ہے کہ معاشرے میں ہر رکن کا ایک خاص مقام ہوتا ہے جس کا تعین اس کے مخصوص انداز سے ہوتا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation F. H. Bradley posits that individuals possess unique talents or abilities that determine their roles and responsibilities within society . According to his view, each person's talents shape their specific station or position in society , guiding them towards fulfilling roles where their skills are most valuable. This perspective suggests that individuals should recognize and embrace their talents, contributing to society according to their inherent abilities.

mcqs.question_en: Ones duties relate to his own station in life. Who argues this?
mcqs.question_ur: فرائض کا تعلق زندگی میں اس کے اپنے مقام سے ہوتا ہے۔  یہ کون دلیل دیتا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The argument that "one's duties relate to his own station in life" is often associated with F.H. Bradley .

mcqs.question_en: The Greek term "eudaimonia" means?
mcqs.question_ur: یونانی اصطلاح "یوڈیمونیا" کا مطلب ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The Greek term " eudaimonia " means " Happiness ."

mcqs.question_en: Self-realisation is the highest good, this notion is known called?
mcqs.question_ur: خود شناسی سب سے بڑی خوبی ہے، اس تصور کو کیا کہا جاتا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Perfectionism is an ethical theory that emphasizes the pursuit of self-realization and the development of one's full potential as the highest good. According to this view, individuals should strive for excellence in all aspects of life, including moral, intellectual, and personal growth. Perfectionists believe that achieving self-fulfillment leads to a flourishing and meaningful existence, and they prioritize self-improvement as a fundamental aspect of ethical living.

mcqs.question_en: According to Kant duty as the fundamental concept of ethics, this view is called?
mcqs.question_ur: کانٹ ڈیوٹی کے مطابق اخلاقیات کے بنیادی تصور کے طور پر اس نظریے کو کہتے ہیں؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Kantian deontology is an ethical theory that emphasizes the importance of duty and moral obligation as the foundation of ethical decision-making. According to Kant, actions are morally right if they are done out of a sense of duty, regardless of the consequences or outcomes. In Kant's view, duty is determined by rational principles and the categorical imperative, which instructs individuals to act in accordance with universal moral laws. Thus, Kantian deontology prioritizes adherence to moral duty over considerations of personal interest or the potential consequences of actions.

mcqs.question_en: Kant assumes that_____are the only two motives of actions.
mcqs.question_ur: کانٹ فرض کرتا ہے کہ _____ اعمال کے صرف دو محرکات ہیں۔
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Kant assumes that " Duty and self-interest " are the only two motives of actions.

mcqs.question_en: Kant’s ethical theory is called?
mcqs.question_ur: کانٹ کے اخلاقی نظریہ کو کیا کہتے ہیں؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Kant's ethical theory is called " Deontology ."

mcqs.question_en: Kant’s ethical doctrine is called?
mcqs.question_ur: کانٹ کے اخلاقی نظریے کو کیا کہتے ہیں؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Kant's ethical doctrine is called " Formalism ."

mcqs.question_en: ‘Freewill is implied by morality’. Who argues this?
mcqs.question_ur: 'آزادی کا مطلب اخلاقیات سے ہے'۔  یہ کون دلیل دیتا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Kant argues that "Freewill is implied by morality."

mcqs.question_en: According to Kant______is the fundamental postulate of morality.
mcqs.question_ur: کانٹ کے مطابق _____ اخلاقیات کا بنیادی اصول ہے۔
mcqs.explanation: Explanation According to Kant, " Freedom of the will " is the fundamental postulate of morality.

mcqs.question_en: Kant argues that Categorical Imperative is the______it applies to all persons.
mcqs.question_ur: کانٹ کا استدلال ہے کہ کیٹیگوریکل امپیریٹیو ______ ہے جو تمام افراد پر لاگو ہوتا ہے۔
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Kant argues that the Categorical Imperative is the " Universal moral law " as it applies to all persons universally.

mcqs.question_en: According to Kant a natural law is?
mcqs.question_ur: کانٹ کے مطابق قدرتی قانون کیا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation According to Kant, a natural law is " Assertorial ."

mcqs.question_en: According to Kant the moral law is a?
mcqs.question_ur: کانٹ کے مطابق اخلاقی قانون کیا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation According to Kant, the moral law is a " Categorical imperative ."

mcqs.question_en: According to Immanuel Kant, moral law is?
mcqs.question_ur: ایمانوئل کانٹ کے مطابق اخلاقی قانون کیا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation According to Immanuel Kant, moral law is " Self evident ."

mcqs.question_en: According to Immanuel Kant moral law is?
mcqs.question_ur: ایمانوئل کانٹ کے مطابق اخلاقی قانون کیا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation According to Immanuel Kant, moral law is " A priori ."

mcqs.question_en: According to Immanuel Kant the moral law is known?
mcqs.question_ur: ایمانوئل کانٹ کے مطابق اخلاقی قانون کیا معلوم ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation According to Immanuel Kant, the moral law is known " Intuitively ."

mcqs.question_en: The laws of ethics can be violated but cannot be?
mcqs.question_ur: اخلاقیات کے قوانین کی خلاف ورزی ہو سکتی ہے لیکن نہیں ہو سکتی؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The laws of ethics can be violated but cannot be " Changed ."

mcqs.question_en: Laws of______can be violated but cannot be changed.
mcqs.question_ur: کے قوانین کی خلاف ورزی کی جا سکتی ہے لیکن اسے تبدیل نہیں کیا جا سکتا۔ _____
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Laws of ethics can be violated but generally cannot be changed, as they are based on moral principles and norms.

mcqs.question_en: Mill’s theory of Hedonism focuses on the quality of the pleasure, rather than the quantity, so it is called?
mcqs.question_ur: مل کا ہیڈونزم کا نظریہ مقدار کے بجائے لذت کے معیار پر مرکوز ہے، اس لیے اسے کیا کہا جاتا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Mill's theory of Hedonism focuses on the quality of the pleasure rather than the quantity, so it is called " Qualitative hedonism ."

mcqs.question_en: Mill justified______pleasures are more valuable than bodily pleasures.
mcqs.question_ur: مل جواز _____ لذتیں جسمانی لذتوں سے زیادہ قیمتی ہیں۔
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Mill justified " Intellectual " pleasures as more valuable than bodily pleasures.

mcqs.question_en: According to J.S. Mill______pleasures are those associated with the body.
mcqs.question_ur: جے ایس کے مطابق  مل _____ لذتیں وہ ہیں جو جسم سے وابستہ ہیں۔
mcqs.explanation: Explanation According to J.S. Mill, " Lower " pleasures are those associated with the body.

mcqs.question_en: According to J.S. Mill______pleasures are those associated with the mind.
mcqs.question_ur: جے ایس کے مطابق  مل _____خوشیاں وہ ہیں جو ذہن سے وابستہ ہیں۔
mcqs.explanation: Explanation According to J.S. Mill, " Higher " pleasures are those associated with the mind.

mcqs.question_en: According to J.S. Mill higher pleasures are those associated with the?
mcqs.question_ur: جے ایس کے مطابق  مل کے اعلیٰ لذتوں سے وابستہ ہیں؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation According to J.S. Mill, higher pleasures are those associated with the " Mind ".

mcqs.question_en: According to J.S. Mill Lower pleasures are those associated with the?
mcqs.question_ur: جے ایس کے مطابق  مل لوئر خوشیوں سے وابستہ ہیں؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation According to J.S. Mill, lower pleasures are those associated with the " Body ."

mcqs.question_en: Mill argued that pleasures could vary in?
mcqs.question_ur: مل نے دلیل دی کہ لذتیں مختلف ہو سکتی ہیں؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Mill argued that pleasures could vary in " Quality ."

mcqs.question_en: Mill argues that_______are superior to physical forms of pleasure.
mcqs.question_ur: مل کا استدلال ہے کہ ______ لذت کی جسمانی شکلوں سے برتر ہیں۔
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Mill argues that " Moral pleasures " are superior to physical forms of pleasure.

mcqs.question_en: J. S. Mill’s version of hedonism is known as?
mcqs.question_ur: جے ایس مل کا ہیڈونزم کا ورژن کس نام سے جانا جاتا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation J.S. Mill's version of hedonism is known as " Qualitative hedonism ."

mcqs.question_en: Bentham’s version of hedonism is known as?
mcqs.question_ur: بینتھم کا ہیڈونزم کا ورژن کس طرح جانا جاتا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Bentham's version of hedonism is known as " Quantitative hedonism ."

mcqs.question_en: The hedonism which, focuses the quantity of the pleasure, rather than the quality is called?
mcqs.question_ur: وہ خوشامدیت جو معیار کی بجائے لذت کی مقدار پر مرکوز ہو اسے کہتے ہیں؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The hedonism that focuses on the quantity of pleasure rather than the quality is called " Quantitative hedonism ."

mcqs.question_en: Which refers to the felt strength of the pleasure or pain?
mcqs.question_ur: جس سے مراد خوشی یا درد کی محسوس طاقت ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The term that refers to the felt strength of the pleasure or pain is " Intensity ."

mcqs.question_en: Hedonic Calculus of Bentham is a______calculus.
mcqs.question_ur: بینتھم کا ہیڈونک کیلکولس ایک ______ کیلکولس ہے۔
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The seven points in Bentham's Hedonic Calculus are: Intensity : How strong is the pleasure or pain? Duration : How long will the pleasure or pain last? Certainty : How likely is it that the pleasure or pain will occur? Propinquity : How soon will the pleasure or pain occur? Fecundity : The likelihood that the pleasure or pain will lead to more of the same sensation. Purity : The likelihood that the pleasure or pain will lead to some of the opposite sensation. Extent : How many people will be affected by the pleasure or pain?

mcqs.question_en: Which refers to how long the pleasure or pain are felt for?
mcqs.question_ur: جس سے مراد یہ ہے کہ خوشی یا تکلیف کتنی دیر تک محسوس کی جاتی ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The term that refers to how long the pleasure or pain are felt for is " Duration ."

mcqs.question_en: Which refers to the number of people the pleasure or pain is likely to affect?
mcqs.question_ur: جس سے مراد ان لوگوں کی تعداد ہے جن پر خوشی یا تکلیف کا امکان ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The term that refers to the number of people the pleasure or pain is likely to affect is " Extent ."

mcqs.question_en: Which refers to the likelihood of the pleasure or pain leading to some of the opposite sensation?
mcqs.question_ur: جس سے مراد اس لذت یا درد کے امکان کی طرف ہے جو کچھ مخالف احساس کو جنم دیتا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The term that refers to the likelihood of the pleasure or pain leading to some of the opposite sensation is " Purity ."

mcqs.question_en: Which refers to the likelihood of the pleasure or pain leading to more of the same sensation?
mcqs.question_ur: جس سے مراد اس خوشی یا درد کے امکان کی طرف ہے جس کی وجہ سے ایک ہی احساس زیادہ ہوتا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The term that refers to the likelihood of the pleasure or pain leading to more of the same sensation is " Fecundity ."

mcqs.question_en: Which refers to how long away the pleasure or pain is?
mcqs.question_ur: جس سے مراد یہ ہے کہ خوشی یا تکلیف کتنی دور ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The term that refers to how long away the pleasure or pain is " Propinquity ."

mcqs.question_en: Which refers to the likelihood that the pleasure or pain will occur?
mcqs.question_ur: جس سے مراد اس امکان کی طرف ہے کہ لذت یا تکلیف ہو گی؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Certainty refers to the likelihood that the pleasure or pain will occur.

mcqs.question_en: Who introduced the method of hedonic calculus?
mcqs.question_ur: ہیڈونک کیلکولس کا طریقہ کس نے متعارف کرایا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The method of hedonic calculus was introduced by Jeremy Bentham.

mcqs.question_en: The Hedonic Calculus is a method of counting the amount of______that would likely be caused by different actions.
mcqs.question_ur: ہیڈونک کیلکولس ______ کی مقدار کو شمار کرنے کا ایک طریقہ ہے جو ممکنہ طور پر مختلف اعمال کی وجہ سے ہوتا ہے۔
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The Hedonic Calculus is indeed a method of counting the amount of pleasure and pain that would likely be caused by different actions.

mcqs.question_en: Which is a method of counting the amount of pleasure and pain that would likely be caused by different actions?
mcqs.question_ur: خوشی اور درد کی مقدار کو شمار کرنے کا کون سا طریقہ ہے جو ممکنہ طور پر مختلف اعمال سے پیدا ہوتا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation "Hedonistic calculus" : It's a method proposed by Jeremy Bentham for calculating the amount of pleasure and pain generated by different actions , ultimately to determine the most ethical course of action

mcqs.question_en: Utilitarian school having the slogan?
mcqs.question_ur: یوٹیلیٹیرین سکول کا نعرہ ہے؟
options: The greatest happiness of the individual
The greatest happiness of greatest number
mcqs.correct_answer: The greatest happiness of greatest number
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The slogan commonly associated with the Utilitarian school of thought is "The greatest happiness of the greatest number."

mcqs.question_en: Universalistic Ethical Hedonism is also known as?
mcqs.question_ur: یونیورسلسٹ ایتھیکل ہیڈونزم کے نام سے بھی جانا جاتا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Universalistic Ethical Hedonism is also known as Utilitarianism .

mcqs.question_en: The most influential contributor to Universal ethical hedonism is?
mcqs.question_ur: یونیورسل ایتھیکل ہیڈونزم میں سب سے زیادہ بااثر شراکت دار ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The most influential contributor to Universal ethical hedonism is John Stuart Mill.

mcqs.question_en: The theory which holds that the right action is the one that produces the greatest happiness for all is?
mcqs.question_ur: وہ نظریہ جو یہ کہتا ہے کہ صحیح عمل وہی ہے جو سب کے لیے سب سے بڑی خوشی پیدا کرتا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Utilitarianism is a theory of morality that advocates actions that foster happiness and oppose actions that cause unhappiness. Utilitarianism promotes "the greatest amount of good for the greatest number of people."

mcqs.question_en: Each man seeks, or ought to seek, is his own pleasure, this type of ethical hedonism is called?
mcqs.question_ur: کیا ہر انسان اپنی رضا کی تلاش میں ہے، یا اسے ڈھونڈنا چاہیے، اس قسم کی اخلاقی ہیڈونزم کہلاتا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Each man seeks, or ought to seek, his own pleasure, is known as Egoistic ethical hedonism.

mcqs.question_en: Man ought to seeks pleasure, the position is known as?
mcqs.question_ur: انسان کو لذت کی تلاش کرنی چاہیے، مقام کس سے جانا جاتا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The position that man ought to seek pleasure is known as Ethical hedonism.

mcqs.question_en: Men always seeks pleasure-this position is known as?
mcqs.question_ur: مرد ہمیشہ لذت کی تلاش میں رہتے ہیں- یہ مقام کس طرح جانا جاتا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Psychological hedonism asserts that humans are inherently motivated by the pursuit of pleasure and the avoidance of pain. According to this position, all human actions, whether conscious or unconscious, are ultimately driven by the desire for pleasure. It suggests that seeking pleasure is a fundamental aspect of human nature, influencing decision-making and behavior across various contexts.

mcqs.question_en: According to the nature of seeking pleasure hedonism can be divided broadly in to Psychological hedonism and?
mcqs.question_ur: لذت کی تلاش کی نوعیت کے مطابق ہیڈونزم کو نفسیاتی ھیدونیزم میں بڑے پیمانے پر تقسیم کیا جاسکتا ہے اور؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation According to the nature of seeking pleasure, hedonism can be broadly divided into Psychological hedonism and Ethical hedonism.

mcqs.question_en: Hedonism is a school of thought that argues that______is the only intrinsic good.
mcqs.question_ur: ھیدونیزم ایک ایسا مکتبہ فکر ہے جو یہ دلیل دیتا ہے کہ ______ صرف اندرونی اچھائی ہے۔
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Hedonism is a school of thought that argues that pleasure is the only intrinsic good.

mcqs.question_en: Hedone means?
mcqs.question_ur: ھیڈون کا مطلب ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Hedone means pleasure .

mcqs.question_en: Hedonism the term derives from the Greek word?
mcqs.question_ur: ھیدونیزم اصطلاح یونانی لفظ سے ماخوذ ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The term " Hedonism " derives from the Greek word " Hedone ," meaning pleasure .

mcqs.question_en: Which is the general term for the theories that regards happiness?
mcqs.question_ur: خوشی سے متعلق نظریات کے لیے عام اصطلاح کون سی ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Hedonism Theory : In all its variants, it holds that happiness is a matter of raw subjective feeling. A happy life maximizes feelings of pleasure and minimizes pain.

mcqs.question_en: Human beings share some kinds of needs with the lower animals and even with plants are called?
mcqs.question_ur: کیا انسان کسی نہ کسی قسم کی ضروریات کو نچلے حیوانات سے بھی بانٹتا ہے اور پودوں سے بھی کہلاتا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Organic needs refer to fundamental requirements shared among humans, lower animals, and plants for basic survival and functioning. These needs include essentials like nourishment, hydration, and shelter, which are essential for sustaining life across various species. Understanding organic needs underscores the interconnectedness and commonality in the biological requirements for existence.

mcqs.question_en: McDougall defines an instinct as______psycho physical disposition.
mcqs.question_ur: میک ڈوگل ایک جبلت کی تعریف ______ نفسیاتی جسمانی مزاج کے طور پر کرتا ہے۔
mcqs.explanation: Explanation McDougall's definition suggests that instincts are inherited tendencies present at birth. These tendencies influence both psychological and physical behavior, guiding individuals toward certain actions or responses. Instincts are deeply ingrained and evolved traits that contribute to survival and adaptation in various environments.

mcqs.question_en: Sucking of the thump by a child is a?
mcqs.question_ur: بچے کی طرف سے انگوٹھے چوسنا کیا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Sucking the thumb by a child often becomes a habitual action as it provides comfort and security. Over time, the repetitive nature of this behavior reinforces its occurrence. Habitual thumb sucking can be a self-soothing mechanism, especially during times of stress or boredom.

mcqs.question_en: A motive is________mental process.
mcqs.question_ur: ایک مقصد _______ ذہنی عمل ہے۔
mcqs.explanation: Explanation A motive is a conscious mental process, involving the awareness and deliberation of one's reasons or intentions behind an action.

mcqs.question_en: When a man acts blindly without considering the end or result of his action. Such actions is called?
mcqs.question_ur: جب انسان اپنے عمل کے انجام یا نتیجہ پر غور کیے بغیر آنکھیں بند کر کے کام کرتا ہے۔  کیا ایسے اعمال کو کہتے ہیں؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Impulsive action refers to behavior that occurs spontaneously without thoughtful consideration of consequences or outcomes. It often arises from sudden urges or emotions, leading individuals to act impulsively without weighing the potential results. Such actions are characterized by their lack of deliberate planning or foresight.

mcqs.question_en: An intention which the agent does not definitely avows to himself is called?
mcqs.question_ur: وہ ارادہ جس کا ایجنٹ یقینی طور پر اپنے آپ کو ظاہر نہ کرے اسے کہتے ہیں؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation An unconscious intention refers to a motive or purpose behind an action that the agent is not consciously aware of or does not explicitly acknowledge. It may drive behavior without the individual's conscious recognition, yet still influences their actions . Understanding unconscious intentions can provide insight into subconscious motivations and behaviors.

mcqs.question_en: Hobbes asserted that human desire is the______of all human action.
mcqs.question_ur: ہوبز نے زور دے کر کہا کہ انسانی خواہش تمام انسانی اعمال کا ______ ہے۔
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Hobbes asserted that human desire is the Fundamental motivation of all human action.

mcqs.question_en: Desire is a sense of longing of a person for?
mcqs.question_ur: خواہش انسان کی آرزو کا احساس ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Desire is a sense of longing of a person for an outcome .

mcqs.question_en: A person’s conduct corresponding to his?
mcqs.question_ur: ایک شخص کا طرز عمل اس کے مطابق ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation A person's conduct corresponds to his Character , which encompasses their values, beliefs, and habitual patterns of behavior.

mcqs.question_en: The motive means, of course, what moves us or causes us to act in a particular way. Who asserted this?
mcqs.question_ur: محرک کا مطلب ہے، یقیناً، جو ہمیں متحرک کرتی ہے یا ہمیں کسی خاص طریقے سے کام کرنے کا سبب بنتی ہے۔  یہ دعویٰ کس نے کیا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation "The motive means, of course, what moves us or causes us to act in a particular way" is attributed to Mackenzie .

mcqs.question_en: The remote intention of an act is sometimes called?
mcqs.question_ur: کسی فعل کی بعید نیت کو کبھی کبھار کہا جاتا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The remote intention of an act, also known as the motive , refers to the underlying reason or driving force behind an action. It represents the broader goal or objective that motivates a person's behavior, often influencing their decisions and actions over an extended period. Understanding one's motives can provide insight into their behavior and decision-making processes.

mcqs.question_en: The particular result as a realised fact is?
mcqs.question_ur: ایک حقیقی حقیقت کے طور پر خاص نتیجہ ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The particular result as a realized fact is Material intention .

mcqs.question_en: According to Mackenzie the formal intention means the______embodied in fact.
mcqs.question_ur: میکنزی کے مطابق رسمی ارادے کا مطلب ہے حقیقت میں ______ مجسم۔
mcqs.explanation: Explanation According to Mackenzie, the formal intention means the Purpose embodied in fact.

mcqs.question_en: The whole willed scheme of action, which is anticipated by the doer is called?
mcqs.question_ur: عمل کی پوری مرضی کی اسکیم، جس کا انجام کرنے والے کو کہا جاتا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The whole willed scheme of action, which is anticipated by the doer, is called Intention .

mcqs.question_en: The term "intention" corresponds the term?
mcqs.question_ur: اصطلاح "نیت" اصطلاح سے مطابقت رکھتا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The term "intention" corresponds to the term Purpose .

mcqs.question_en: Which is a conscious mental process which moves a man to act in a particular way?
mcqs.question_ur: کون سا شعوری ذہنی عمل ہے جو انسان کو ایک خاص طریقے سے عمل کرنے کی تحریک دیتا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The conscious mental process which moves a person to act in a particular way is called a Motive .

mcqs.question_en: The desires that predominate or continue to be effective is called?
