mcqs.explanation: Explanation The departure of Mina typically starts from the 8th Duhl Hijjah. This marks the beginning of the ritual known as "Rami al-Jamarat," Key points about arrival in Mina: Day Name: Day of Tarwiyah Significance: Pilgrims spend the day in Mina performing prayers and supplications

mcqs.question_en: Hajar-e-Aswad’s direction is toward:
mcqs.question_ur: حجر اسود کا رخ کس طرف ہے
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The picture above shows the Hajar al-Aswad (The Black Stone) , which is set in the eastern corner of the Ka'bah. حج کے متعلق ان سولات کو ضرور پڑھیں Click here

mcqs.question_en: The fundamental pillar of Islam that requires both Physical and financial sacrifice is known as:
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The pillar of Islam that requires both p hysical and financial sacrifice is Hajj. Additional information: The word pilgrimage is indeed called Hajj . The word Hajj means to intend There are 3 Farz, 10 Sunnat and 6 Wajibat in Hajj. Hajj was made compulsory in 9 A.H. First Hajj is offered in 9 A.H. Hajj was ordained in Surah Bakr. The holy prophet performed only 1 Hajj in 10th A.H. There are 3 types of Hajj . حج کے متعلق ان سولات کو ضرور پڑھیں Click here

mcqs.question_en: Animals are routinely sacrificed on Eid-ul-Adha in memory of the sacrifice of?
mcqs.question_ur: قربانی کی یاد میں عید الاضحی پر جانوروں کی قربانی معمول کے مطابق کی جاتی ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Animals are routinely sacrificed on Eid ul Adha in memory of the sacrifice of Prophet Abraham and Prophet Ishmael. Prophet Abraham was tested by God and asked to sacrifice his son , Prophet Ishmael , as a demonstration of his faith . However, just as Abraham was about to carry out the sacrifice , God provided a ram to be sacrificed instead.

mcqs.question_en: Who said that Hajj is greatest of all worships?
mcqs.question_ur: کس نے کہا کہ حج تمام عبادات سے افضل ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Imam Malik said that Hajj is greatest of all worships .

mcqs.question_en: Which Muslim country has highest Hajj Pilgrims?
mcqs.question_ur: کس مسلم ملک میں سب سے زیادہ عازمین حج ہیں؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Indonesia has consistently sent one of the largest numbers of Hajj pilgrims each year .

mcqs.question_en: The place where offering prayer is just like offering prayer inside Kaba is called?
mcqs.question_ur: وہ جگہ جہاں نماز پڑھنا بالکل کعبہ کے اندر نماز پڑھنے کی طرح ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation It is believed that the blessings that one receives after praying inside the Al Hateem are equivalent to the rewards received by a pilgrim who prays inside the Kaaba .

mcqs.question_en: What is meant by Hajj e Mabroor?
mcqs.question_ur: حج مبرور سے کیا مراد ہے؟
options: That Hajj which is performed to obtain the goodwill of Allah
That Hajj which is performed for jinnah
A pilgrimage to the Cave of Hira
mcqs.correct_answer: That Hajj which is performed to obtain the goodwill of Allah
mcqs.explanation: Explanation "Mabrood " is an Arabic term that means " blessed " or " fortunate ." It is often used to convey congratulations or good wishes . In the context of Hajj or special occasions, people might use " Mabrood " to express blessings and good fortune .

mcqs.question_en: What does mean by Hadi?
mcqs.question_ur: ہادی سے کیا مراد ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation " Hadi " in the context of Hajj refers to the sacrificial animal that pilgrims offer during the ritual of Qurbani (sacrifice) as part of the Hajj pilgrimage.

mcqs.question_en: Dhulhulaifah is a point_____miles away from Madina.
mcqs.question_ur: ذوالحلیفہ مدینہ سے _____ میل دور ہے۔
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Dhulhulaifah is a point approximately 4 miles away from Mad ina .

mcqs.question_en: The gate which is the best for the pilgrims to enter in Kaba is?
mcqs.question_ur: خانہ کعبہ میں حجاج کے داخلے کے لیے کون سا دروازہ سب سے بہتر ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The gate that is considered the best for pilgrims to enter the Kaaba is known as the "Bab al-Salam" or the "Gate of Peace."

mcqs.question_en: Umrah can be performed at any time throughout the year except?
mcqs.question_ur: عمرہ سال بھر میں کسی بھی وقت کیا جا سکتا ہے سوائے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Muslims can conduct Umrah at any time of the year, except during the Hajj season . Hajj is the annual pilgrimage to Mecca that takes place in the Islamic month of Dhu al-Hijjah.

mcqs.question_en: What is the difference between Hajj and Umrah?
mcqs.question_ur: حج اور عمرہ میں کیا فرق ہے؟
options: Hajj is offered between 7th to 13th Zul-Hajj whereas Umrah can be performed any time
Umrah is offered between 7th to 13th Zul-Hajj whereas Hajj can be performed any time
mcqs.correct_answer: Hajj is offered between 7th to 13th Zul-Hajj whereas Umrah can be performed any time
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Umrah can be performed at any time during the Islamic calendar , unlike Hajj which can only be performed during the month of Dhul Hijjah .

mcqs.question_en: Who rebuilt Kaaba 4500 years ago?
mcqs.question_ur: 4500 سال قبل خانہ کعبہ کی تعمیر نو کس نے کی؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The Kaaba was originally built by Prophet Ibrahim (Abraham) and his son Ismael around 4,500 years ago. They are believed to have been commanded by Allah to construct the Kaaba as a place of worship.

mcqs.question_en: How many companions accompanied Prophet (PBUH) at the last Hajj?
mcqs.question_ur: آخری حج میں کتنے صحابہ کرام رضوان اللہ علیہم اجمعین کے ساتھ تھے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation At the Prophet Muhammad's (PBUH) last Hajj , known as the Farewell Pilgrimage , there were approximately 120,000 companions present.

mcqs.question_en: The most of the bindings of Hajj on the pilgrim are released on____after Rami.
mcqs.question_ur: حاجی پر حج کی زیادہ تر پابندیاں _____ رمی کے بعد جاری ہوتی ہیں۔
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The most of the bindings of Hajj on the pilgrim are released on the 10th day of Dhu al-Hijjah , which is after the ritual of Rami (stoning of the devil) . This day is known as Eid al-Adha.

mcqs.question_en: Tawaf-e-Ziyarat is performed on?
mcqs.question_ur: طواف زیارت کب کیا جاتا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Tawaf al-Ziyarah is a farz . It can be performed any time, day or night , from 10 Zil Hijjah to the sunset of 12 Zil Hijjah .

mcqs.question_en: What is Arafat?
mcqs.question_ur: عرفات کیا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Arafat refers to the plain of Arafat. It is a flat and open area located near Mecca , where pilgrims gather on the 9th day of the Islamic month of Dhu al-Hijjah. Standing at Arafat is a crucial ritual during Hajj, symbolizing unity and equality in Islam.

mcqs.question_en: When Tawaf-e-Sadr is performed?
mcqs.question_ur: طوافِ صدر کب کیا جاتا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Tawaf al-Wida (the Farewell Tawaf), also known as Tawaf al-Sadr (Tawaf of Leaving). This is performed by Hajj pilgrims just before leaving Makkah after completing the Hajj.

mcqs.question_en: Which pillar of Islam is an exhibition of brotherhood, equality punctuality and discipline?
mcqs.question_ur: اسلام کا کون سا ستون بھائی چارے، مساوات وقت کی پابندی اور نظم و ضبط کا مظہر ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The pilgrimage of Hajj , which is one of the Five Pillars of Islam, serves as an exhibition of brotherhood, equality, punctuality, and discipline.

mcqs.question_en: Which tawaf is also called Tawaf-e-Ifadah or Tawaf-e-Rukn?
mcqs.question_ur: کس طواف کو طوافِ افادہ یا طوافِ رُکن بھی کہتے ہیں؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Tawaf-e-Ziyarat or Tawaf-e-Ifadah is also known as Tawaf-e-Rukn.

mcqs.question_en: Tawaf-e-Rukn is which component of Hajj?
mcqs.question_ur: طواف رکن حج کا کون سا حصہ ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Tawaf-e-Ziyarat : The Tawaf performed after Waqof-e-'Arafat. It is also known as Tawaf-e-Rukn for it is Farz ( Divine Obligation ) in Hajj.

mcqs.question_en: The small piece of land between Rukn-e-Islam and Rukn-e-Yamani is called?
mcqs.question_ur: رکنِ اسلام اور رکنِ یمانی کے درمیان زمین کے چھوٹے ٹکڑے کو کہتے ہیں؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The small piece of land between Rukn-e-Islam (the Black Stone) and Rukn-e-Yamani (the Yemeni Corner) is known as the "Hatim" or "Hijr Isma'il."

mcqs.question_en: After which rite of Hajj, the Talbiyah is to be stopped?
mcqs.question_ur: حج کی کس مناسک کے بعد تلبیہ پڑھنا چھوڑنا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation After the ritual of throwing pebbles at the Jamarat (the three pillars representing Satan) on the 10th day of Dhu al-Hijjah , pilgrims participating in Hajj are instructed to stop reciting the Talbiyah . This act is known as " Ramy al-Jamarat".

mcqs.question_en: Who firstly fixed boundaries of Haram, the 3rd circle around the Kaaba?
mcqs.question_ur: کعبہ کے گرد تیسرے دائرہ حرم کی حدود سب سے پہلے کس نے طے کیں؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The fixing of the boundaries of Haram , including the 3rd circle around the Kaaba, is associated with Hazrat Adam (AS).

mcqs.question_en: Which mosque is situated in Mina?
mcqs.question_ur: منیٰ میں کون سی مسجد ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Al Khaif Mosque is situated in Mina where pilgrims offer their prayers during their stay at Mina. It is 25,000 square meters in area and can accommodate 25,000 pilgrims.

mcqs.question_en: When did angels construct the House of Allah
mcqs.question_ur: فرشتوں نے اللہ کا گھر کب بنایا؟
options: 2000 years before the creation of Hazrat Adam (AS)
3000 years before the creation of Hazrat Adam (AS)
4000 years before the creation of Hazrat Adam (AS)
5000 years before the creation of Hazrat Adam (AS)
mcqs.correct_answer: 2000 years before the creation of Hazrat Adam (AS)
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The angels , under the command of Allah , constructed the House of Allah , the Kaaba , before the creation of Adam (AS) .

mcqs.question_en: Hajj is Farz ________ in the Muslim’s life who is capable to do so.
mcqs.question_ur: حج کتنی بار فرض ہے مسلمان کی زندگی میں جو اس کی استطاعت رکھتا ہو۔
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Hajj is Farz (obligatory) once in a lifetime for a Muslim who is capable to do so.

mcqs.question_en: Tawaf-e-Sadr is also called?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation I t is a farewell Tawaf and is performed as a final ritual of Hajj when a pilgrim leaves Makkah. It is wajib. To perform Tawaf Al-Wada, Muslims are directed to circumambulate the Holy Kaaba seven times and pray two Rakats (only if one wants to, as it is not mandatory).

mcqs.question_en: When Tawaf-e-Qudum is performed?
mcqs.question_ur: طواف قدوم کب کیا جاتا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Tawaf al-Qudum should be performed by pilgrims the moment they enter the premises of Masjid al-Haram (the Grand Mosque) in Makkah, Saudi Arabia.

mcqs.question_en: Which rite of Hajj is celebrated throughout the world by Muslims?
mcqs.question_ur: حج کی کون سی رسم پوری دنیا میں مسلمان مناتے ہیں؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The rite of Hajj celebrated throughout the world by Muslims is the Eid al-Adha, also known as the Festival of Sacrifice. This celebration takes place on the 10th day of Dhu al-Hijjah .

mcqs.question_en: What is/are the condition(s) to perform Hajj for a Muslim?
mcqs.question_ur: مسلمان کے لیے حج کرنے کی کیا شرطیں ہیں؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The conditions to perform Hajj for a Muslim include: Islam : The individual must be a Muslim . Maturity : The person should be mentally and physically mature. Financial Capability : The individual must have the financial means to undertake the journey without causing hardship to themselves or their dependents. Physical Capability : The person should be physically capable of performing the pilgrimage, and having the provisions for travel is part of this readiness. Freedom : The individual should be free, both physically and legally, to undertake the journey.

mcqs.question_en: Where did Hazrat Hawa A.S and Hazrat Adam A.S reunite after years of wanderings?
mcqs.question_ur: حضرت حوا علیہ السلام اور حضرت آدم علیہ السلام برسوں کے چکر کے بعد کہاں ملے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Hazrat Hawwa (Eve) and Hazrat Adam (Adam) reunited at the plain of Arafat after years of wanderings. The story symbolizes their reconciliation and repentance after being separated due to their initial dwelling in Paradise and subsequent descent to Earth.

mcqs.question_en: Which is the holiest and most sacred spot on the surface of the earth for Muslims?
mcqs.question_ur: مسلمانوں کے لیے روئے زمین پر سب سے مقدس اور مقدس ترین مقام کون سا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Mecca is considered the holiest city in Islam , as it is home to Islam's holiest site Kaaba in Al-Masjid Al-Ḥaram (The Sacred Mosque).

mcqs.question_en: In the first ever Hajj in Islam (in 9 AH) it’s Ameer was?
mcqs.question_ur: اسلام میں سب سے پہلے حج (9 ہجری میں) کیا یہ امیر تھا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Muslim tradition ascribes the first Hajj caravan to the lifetime of the Islamic Prophet Muhammad SAW , who in 630 ( AH 9 ) instructed Ameer Hazrat Abu Bakr to lead 300 pilgrims from Medina to Mecca.

mcqs.question_en: Which Ibadat is the best demonstration of unity, confederation and equality of the Islamic world?
mcqs.question_ur: عالم اسلام کے اتحاد و اتفاق اور مساوات کا بہترین مظاہرہ کون سی عبادت ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Hajj is considered the best demonstration of unity, confederation, and equality in the Islamic world. During Hajj , Muslims from diverse backgrounds, cultures, and nations gather in Makkah to perform the pilgrimage rituals together, emphasizing the universal brotherhood and equality among believers.

mcqs.question_en: Hujjaj stay at Mina for one day, the second day and the final day encampment is done for a night at Muzdalifah; its called?
mcqs.question_ur: حجاج منیٰ میں ایک دن، دوسرے دن اور آخری دن مزدلفہ میں ایک رات قیام کرتا ہے۔  یہ کہا جاتا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The encampment at Muzdalifah for one night during Hajj is called " Wuquf ." Pilgrims spend the night at Muzdalifah on the 9th and 10th days of Dhu al-Hijjah. Engaging in the ritual of Wuquf , which involves standing in prayer, supplication, and collecting pebbles for the symbolic stoning of the Jamarat .

mcqs.question_en: At what place, pilgrims offer two Raka’at Nafl?
mcqs.question_ur: حجاج کرام کس جگہ دو رکعت نفل ادا کرتے ہیں؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Pilgrims offer two Raka'at Nafl (voluntary prayers) at the Maqam Ibrahim.

mcqs.question_en: The old name of Makkah is Bakkah. Which of the following statement is true regarding Makkah?
mcqs.question_ur: مکہ مکرمہ کا پرانا نام بکّہ ہے۔  مندرجہ ذیل میں سے کون سا قول مکہ کے متعلق صحیح ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Makkah has been mentioned in the Holy Qur'an in many names such as Makkah, Bakkah, Al-Balad Al-Amen, Al-Balad Al-Ameen, Al-Haram Al-Amen and Umm Al-Qura.

mcqs.question_en: Which place is called Miqat for pilgrims coming from Pakistan?
mcqs.question_ur: پاکستان سے آنے والے زائرین کے لیے میقات کس جگہ کو کہتے ہیں؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Meeqat for the people of PAKISTAN is Yalamlam Zul Halifa for Madina people *** Typically there are 5 Miqats 1. Yalamlam Miqat : This is the Miqat for the people of Yemen, India, Pakistan, China, South Africa, Nigeria, Japan. 2. Al-Juhfah : This Miqat is also known as Rabigh . This is the Miqat for the people of North America, North Africa, Jordan, Lebanon, Europe, Turkey, Syria, Egypt, Algeria, Sudan. 3. Dhat Irq : This is the Miqat for the people of Iraq, Iran, China, and Russia. 4. Qarn Al-Manazil (Miqat Taif) : This Miqat is also known as Al Sail Al Kabir . This is the Miqat for the people of U.A.E, Oman, Pakistan, Australia, Malaysia, Singapore, Najd, Riyadh, Dammam, and Khobar. 5. Dhul Hulayfah: This Miqat is also known as Abyar Ali . This Miqat is for the people of Medina .

mcqs.question_en: When the House of Allah disappeared?
mcqs.question_ur: اللہ کا گھر کب غائب ہوا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation In the time of Hazrat Noah AS times House of Allah disappeared.

mcqs.question_en: Type of Hajj performed by prophet Muhammad PBUH was?
mcqs.question_ur: نبی کریم صلی اللہ علیہ وسلم کا حج کس قسم کا تھا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation A person who has an intention to offer Umra and Hajj at Meeqat is called Qaran A person who has an intention to offer only Umra at Meeqat is called Mutamtae A person who has an intention to offer only Hajj at Meeqat is called Mufrid

mcqs.question_en: What is meant by Hajj e Asghar?
mcqs.question_ur: حج اصغر سے کیا مراد ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation " Hajj e Asghar " is a term sometimes used to refer to Umrah . A pilgrimage to Makkah that can be undertaken at any time of the year. " Asghar" means smaller or minor , emphasizing that Umrah is a lesser pilgrimage compared to the major pilgrimage of Hajj.

mcqs.question_en: Which place is called Miqat for pilgrims coming from Iraq?
mcqs.question_ur: عراق سے آنے والے زائرین کے لیے میقات کس جگہ کو کہتے ہیں؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Typically there are 5 Miqats 1. Yalamlam Miqat : This is the Miqat for the people of Yemen, India, Pakistan, China, South Africa, Nigeria, Japan. 2. Al-Juhfah : This Miqat is also known as Rabigh . This is the Miqat for the people of North America, North Africa, Jordan, Lebanon, Europe, Turkey, Syria, Egypt, Algeria, Sudan. 3. Dhat Irq : This is the Miqat for the people of Iraq, Iran, China, and Russia. 4. Qarn Al-Manazil (Miqat Taif) : This Miqat is also known as Al Sail Al Kabir . This is the Miqat for the people of U.A.E, Oman, Pakistan, Australia, Malaysia, Singapore, Najd, Riyadh, Dammam, and Khobar. 5. Dhul Hulayfah: This Miqat is also known as Abyar Ali . This Miqat is for the people of Medina .

mcqs.question_en: Which is an annual congregational Ibadat?
mcqs.question_ur: سالانہ اجتماعی عبادات کون سی ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Every year, the events of Hajj take place in a ten-day period. It starting on 1 and ending on 10 Dhu al-Hijjah. The 9th Dhul-Hijjah is known as Day of Arafah , and this day is called the day of Hajj.

mcqs.question_en: Which of the following Tawaf is Sunnah?
mcqs.question_ur: مندرجہ ذیل میں سے کون سا طواف سنت ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Tawaf-e-Qudoom is the circumambulation around the Kaaba performed upon arrival in Makkah during Hajj or Umrah.

mcqs.question_en: What is meant by Tawaf-e-Widah?
mcqs.question_ur: طواف وداع سے کیا مراد ہے؟
options: First Tawaf on presence at Kabba
Second Tawaf on presence at Kabba
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Tawaf-e-Widah , also known as the Farewell Tawaf. It is the circumambulation around the Kaaba that pilgrims perform before leaving Makkah at the conclusion of their Hajj or Umrah.

mcqs.question_en: What is meant by Tawaf-e-Qadoom?
mcqs.question_ur: طواف قدوم سے کیا مراد ہے؟
options: First Tawaf on presence at Kabba
Second Tawaf on presence at Kabba
mcqs.correct_answer: First Tawaf on presence at Kabba
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Tawaf-e-Qadoom refers to the circumambulation around the Kaaba performed upon entering Makkah.

mcqs.question_en: During Hajj hunting animals is?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation During Hajj, hunting animals is prohibited . Hunting animals is forbidden during Hajj while in the state of ihram. This includes hunting in the Haram zone, even if the hunter is not in ihram.

mcqs.question_en: Jamarat which is nearest to Makkah is called?
mcqs.question_ur: مکہ مکرمہ سے قریب ترین جمرات کسے کہتے ہیں؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The Jamarat nearest to Makkah is called " Jamarat al-Uqbah."

mcqs.question_en: The smallest Jamarat is called?
mcqs.question_ur: سب سے چھوٹی جمرات کسے کہتے ہیں؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The smallest Jamarat is called Jamarat-ul-Sughra and Jamarat-ul-Oola

mcqs.question_en: Three upright stones are called?
mcqs.question_ur: تین سیدھے پتھروں کو کہتے ہیں؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The three upright stones are called " Jamarat ". It stoned by pilgrims during the ritual in Mina .

mcqs.question_en: When is the stoning of Jamarat performed during Hajj?
mcqs.question_ur: حج کے دوران جمرات کی رجم کب ہوتی ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The stoning of Jamarat is performed during Hajj on the days of Eid al-Adha , specifically on the 10th, 11th, and 12th days of Zul-Hajj.

mcqs.question_en: What does the term Jamarat refer to in Hajj?
mcqs.question_ur: حج میں جمرات سے کیا مراد ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Jamarat in Hajj involves stoning three pillars in Mina. It symbolizing the rejection of temptations. It commemorating Prophet Ibrahim's defiance against Satan.

mcqs.question_en: What is most important step after Waquf?
mcqs.question_ur: وقوف کے بعد سب سے اہم مرحلہ کیا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Tawaf involves circumambulating the Kaaba seven times in a counterclockwise direction. It is symbolizing unity, submission. It is external nature of worship in Islam.

mcqs.question_en: How many Meeqats of Kaaba?
mcqs.question_ur: کعبہ کے کتنے میقات ہیں؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The five miqats for pilgrims performing Hajj or Umrah are; 1. Dhul Hulayfa 2. Al-Juhfa 3. Qarn al-Manazil 4. Yalamlam 5. Dhat Irq

mcqs.question_en: From Mina, Muzdalfa is______miles away.
mcqs.question_ur: منیٰ سے مزدلفہ _____ میل دور ہے۔
mcqs.explanation: Explanation From Mina , Muzdalifa is a location located 3 miles away from Makkah in Saudi Arabia.

mcqs.question_en: Muzdalfa is located_____miles away from Makkah.
mcqs.question_ur: مزدلفہ مکہ مکرمہ سے _____ میل دور واقع ہے۔
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Muzdalifa is a location located 6 miles away from Makkah in Saudi Arabia.

mcqs.question_en: How many undesirable acts of Ihram are there?
mcqs.question_ur: احرام کے کتنے ناپسندیدہ اعمال ہیں؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The six undesirable acts of Ihram, also known as the prohibitions , include: 1. Clipping the nails 2. Removing hair 3. Wearing perfume 4. Wearing stitched clothing 5. Hunting 6. Engaging in marital relations

mcqs.question_en: How many permitted acts of Ihram are there?
mcqs.question_ur: احرام کے کتنے جائز اعمال ہیں؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The four permitted acts of Ihram are: 1. Waring the prescribed clothing : Pilgrims wear two pieces of white, seamless cloth. 2. Talbiyah : Reciting the specific supplication expressing the intention for Hajj or Umrah. 3. Trimming or shaving the hair : Pilgrims typically trim or shave their hair as a symbolic act of humility. 4. Certain restrictions : Avoiding specific actions, such as cutting nails, using scented products, or engaging in marital relations during the pilgrimage.

mcqs.question_en: Muzdalfa is a?
mcqs.question_ur: مزدلفہ ایک ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Muzdalifah is located between Arafat and Mina. Pilgrims spend the night here on the 9th Zul-Hijjah after leaving Arafat . They collect pebbles for the ritual of Stoning the Devil at Mina. Maghrib and Isha prayers are performed at Muzdalifah . After Muzdalifah , pilgrims proceed to Mina for the Stoning of the Devil.

mcqs.question_en: On Hajj day (9th Zul-Hajj) Imam leads_____prayers at Arafat which are offered jointly pilgrims.
mcqs.question_ur: حج کے دن (9 ذی الحج) کو امام عرفات میں کونسی نماز کی امامت کرتے ہیں جو حاجیوں کے مشترکہ طور پر ادا کی جاتی ہے۔
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Arafat is a plain near Mecca . Pilgrims stand in prayerful reflection during the Wuquf at Arafat on the 9th day of Dhu al-Hijjah. It is a day of repentance and seeking forgiveness. Prophet Muhammad (PBUH) delivered his Farewell Sermon at Arafat . Pilgrims gather here (Arafat) to fulfill a major Hajj ritual before moving to Muzdalifah

mcqs.question_en: How many Khutbas at Masjid-e-Nimra are recited during Hajj?
mcqs.question_ur: حج کے دوران مسجد نمرہ میں کتنے خطبے پڑھے جاتے ہیں؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Masjid-e-Nimra is a mosque near Arafat in Mecca. Pilgrims gather at Masjid-e-Nimra on the 9th day of Dhu al-Hijjah. It is also known as the " Musalla ". The Prophet Muhammad (PBUH) delivered his Farewell Sermon at this location. Pilgrims perform Dhuhr and Asr prayers combined at Masjid-e-Nimra during Hajj.

mcqs.question_en: What is the meaning of Hijr-e-Aswad ?
mcqs.question_ur: حجر اسود کا کیا مطلب ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation What is the meaning of Hajr-e-Aswad? Black Stone

mcqs.question_en: How many Khutba are recited during Hajj?
mcqs.question_ur: حج کے دوران کتنے خطبے پڑھے جاتے ہیں؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation One khutba is recited during Hajj. Al-Imran is the surah in which Hajj is commanded. Holy Prophet (PBUH) sacrificed 63 camels during hajj. Adam and Hazrat Hawa performed the first ever Hajj .

mcqs.question_en: Where do the Pilgrims go from Arafat?
mcqs.question_ur: حجاج عرفات سے کہاں جاتے ہیں؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation After spending the day at Arafat during the Hajj pilgrimage, pilgrims proceed to Muzdalifah . This symbolic journey is an integral part of the Hajj rituals, following the traditions of Prophet Muhammad SAW.

mcqs.question_en: From where does Sayee commence?
mcqs.question_ur: سعی کہاں سے شروع ہوتی ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Sayee , which is the act of walking seven times back and forth between the hills of Safa and Marwah , begins at Safa and concludes at Marwah . Pilgrims start at Safa and complete the seven rounds, finishing at Marwah during the Hajj pilgrimage.

mcqs.question_en: How many rounds are paid between Safaa and Marwa during Hajj?
mcqs.question_ur: حج کے دوران صفا اور مروہ کے درمیان کتنے چکر لگائے جاتے ہیں؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation During the Hajj pilgrimage, pilgrims perform seven rounds of Tawaf around the Kaaba . Tawaf is the act of walking around the Kaaba in a counterclockwise direction , and it is an integral part of the pilgrimage rituals.

mcqs.question_en: Rami is held during Hajj at?
mcqs.question_ur: رمی حج کے دوران کہاں منعقد ہوتی ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Rami al-Jamarat sometimes referred to as the “ Stoning of the Devil ” is a rite carried out by Hajj pilgrims whereby small pebbles are thrown at three stone structures in Mina . The act of throwing stones at the Jamarat is known as “ Rami ”.

mcqs.question_en: After performing Sayee Hujjaj go to?
mcqs.question_ur: سعی حجاج ادا کرنے کے بعد کہاں جائیں گے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation After performing Sayee , Hujjaj (pilgrims) typically go to Mina . Mina is one of the locations where certain rituals of Hajj are performed, and it is visited after completing the Sa'i between Safa and Marwah .

mcqs.question_en: What is Yum-ul-Tarvia?
mcqs.question_ur: یوم الطرویہ کیا ہے؟
options: Staying at Mina After Isha on 8th Zul-Hajj
Staying at Arafat before Maghrib on 8th Zul-Hajj
Staying at Muzdalfa After Fajur on 8th Zul-Hajj
mcqs.correct_answer: Staying at Mina After Isha on 8th Zul-Hajj
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Yawm al-Tarwiyah ," it is the 8th day of Dhu al-Hijjah. Pilgrims in Mecca enter into a state of ihram on this day, making preparations for the upcoming Hajj rites.

mcqs.question_en: Which Kalimah is recited during Hajj on way to Mina?
mcqs.question_ur: منیٰ جاتے ہوئے حج کے دوران کون سا کلمہ پڑھا جاتا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Kalma e Touheed is recited during Hajj on the way to Mina. لَآ اِلٰهَ اِلَّا اللهُ وَحْدَهٗ لَا شَرِيْكَ لَهٗ لَهُ الْمُلْكُ وَ لَهُ الْحَمْدُ يُحْىٖ وَ يُمِيْتُ وَ هُوَحَیٌّ لَّا يَمُوْتُ اَبَدًا اَبَدًاؕ ذُو الْجَلَالِ وَالْاِكْرَامِؕ بِيَدِهِ الْخَيْرُؕ وَهُوَ عَلٰى كُلِّ شیْ ٍٔ قَدِیْرٌؕ

mcqs.question_en: Which stone of Kaaba wall is kissed?
mcqs.question_ur: خانہ کعبہ کے کس پتھر کو چوما؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The stone of the Kaaba wall that is kissed is called " Hijr-e-Aswad ." Pilgrims often seek to touch or kiss the Black Stone (Hijr-e-Aswad) during the Tawaf.

mcqs.question_en: After completing the seven rounds of Kaaba where do the Hajji go?
mcqs.question_ur: خانہ کعبہ کے سات چکر مکمل کرنے کے بعد حاجی کہاں جائیں گے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation After completing the seven rounds (Tawaf) around the Kaaba , Hajj pilgrims proceed to perform the Sa'i , walking seven times back and forth between the hills of Safa and Marwah.

mcqs.explanation: Explanation The first and innermost circle around Kaaba is? Masjid-e-Haram The second circle around Kaaba is? Makkah Mukaramah The third circle around Kaba is? Haram The fourth circle around Kaba is? Mowaqeet

mcqs.explanation: Explanation The first and innermost circle around Kaaba is? Masjid-e-Haram The second circle around Kaaba is? Makkah Mukaramah The third circle around Kaba is? Haram The fourth circle around Kaba is? Mowaqeet

mcqs.question_en: Prohibitions and restrictions of Ihram are?

mcqs.question_en: The Stoning of the Devil ritual is performed at the Jamarat, which is located in _________ near Mecca.
mcqs.question_ur: شیطان کو سنگسار کرنے کی رسم جمرات میں ادا کی جاتی ہے جو مکہ کے قریب کس جگہ واقع ہے۔
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The Stoning of the Devil ritual is performed at the Jamarat, which is located in Mina, near Mecca. mcqs.question_en: What is the Qur’anic argument on the Life Hereafter? What are its impacts on the individual and collective life of a human being?
mcqs.question_ur: اخروی زندگی کے بارے میں قرآنی استدلال کیا ہے ؟اس کے انفرادی اور اجتماعی زندگی پر کیا اثرات مرتب ہوتے ہیں؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation What is the Qur’anic argument on the Life Hereafter? What are its impacts on the individual and collective life of a human being? (20 marks) Qur'anic Argument on the Life Hereafter Purpose and Accountability : The Qur'an states that life is a test and that humans are created to worship and obey God. Accountability in the Hereafter ensures every action is rewarded or punished. "Do you think that We created you in play (without any purpose)?" (Qur'an 23:115). Resurrection and Divine Justice : The Qur'an highlights resurrection as a demonstration of God's power, ensuring ultimate justice. "And to Allah belongs the Hereafter and the former (life)" (Qur'an 53:25). "The Day when everyone will be paid in full for what they have earned" (Qur'an 3:185). Natural Signs as Evidence : The Qur'an frequently points to signs in nature (e.g., plants revived from dead soil) as evidence of resurrection. "Look at the earth, how We bring life to it after its death" (Qur'an 30:19). Impacts on Individual Life Moral Accountability : Awareness of judgment day fosters honesty, integrity, and a strong moral compass. Encouragement of Good Deeds : Promotes acts of charity, kindness, and patience due to the promise of reward. Inner Peace : Belief in divine justice brings comfort in facing life's hardships and injustices. Impacts on Collective Life Promotion of Justice and Social Welfare : Encourages fair dealings and the establishment of justice in society. Strengthening of Social Bonds : Compassion and charity are encouraged, creating trust and support within communities. Discouragement of Social Vices : Reduces crimes, corruption, and exploitation by instilling fear of accountability. In essence, belief in the Hereafter shapes ethical, social, and spiritual behaviors, guiding both individuals and communities toward a just and compassionate society

mcqs.question_en: If the current changes from 5A to nill in five seconds in a coil of 500 volts, then the self-inductance is _____ Henry?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation To find the self-inductance of a coil, we can use the formula: L = (ΔΦ / ΔI) Where: L is the self-inductance in Henry (H), ΔΦ is the change in magnetic flux in Weber (Wb), and ΔI is the change in current in Ampere (A). In this case, the current changes from 5A to 0A (nil) in 5 seconds . (ΔI) is therefore 5A - 0A = 5A. To find the change in (ΔΦ), we can use Faraday's law of electromagnetic induction ΔΦ = L * ΔI Since the current changes from 5A to 0A in 5 seconds , the rate of  (ΔI) is 5A / 5s = 1A/s. Substituting the values into the equation: ΔΦ = L * ΔI 500 V = L * 1 A/s Since the (V) is equal to  (L) and  (ΔI), we can rewrite the equation as: L = 500 V / 1 A/s Simplifying the equation gives us: L = 500 H Therefore, the self-inductance of the coil is 500 Henry (H).

mcqs.question_en: The voltage across the 100W conductor is 250V. The current is _____?
mcqs.explanation: Explanation To find the current flowing through the conductor, you can use Ohm's Law, which states: Voltage (V) = Current (I) × Resistance (R) Voltage (V) = Current (I) × Resistance (R) Given that the power (P) of the conductor is 100 W 100 W , and the voltage (V) is 250 V 250 V , you can use the formula: Power (P) = Voltage (V) × Current (I) Power (P) = Voltage (V) × Current (I) Solve for current (I): Current (I) = Power (P) Voltage (V) Current (I) = Voltage (V) Power (P) ​ Substitute the given values: Current (I) = 100 W 250 V = 0.4 A Current (I) = 250 V 100 W ​ = 0.4 A So, the current flowing through the conductor is 0.4 A 0.4 A .

mcqs.question_en: Who met Hazrat Muhammad (SAW) at the first heaven during Miraj?
mcqs.question_ur: معراج کے دوران پہلے آسمان پر حضرت محمد صلی اللہ علیہ وسلم سے کس کی ملاقات ہوئی؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The Miraj event took place on the 27th of Rajab in the 10th (621 A.D) year of Prophethood. Prophet Muhammad (SAW) was staying at the house of Umm Hani on the night of Miraj. That night, Angel Jibreel came to the Prophet (SAW) and took him on the journey of Israa and Miraj. During Miraj, Hazrat Adam and Hazrat Muhammad (SAW) met at the first heaven. The event is mentioned in Surah Bani Israel. It is also known as 'Isra and Mi'raj' or 'Shab-e-Meraj'. Isra : Night journey from Makkah to Masjid Al-Aqsa. Mi’raj : Journey from Masjid Al-Aqsa to the heavens. Gifts of the 27th of Rajab : The five prescribed daily prayers. The last part of the chapter of Al-Baqara (Amanar-Rasulu).

Bait Rizwan was the pledge taken to get revenge on Hazrat Usman (RA) under the tree known as Rizwan Bait-e-Rizwan is also known as Bait-e-Shajra made under the Keekar tree. On this occasion, Muhammad gathered his nearly 1,400 Sahaba and called them to pledge to fight until death and revenge the death of Hazrat Usman ****** ND-21-5-2023

mcqs.question_en: The name of lbn-e- Hisham's famous book is:
mcqs.question_ur: ابن ہشام کی مشہور کتاب کا نام  ۔ ۔۔ ۔۔ ہے
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Al-Sirah al-Nabawiyyah As- Sīrah an-Nabawiyyah (السيرة النبوية), 'The Life of the Prophet'; is an edited recension of Ibn Isḥāq's classic Sīratu Rasūli l-Lāh (سيرة رسول الله) 'The Life of God's Messenger'. Ibn Isḥāq's now lost work survives only in Ibn Hishām's and al-Tabari's recensions, although fragments of several others survive, and Ibn Hishām and al-Tabarī s hare virtually the same material.

mcqs.question_en: How many Surahs are in 30th Chapter (Parah) of Quran?

mcqs.explanation: Explanation Total Surah in Quran = 114 Total Parah in Quran = 30 Total Ayat = 6666 Rakoh= 558

mcqs.question_en: What is the Ratio of Zakat in grams on Gold?
mcqs.question_ur: سونے پر گرام میں زکوٰۃ کا تناسب  ۔ ۔ ۔۔ ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation If you have 7.5 tola/3 ounces/87.48 grams of gold or 52.5 tota/21 ounces/612.36 grams of silver or its cash equivalent for a full lunar year, then you are considered Sahib-e-Nisab and should pay Zakat 2.5%

mcqs.question_en: Which of the following has the holiest places for Muslims?

mcqs.explanation: Explanation Makkah and Madina , both holiest places for Muslims located in Saudi Arabia. Hajj is also performed in Saudi Arabia.

mcqs.explanation: Explanation Idrīs (Arabic: إدريس) is an ancient prophet mentioned in the Quran, whom Muslims believe was the third prophet after Seth. He is the second prophet mentioned in the Quran. Born Babylon, Iraq Title Prophet Predecessor Seth Successor Nuh

mcqs.question_en: Who was the first key-holder of Kaba among Quraish?
mcqs.question_ur: قریش میں کعبہ کی پہلی چابی کون رکھتا تھا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Qusay in Islam Qusayy ibn Kilab ibn Murra (Arabic: قصي ٱبن كلاب ٱبن مرة, romanized : Quṣayy ibn Kilāb ibn Murra; c. 400–480) was the 5th-century ruler of Mecca , who established the Quraysh as the dominant power in Mecca . Following his death, a succession crisis arose between his sons Abd al-Dar and al-Mughira.

mcqs.question_en: Our Holy Prophet Muhammad (SAW) had ___________ brothers and sisters.

mcqs.explanation: Explanation No actual brother and sister . Hamzah ibn ʿAbd al-Muṭṭalib was a foster brother, companion and paternal uncle of the Islamic prophet Muhammad .

mcqs.explanation: Explanation Musa is revered as a prominent prophet and messenger in Islam, and his narrative is recounted the most among the prophets in the Quran. He is regarded by Muslims as one of the five most prominent prophets in Islam, along with Jesus (Isa), Abraham (Ibrahim), Noah (Nuh) and Muhammad. 6 Miracles of Prophet Musa A.S given by Allah.

mcqs.question_en: How old was Hazrat Yousaf (peace be upon him) at the time of migration to Egypt?

mcqs.explanation: Explanation Hazrat Yousaf (peace be upon him) was approximately 17 years old when he was taken from the well Important Question about "Hazrat Yousaf (AS) Prophet Yusuf (عليه السلام) was one of the twelve sons of Prophet Yaqub (AS). mcqs.question_en: Name the mountain where the Holy Prophet (S.A.W) deputed 50 skilful archers (Teer-Andaaz) in the battle of Ohad?

mcqs.explanation: Explanation Jabal al-Rumah, also known as Jabal Ainain, is a small mountain located near Jabal Uhud where Muslim archers were positioned during the Battle of Uhud.

mcqs.question_en: What is called the seven times walks around the Kaaba?
mcqs.question_ur: خانہ کعبہ کے گرد سات بار چہل قدمی کسے کہتے ہیں؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The Tawaf is a religious ritual that involves walking around the Kaaba seven times counterclockwise. It is an obligatory part of the Hajj and Umrah pilgrimages . The northern area where pilgrims walk is called the head.

mcqs.question_en: Name the Sahabi who is a cousin and son in law of the Holy Prophet (SAW)?
mcqs.question_ur: اس صحابی کا نام بتائیں جو حضور صلی اللہ علیہ وسلم کے چچازاد بھائی اور داماد تھے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Fatimah was married in AD 624 to Ali ibn Abi Talib (l. AD 601-661), a cousin of Prophet Muhammad, and the marriage lasted to the end of her days. Hazrat Ali (R.A) was attacked with a poisoned sword On 19th Ramazan 40th Hijri, before the time of FAJAR prayers to the mosque of Kufa. He died on the 21st of Ramadan 40 A.H. He was buried in Najaf al-Ashraf (Iraq ).

mcqs.question_en: Who was the first Muhajir of Madina?
mcqs.question_ur: مدینہ کا پہلا مہاجر کون تھا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Hazrat Abu Salam (RA) Abdullah ibn Salam was a Jew in Yathrib who belonged to the Banu Qaynuqa tribe and claimed descent from Joseph. He was widely respected and honored by the people of the city, including those who were not Jewish. He was known for his piety and goodness, righteous conduct and truthfulness.

mcqs.question_en: What portion of war spoils should be deposited in Bait ul Maal???
mcqs.question_ur: مال غنیمت کا کون سا حصہ بیت المال میں جمع کیا جائے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Bayt al-mal (بيت المال) is an Arabic term that is translated as "House of money" or "House of Wealth." Historically, it was a financial institution responsible for the administration of taxes in Islamic states, particularly in the early Islamic Caliphate

mcqs.question_en: 4th source of Islamic law?

mcqs.explanation: Explanation fourth source of Sharia The primary sources of Islamic law are the Holy Book (The Quran) , The Sunnah (the traditions or known practices of the Prophet Muhammad ), Ijma ' (Consensus), and Qiyas (Analogy) Qiyas or analogical reason is the fourth source of Sharia for the majority of Sunni jurisprudence . It aims to draw analogies to a previously accepted decision

mcqs.question_en: Khyber was a stronghold of ?

mcqs.question_en: Who was the first one to embrace Islam in the land of Yemen?
mcqs.question_ur: یمن میں سب سے پہلے اسلام قبول کرنے والا کون تھا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Hazrat Abu Moosa al-Ashari (RA) was indeed a significant early convert to Islam from Yemen While not the very first individual from Yemen to embrace Islam He was later appointed as one of the governors over Yemen by the Prophet (peace be upon him) He continued to serve in that role until the caliphate of Abu Bakr. ** Hazrat Zoaib bin Kalaib (RA) played a role in the spread of Islam, but the first person to bring Islam to Yemen was not him. Hazrat Muadh ibn Jabal (RA), who was sent by the Prophet Muhammad (PBUH) to Yemen to teach Islam and collect Zakat.

mcqs.question_en: According to Islamic law the share of wife in property is,
mcqs.question_ur: اسلامی قانون کے مطابق جائیداد میں بیوی کا حصہ ہے
mcqs.explanation: Explanation In Islam, women have the right to inheritance , but Muslims usually as sign women half of the  inheritance available to men if they inherit from the s ame fathe r. For example, if the deceased has both male and female children , the proportion of sons is twice that of daughters.

mcqs.question_en: Social boycott of prophet Muhammad (PBUH) continued for how many years

The best eatable thing mentioned in Holy Quran is ? Honey.Which is the shortest Sura of Holy Quran ? Qausar ******* The word “Islam” is used 10 times in Quran. Here are 9 verses of the Quran that mention “Islam”: Quran (2:208) : يَا أَيُّهَا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا ادْخُلُوا فِي السِّلْمِ كَافَّةً وَلَا تَتَّبِعُوا خُطُوَاتِ الشَّيْطَانِ ۚ إِنَّهُ لَكُمْ عَدُوٌّ مُّبِينٌ, Quran (5:3) : الْيَوْمَ أَكْمَلْتُ لَكُمْ دِينَكُمْ وَأَتْمَمْتُ عَلَيْكُمْ نِعْمَتِي وَرَضِيتُ لَكُمُ الْإِسْلَامَ دِينًا ۚ , Quran (3:19) : إِنَّ الدِّينَ عِندَ اللَّهِ الْإِسْلَامُ ۗ, Quran (3:85) : وَمَن يَبْتَغِ غَيْرَ الْإِسْلَامِ دِينًا فَلَن يُقْبَلَ مِنْهُ وَهُوَ فِي الْآخِرَةِ مِنَ الْخَاسِرِينَ, Quran (6:125) : فَمَن يُرِدِ اللَّهُ أَن يَهْدِيَهُ يَشْرَحْ صَدْرَهُ لِلْإِسْلَامِ, Quran (9:74) : يَحْلِفُونَ بِا للَّهِ مَا قَالُوا وَلَقَدْ قَالُوا كَلِمَةَ الْكُفْرِ وَكَفَرُوا بَعْدَ إِسْلَامِهِمْ وَهَمُّوا بِمَا لَمْ يَنَالُوا, Quran (39:22) : أَفَمَن شَرَحَ اللَّهُ صَدْرَهُ لِلْإِسْلَامِ فَهُوَ عَلَىٰ نُورٍ مِّن رَّبِّهِ ۚ فَوَيْلٌ لِّلْقَاسِيَةِ قُلُوبُهُم مِّن ذِكْرِ اللَّهِ ۚ أُولَٰئِكَ فِي ضَلَالٍ مُّبِينٍ, Quran (49:17) : يَمُنُّونَ عَلَيْكَ أَنْ أَسْلَمُوا ۖ قُل لَّا تَمُنُّوا عَلَيَّ إِسْلَامَكُم ۖ بَلِ اللَّهُ يَمُنُّ عَلَيْكُمْ أَنْ هَدَاكُمْ لِلْإِيمَانِ إِن كُنتُمْ صَادِقِينَ , Quran (61:7) : وَمَنْ أَظْلَمُ مِمَّنِ افْتَرَىٰ عَلَى اللَّهِ الْكَذِبَ وَهُوَ يُدْعَىٰ إِلَى الْإِسْلَامِ ۚ وَ اللَّهُ لَا يَهْدِي الْقَوْمَ الظَّالِمِينَ ,

mcqs.explanation: Explanation Abu Trab means Father of soil Tribe Quraish Buried in Najaf Iraq

mcqs.question_en: Two essential prayer early days of Islam?

Fajr: This prayer marks the beginning of the day and is considered a way to start the day with blessings and protection from Allah Isha: This is the final prayer of the day, and it is a time for reflection, seeking forgiveness , and connecting with Allah before sleep.

mcqs.question_en: Last persian war in Hazrat Umar's era

mcqs.question_en: Is the Surah in the Holy Quran in which Hajj is commanded?
mcqs.question_ur: قرآن پاک کی کس  سورت میں حج کا حکم دیا گیا ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Surah-Al-Baqrah is the surah in which Hajj is commanded. Holy prophet sacrificed 63 camels during hajj. In Hajj there are three obligations (Farz). 1. Hajj means to intend . 2. Hajj made compulsory in 9 A.H. 3. First Hajj offered in 9 A.H. Muhammad not perform hajj this year 4. Hajj ordained in Surah Bakr. 5. The holy prophet performed only 1 Hajj in 10th A.H. 6. There are 3 types of Hajj. 7. One tawaf of Kaaba is known as Shoot. 8. Tawaf begins from Shoot. 9. Number of Jamarat is 3. 10. Mosque located in Mina is Kheef. 11. At Meekat, Hujjaj assume the state of Ihram. 12. Kalima Tauheed is recited during Hajj. 13. At Mina the ritual of offering sacrifice is performed 14. Jamart-throwing of pebbles, it is performed on 10th, 11th, 12th and 13th of Zul Hajj. 15. Maghrib and Isha both prayers are offered together at Muzdalifa on 9th Zil Hajj. 16. Yome-Afra is called to Hajj day. 17. Name of the place where the pilgrims go from Arafat: Muzdalfa. 18. First structure of Kaaba was built by Adam. 19. Ibrahim & Ismail rebuilt Kaaba 4500 years ago. 20. Yum-e-Nahar is called to the Day of Sacrifice. 21. Yum e Arafat is 9th Zul Hajj. 22. One khutba is recited during Hajj. 23. Al-Imarn is the surah in which Hajj is commanded. 24. Holy prophet sacrificed 63 camels during hajj. 25. Adam and Hazrat Hawa performed the first ever Hajj. 26. Running b/w Safa & Marwa seven times is called Sayee. 27. Most important step of Hajj after assuming Ahram is Wuquf. 28. Waqoof-e-Arfah is the Rukn-e-Azam of Hajj 29. With the performance of Rami on the 10th Zil-Hajj, the most of the bindings of Hajj on the pilgrim are released. 30. Three upright stones are called Jamarat. 31. After Waquf the most important step is Tawaf. 32. In Hajj there are three obligations (Farz). 33. Umrah can be performed at any time throughout the year except 9th to 11th Zil-Hajj. 34. Hujjaj stat at Mina for one day, the second day at Arafat and the final day, encampment is done for a night at Muzdalfah, it is called Wuquf. 35. Who said that Hajj is greatest of all worships:Imam Malik. 36. How many undesirable acts of Ihraam are there: six. 37. How many permitted acts of Ihraam are there:Four. 38. Prohibitions and restructions of Ihram are 8. 39. The first and the foremost Farz of Hajj and Umrah is Ihram. 40. The first and inner most circle around Ka’ba is Masjid-e-Haram. 41. The second circle around Kaba is Makkah Mukaramah. 42. The third circle around Kaba is Haram. 43. Who firsly fixed boundaries of Haram, the third circle around Kaaba: Adam. 44. The fourth cirle around Kaba is Mowaqeet. 45. The place where no one can advance without putting on Ihram is Mowaqeet. 46. Two thousand years before the creation of Adam, Kaba was constructed. 47. Angels built Kaba firstly in the universe. 48. During the Noah’s time Kaaba disappeared due to flood. 49. The gate which is the best for the pilgrims to enter in Kaba is Bab-e-Salam. 50. Hajr-e-Aswad means black stone. 51. Actual color of Hajr-e-Aswad was white. 52. The small piece of land b/wk Rukn-e-Islam and Rukn-e-Yamani is called Hateem. 53. The place where offering prayer is just like offering prayer inside Kaba is Hateem. 54. There are five types of Tawaf. 55. Hajji go to Al-Multazim after completing the seven rounds. 56. Al-Multazim means the place of holding. 57. The portion of the wall of Kaba which is b/w its door and Hajr-e-Aswad is called al-Multazim. 58. Sayee is commenced from Safa and ends at Marwa. 59. After performing Say’ee Hujjaj go to Mina. 60. Muzdalfa is a plain. 61. Muzdalfa is located b/w Mina & Arafat. 62. Muzdalfa is located six miles from Makkah. 63. From Mina Muzdalfa is three miles away. 64. Muzdalfa is called Sacred Monument in Quran. 65. At Muzdalfa Maghrib & Isha prayers are offered together. 66. Pebbles are collected from Muzdalfa. 67. Jamarat which is nearest to Makkah is called Jamarat-ul-Uqba. 68. Smallest Jamarat is Jamarat-al-Sughra. 69. Rami is held at Mina. 70. Talbiah is stopped after Rami. 71. Afrad, Qar’ran and Tamatae are the types of Hajj. 72. Dhulhulaifah is the Meeqat for the people of Pakistan. 73. Dhulhulaifah is a point six mile from Madina.

mcqs.explanation: Explanation The fourth kalima is also referred to as Tauheed or Tawheed , meaning " unification of oneness of God ." 1. كَلِمَاتْ اَلطَّيِّبَة Kalimat aṭ-Ṭayyibah (Word of Purity) 2. كَلِمَاتْ اَلشَّهَادَة Kalimat ash-Shahādah (Word of Testimony) 3. كَلِمَاتْ اَلتَّمْجِيدْ Kalimat at-Tamjīd (Word of Majesty) 4. كَلِمَاتْ اَلتَّوْحِيدْ Kalimat at-Tawḥīd (Word of Oneness) 5. كَلِمَاتْ إِسْتِغْفَارْ Kalimat ʾIstighfār (Word of Penitence) 6. كَلِمَاتْ رَدّْ اَلْكُفْرْ Kalimat Radd al-Kufr (Word of Rejection of Disbelief)

mcqs.question_en: Which Masjid has the tallest Minaret in the world
mcqs.question_ur: دنیا کا سب سے اونچا مینار کس مسجد میں ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The tallest minaret in the world is the minaret of the Djamaa el Djazaïr in Algiers, Algeria. which stands at 265 metres (870 ft) . The tallest minaret in the world built of bricks is the 73 metres (240 ft) tall Qutb Minar in Delhi, India

mcqs.question_en: The Friday Mosque, located in ___________?
mcqs.question_ur: جمعہ کی مسجد، جو ___________ میں واقع ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The Jāmeh Mosque of Isfahān also known as the Atiq Mosque and the Friday Mosque. Located in Isfahan, Iran.

mcqs.question_en: Great Mosque of Cordoba is located in ________?
mcqs.question_ur: قرطبہ کی عظیم مسجد ________ میں واقع ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The earliest parts of the Great Mosque of Cordoba, located in Spain, were built on the site of a Christian church by the Umayyad ruler Abd al-Rahman I in 784–786.

mcqs.question_en: Which was the favourite month of Hazrat Muhammad ﷺ?
mcqs.question_ur: حضرت محمد ﷺ کا پسندیدہ مہینہ کون سا تھا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Shaʽban is the eighth month of the Islamic calendar. It is the month of "separation", so called because the pagan Arabs used to disperse in search of water. The fifteenth night of this month is known as the "Night of Records". However, observance of this day is disputed.

mcqs.question_en: Name the First Jannati Shaheed who neither offered any prayer nor kept any fast?
mcqs.question_ur: پہلے جنتی شہید کا نام بتائیں جنہوں نے نہ کوئی نماز پڑھی اور نہ ہی کوئی روزہ رکھا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation حصین کہتے ہیں کہ میں نے محمود بن لبید سے پوچھا کہ اصیرم کا کیا واقعہ ہوا تھا؟ انہوں نے فرمایا کہ وہ اپنی قوم کے سامنے اسلام لانے سے انکار کرتا تھا غزوہ احد کے موقع پر نبی کریم (صلی اللہ علیہ وسلم) جب جبل احد کی طرف ہوئے تو اسے اسلام کی طرف رغبت ہوئی اور اس نے اسلام قبول کر لیا پھر تلوار پکڑی اور روانہ ہو گیا۔ وہ لوگوں کے پاس پہنچا اور لوگوں کی صفوں میں گھس گیا اور اس بے جگری سے لڑا کہ بالآخر زخمی ہو کر گر پڑا بنو عبد الاشہل کے لوگ جب اپنے مقتولوں کو تلاش کر رہے تھے تو انہیں میدان جنگ میں وہ بھی پڑا نظر آیا وہ کہنے لگے کہ واللہ یہ تو اصیرم ہے لیکن یہ یہاں کیسے آ گیا؟ جب ہم اسے چھوڑ کر آئے تھے تو اس وقت تک یہ اس دین کا منکر تھا پھر انہوں نے اس سے پوچھا کہ عمرو! تم یہاں کیسے آ گئے؟ اپنی قوم کا دفاع کرنے کے لیے یا اسلام کی کشش کی وجہ سے؟ اس نے کہا کہ اسلام کی کشش کی وجہ سے میں اللہ اور اس کے رسول پر ایمان لے آیا اور میں مسلمان ہو گیا پھر اپنی تلوار پکڑی اور روانہ ہو گیا اور نبی کریم (صلی اللہ علیہ وسلم) کے ہمراہ جہاد میں شرکت کی اب جو مجھے زخم لگنے تھے وہ لگ گئے تھوڑی دیر میں وہ ان کے ہاتھوں میں دم توڑ گیا لوگوں نے نبی کریم (صلی اللہ علیہ وسلم) سے اس کا تذکرہ کیا تو نبی کریم (صلی اللہ علیہ وسلم) نے فرمایا کہ وہ اہل جنت میں سے ہے

mcqs.question_en: In how many years Makhi Surahs were revealed?
mcqs.question_ur: مکی سورتیں کتنے سالوں میں نازل ہوئیں؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Madani Surahs revealed in Year = 10 Makkii Surahs revealed in Year = 13

mcqs.question_en: Who was made governor of south Yemen by Holy Prophet?
mcqs.question_ur: حضور صلی اللہ علیہ وسلم نے جنوبی یمن کا گورنر کس کو بنایا تھا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Muadh ibn Jabal was a sahabi of the Islamic prophet Muhammad. Muadh was an Ansar of Banu Khazraj and compiled the Quran with five companions while Muhammad was still alive . He was known as the one with a lot of knowledge. He was called by Muhammad "the one who will lead the scholars into Paradise."

mcqs.explanation: Explanation Hazrat Umeh Habiba (RA) was 8 th wife of Prophetﷺ She was 3 6 years old a t the time of Nikah and Muhammad ﷺ was 60 years ago she married Prophetﷺ in 7 A.H. She was the daughter of Abu Sufyan Her first husband was Ubayd-Allah ibn Jahsh a brother of Zaynab bint Jahsh Additional Information: Nabi e Akram (ﷺ) had eleven (11) wives also known as “Azwaaj e Mutahharaat”

mcqs.question_ur: پاکستان نے او آئی سی میں پہلی مرتبہ ’اسلامو فوبیا سے نمٹنے کا عالمی دن‘ منانے کے لیے کب  شمولیت اختیار کی۔
mcqs.explanation: Explanation In line with Prime Minister Imran Khan's vision, Pakistan had presented a resolution to designate March 15 as ‘ International Day to Combat Islamophobia’ , at the 47th Session of the OIC Council of Foreign Ministers (CFM) held in Niamey on November 27-28, 2020.

mcqs.question_en: Which country has recently relaxed Islamic laws to “boost tolerance”?
mcqs.question_ur: کس ملک نے حال ہی میں \"رواداری کو فروغ دینے\" کے لیے اسلامی قوانین میں نرمی کی ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The United Arab Emirates announced on November 7, 2020 a major overhaul of the country`s Islamic personal laws, allowing unmarried couples to cohabitate , loosening alcohol restrictions and criminalizing honor killings. mcqs.question_en: Who was the first Muslim Caliph of Spain?

mcqs.question_ur: لفظ \"تذیر\" __________________ سے ماخوذ ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation In Islamic Law, tazir (or ta'zir, Arabic) refers to punishment, usually corporal, that can be administered at the discretion of the judge, as opposed to the hudud (singular: hadd), the punishments for certain offenses that are fixed by the Qur'an or Hadith.

mcqs.question_en: The Qisas and Diyat Ordinances were enforced in Pakistan on___________?
mcqs.question_ur: قصاص اور دیت آرڈیننس پاکستان میں ___________ کو نافذ ہوئے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation It was during the interim government of Ghulam Mustafa Jatoi (r. 6 August to 6 November 1990) that the Ordinance pertaining to the law of qisas and diyat was issued. The said ordinance was re-promulgated over 20 times as the constitutional life of an ordinance is four months. Finally, in 1997 during the government of Mian Nawaz Sharif , it became an Act of the Parliament, which covered all offenses against human body and provided for Qisas and Diyat.

mcqs.question_en: The value of Diyat is
mcqs.question_ur: دیت کی قیمت  ۔۔۔۔۔۔۔۔   ہے۔
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Diyat Meaning: “Diyat” means the compensation specified in S. 323 payable to the heirs of the victim. Method to Pay Diyat: The Diyat may be made payable: (i) in lump sum; or (ii) in installments spread over a period of three years from the date of the final judgment.

mcqs.question_en: Eid ul fitr first performed on which date?

mcqs.explanation: Explanation رسالت کے معنی ہیں پیغام پہنچانا اور رسول کے معنی ہیں پیغام پہنچانے والے۔ رسالت کا آغاز حضرت آدم سے ہوا اور آخری نبی حضرت محمد پر ختم ہوا۔

mcqs.explanation: Explanation نبی اکرم ﷺ نے فرمایا میں آخری نبی ہوں اور تم آخری امت ہو۔ ***********

T he word Zakat occurs 32 times in the Holy Quran. Hazrat Abu Baker did Jihad on the issue of Zakat . Without which act the prayer is useless? Zakat One who disbelievers in Zakat is a Kafir “Zakat” is the treasure of Islam, who said this? Holy Prophet (PBUH) **** 612.36 grams of silver is the Ratio of Zakat in grams of Silver

mcqs.explanation: Explanation بھلائی کے معنی ہیں نیکی، اچھا سلوک یا برتاو

mcqs.question_en: شب قدر کتنے مہینوں سے افضل ہے ؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation قرآن مجید میں شب قدر کی عبادت کو ہزار مہینوں سے بہتر قرار دیا گیا ہے۔ اس حساب سے اس رات کی عبادت 83 سال اور 4 مہینے بنتی ہے۔

mcqs.question_en: What Caliphate followed the Umayyad Caliphate?
mcqs.question_ur: اموی خلافت کے بعد کون سی خلافت آئی؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The Abbasids overthrew the Umayyad dynasty in 750 CE, supporting the mawali, or non-Arab Muslims, by moving the capital to Baghdad in 762 CE. ________ Ameer Muawiyah was the founder and first caliph of the Umayyad Caliphate, serving from 661 until his death. (30 years)

mcqs.question_en: The idol Manaat was fixed between Makkah and Madina. who worshipped it?
mcqs.question_ur: بت منات مکہ اور مدینہ کے درمیان قائم تھی۔ کس نے اس کی عبادت کی؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Aws and Khazraj were two Arab tribes of Medina during the time of the Prophet Muhammad . Later the conflict between these two tribes, Banu Aws and Banu Khazraj, died out and they jointly became known as "ansar" or helper.

mcqs.question_en: Hazrat Asma (RA), the daughter of Hazrat Abu Bakr (RA), got married to _________?
mcqs.question_ur: حضرت ابوبکر رضی اللہ عنہ کی صاحبزادی حضرت اسماء رضی اللہ عنہا کا نکاح _________ سے ہوا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Az-Zubayr ibn Al-Awam was a cousin and companion of the Islamic prophet Muhammad and one of the first converts to Islam. He was also one of the ten companions whom Muhammad promised paradise. He became one of the political and military leaders of the community following the death of Muhammad.

mcqs.question_en: Where does Jannah (Heaven) lies?
mcqs.question_ur: جنت (جنت) کہاں ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Prophet Muhammad rightly said, "Heaven is under the feet of your mothers ," as mothers play a pivotal role in preparing their children to live a healthy and prosperous life that contributes to the beauty of earth and society.

mcqs.question_en: Died on the tenth of Ramadan 10th Nabvi?
mcqs.question_ur: کی وفات دسویں رمضان 10 نبوی کو ہوئی؟____
mcqs.explanation: Explanation "Hazrat Khadija's" important Questions and information Hazrat Khadija (RA) was the ________ wife of Hazrat Muhammad ﷺ. Banu Asad * *** Hazrat Khadija's servant, Maysra , who accompanied the Holy Prophet on his journey was full of praise for him. Meysara , Lady Khadijah's (s.a) special servant . NS16-3-2023

mcqs.question_en: SIn salat, saying Darood is____?
mcqs.question_ur: نماز میں درود پڑھنا____ ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Saying Darood in Salat is considered Sunnah Because It was regularly practiced by the Prophet Muhammad (PBUH). Salat became Farz on the 10th nabvi.

mcqs.question_en: Who was chosen by Hazrat Umar (R.A) to lead the Muslim Army in the battle of Qadsiya?
mcqs.question_ur: حضرت عمر رضی اللہ عنہ نے جنگ قادسیہ میں مسلم فوج کی قیادت کے لیے کس کو چنا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Sad ibn Abi Waqqas, also known as Saʿd ibn Malik , was one of the companions of the Islamic prophet. Saʿd was reportedly the seventh person to embrace Islam , which he did at the age of seventeen.

mcqs.question_en: The Holy Prophet (PBUH) gave the title of_________ to Abu Zar Ghaffari R.A ?
mcqs.question_ur: حضور صلی اللہ علیہ وسلم نے ابوذر غفاری رضی اللہ عنہ کو _________ کا لقب دیا تھا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Abu Dharr Al-Ghifari Al-Kinani  was the fourth or fifth person converting to Islam, and from the Muhajirun .

mcqs.question_en: The “Ridda Wars” were fought by which caliph?
mcqs.question_ur: ردا کی جنگیں کس خلیفہ نے لڑی تھیں؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The Ridda Wars  or Apostasy Wars, were a series of military campaigns launched by the Caliph Abu Bakr against rebel Arabian tribes during 632 and 633, just after the death of the Islamic Prophet Muhammad.

mcqs.question_en: The Battle of Camel was fought between Hazrat Ali (رضہ) and ______?
mcqs.question_ur: اونٹ کی جنگ حضرت علی رضی اللہ عنہ اور ____ کے درمیان لڑی گئی؟
options: Hazrat Sa’d bin Abi Wakas RA
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The battle was fought between the army of the fourth caliph Ali, on one side, and the rebel army led by Aisha, Talha, and Zubayr, on the other side. The Battle of the Camel, also known as the Battle of Jamel or the B attle of Basra , took place at Basra , Iraq on 7 November 656 . Strength ~10,000 ~10,000 Casualties and losses >400-500 >2,500

mcqs.question_en: How many years Aisha(RA) remained alive after the death of Muhammad ﷺ?
mcqs.question_ur: محمد صلی اللہ علیہ وسلم کی وفات کے بعد عائشہ رضی اللہ عنہا کتنے سال زندہ رہیں؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Hazrat Aisha (RA) lived 45 years after the death of Prophet Muhammad (SAW) She was 18 years old when Hazrat Muhammad (SAW) died Aisha died at her home in Medina on 17 Ramadan 58 AH (16 July 678). She was 67 years old. Abu Hurairah led her funeral prayer after the tahajjud (night) prayer Aisha was buried at Jannat al-Baqi. Additional Information Hazrat Ayesha was the 3rd wife and most learned of Hazrat Muhammad ﷺ. Hazrat Ayesha is also known for narrating 2,210 hadiths Muhammad married Hazrat Ayesha when he was 53 years old and she was only six years old. He had intercourse with Hazrat Ayesha when she was nine years old. Hazrat Ayesha was the daughter of Hazrat Abu Baker She gives the title of Siddiqa, meaning 'the truthful woman, daughter of the truthful man

mcqs.question_en: The Holy Prophet (PBUH) gave the title of_________ to Hazrat Usama bin Zaid R.A ?
mcqs.question_ur: حضور اکرم صلی اللہ علیہ وسلم نے حضرت اسامہ بن زید رضی اللہ عنہ کو _________ کا لقب دیا تھا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Usama ibn Zayd  companion of the Islamic prophet Muhammad. He was the son of Zayd ibn Harithah, Muhammad's freed slave and adopted son, and Umm Ayman . Died: . 680 Medina, Arabia

mcqs.question_en: The Holy Prophet (PBUH) gave the title of_________ to Hazrat Owais Qarni R.A ?
mcqs.question_ur: حضور اکرم صلی اللہ علیہ وسلم نے حضرت اویس قرنی رضی اللہ عنہ کو _________ کا لقب دیا تھا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Awais Karni was born in Asir region of Saudi Arabia in 594CE . He was 28 years of age when Holy Prophet (ﷺ) had migrated to Madinah۔

mcqs.question_en: The Holy Prophet (PBUH) gave the title of_________ to Hazrat Amr bin al-Aas R.A ?
mcqs.question_ur: حضور نبی اکرم صلی اللہ علیہ وآلہ وسلم نے حضرت عمرو بن العاص رضی اللہ عنہ کو _________ کا لقب دیا تھا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Amr ibn al-As al-Sahmi was the Arab commander who led the Muslim conquest of Egypt and served as its governor in 640–646 and 658–664.

mcqs.question_en: The third daughter of our Holy prophet ﷺ was ___________.
mcqs.question_ur: ہمارے نبی پاک صلی اللہ علیہ وسلم کی تیسری صاحبزادی ___________ تھیں۔
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Hazrat Umm-e-Kalthum was 3rd daughter and 4th child of the Holy Prophet ﷺ and Hazrat Khadijah After the death of her sister Ruqayya left Uthman a widower, he married Umm Kulthum Umm Kulthum died in 630 (8 AH) at age of 27 She was buried in Jannat al Mualla in Makkah. Additional Information: Prophet Muhammad ﷺ had three sons and four daughters . 1. Hazrat Qasim 2. Hazrat Zainab (RA) 3. Hazrat Ruqayyah (RA) 4. Hazrat Umm Kulthum (RA) 5. Hazrat Fatima (RA) 6. Hazrat Abdullah 7. Hazrat Ibrahim All of his children were born to Hazrat Khadijah (RA) except one son Ibrahim , who was born to Hazrat Maria al-Qibtiyah (RA).

mcqs.question_en: In the Period Hazrat Umar most battle Muslim fought against?
mcqs.question_ur: حضرت عمرؓ کے دور میں سب سے زیادہ جنگیں مسلمانوں نے  کس  کے خلاف لڑی؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation 1. Conquest of (Roman Empire) Levant (634–638) I. Muslim conquest of Syria II. Muslim conquest of Armenia 2. Conquest of (Roman Empire)  Egypt (640–642) 3. Conquest of mainland Persia (642-644)

mcqs.explanation: Explanation

mcqs.question_en: What is the meaning of Tahdis
mcqs.question_ur: تہدیس کا کیا مطلب ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Hadith is an Arabic word , which literally means statement, talk, story, conversation or communication.

mcqs.question_en: What is the Duration of Madni Period?
mcqs.question_ur: مدنی دور کی مدت کتنی ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Duration of Madni Period is 9 Years, 9 Months, 9 days. Characteristics of Medinan surahs: 1. Details of Islamic jurisprudence and legal system (Laws) 2. Long verses 3. Easy vocabulary

mcqs.question_en: Makkhi Surahs were revealed in how many years?
mcqs.question_ur: مکی سورتیں کتنے سالوں میں نازل ہوئیں؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Makkhi Surahs were revealed in 13 Years Madni Surahs were revealed in 10 Years

mcqs.question_en: What an authentic Hadis is called___________?
mcqs.question_ur: صحیح حدیث کسے کہتے ہیں؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation In its classic form a hadith has two parts: the chain of narrators who have transmitted the report (the isnad) , and the main text of the report ( the matn ).

mcqs.question_en: Who solicited Hazrat Usman (رضہ) to send the copies of Quran to different countries?
mcqs.question_ur: حضرت عثمان رضی اللہ عنہ سے قرآن کے نسخے مختلف ممالک میں بھیجنے کی درخواست کس نے کی؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Solicited درخواست کی Hazrat Umar proposed the compilation of Holy Quran. Hazart Zaid bin sabit ( R.A) firstly arranged and wrote the Quran on paper in book form.

mcqs.question_en: The part of prayer the Holy Prophet did is called
mcqs.question_ur: نماز کا وہ حصہ جو حضور صلی اللہ علیہ وسلم نے  پرھایا اسے  کیا کہتے ہیں۔
mcqs.explanation: Explanation There are three type s of Sunnah. The first is the sayings of the prophet – Sunnah Qawliyyah/Hadith. The second is Sunnah Al Filiyya. Third Sunnah Taqririyyah

mcqs.question_en: Who was sent by the Holy Prophet (PBUH) as his envoy to Quraish of Makkah on the eve of Sulah-e- Hudaibiya?
mcqs.question_ur: صلاۃ حدیبیہ کے موقع پر حضور صلی اللہ علیہ وسلم نے قریش مکہ کے لیے اپنا ایلچی بنا کر کس کو بھیجا تھا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Mentioned in Surah Fatah It was a pivotal treaty between Muhammad PBUH, representing the state of Medina, and the Qurayshi tribe of Mecca in January 628 (6 AH). It helped to decrease tension between Makkah and Madina, authorized Muhammad's followers to return the following year in a peaceful pilgrimage, later known as The First Pilgrimage.

mcqs.question_en: The chain of Narrators to Prophet Mohammad(صلى الله عليه وسلم ) in Hadith is called_____
mcqs.question_ur: حدیث میں رسول اللہ صلی اللہ علیہ وسلم کے راویوں کا سلسلہ _____ کہلاتا ہے۔
mcqs.explanation: Explanation A hadith has two independent portions . The first is called its chain  of the narrators via whom the text has reached the muhaddith who has collected it and recorded in his book called a collection of Ahadith. The second portion is called the text

mcqs.question_en: The explanation of Salat is in the_______
mcqs.question_ur: نماز کی وضاحت ______ میں ہے
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Salat, the daily ritual prayer enjoined upon all Muslims as one of the five Pillars of Islam. Ṣalāh  is an Arabic word that means to pray or bless.

mcqs.question_en: Who proposed Azan for the first time?
mcqs.question_ur: پہلی بار اذان کس نے دی؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Hazrat 'Umar was the first person to suggest the calling of the Azan . Later, through a revelation, Allah gave permission to the Prophet (PBUH) to call out the Azan.

mcqs.question_en: Name of the first Caliph of Islam who introduced the Jail Department?
mcqs.question_ur: اسلام کے پہلے خلیفہ کا نام کیا تھا جس نے جیل کا محکمہ متعارف کرایا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Hazrat Umar (R.A) was the first Caliph of Islam who introduced the Jail Department حضرت عمر رضی اللہ عنہ اسلام کے پہلے خلیفہ تھے جنہوں نے محکمہ جیل کو متعارف کرایا

mcqs.question_en: The Wahi was sent in the month of __?.
mcqs.question_ur: وحی __ کے مہینے میں بھیجی گئی تھی۔
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Prophet Muhammad first received revelations in 609 CE in a cave on Mount Hira

mcqs.question_en: What does the breath of fasting person smell like according to Hadith?
mcqs.question_ur: حدیث کے مطابق روزہ دار کی سانس کی بو کیسی ہوتی ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The smell that issues from the mouth of the fasting person is more pleasant to Allah than the smell of musk .

mcqs.question_en: The kind of Hadith which doesn't reach to Twatur is called___
mcqs.question_ur: جس قسم کی حدیث تواتر تک نہ پہنچتی ہو اسے کیا کہتے ہیں۔
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Al-Khabar al-Wāḥid  a narration of hadiths which is not regarded al-mutawatir hadith which means the number of narrators in all generations of transmission is not enough to ascertain the authenticity of Khabar.

mcqs.question_en: _____,was the brother of Hazrat Ali (R.A) who was taken as prisoner in the battle of Badr?
mcqs.question_ur: کون حضرت علی رضی اللہ عنہ کے بھائی تھے جو جنگ بدر میں قید ہوئے تھے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Aqeel ibn Abi Talib was a companion and first cousin of the Islamic prophet Muhammad. He was known by the kunya Abu Yazid . He is also said to be the common ancestor of the Somali clans such as the Darod clan.

mcqs.question_en: Book named “The Voice of Human Justice ” is the biography of______?
mcqs.question_ur: \"انسانی انصاف کی آواز\" نامی کتاب ______ کی سوانح حیات ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The Voice of Human Justice is an English translation of Sautu'l 'Adālati'l Insaniyah, a book written in Arabic by George Jordac , a Christian author from Lebanon. The book is a biography of Ali ibn Abi Talib. The contents of the book were drawn from the Nahj al-Balagha of Ali. The book depicts the personality of Ali.

mcqs.question_en: “Nahjul Balagha” is authored by
mcqs.question_ur: \"نہج البلاغہ\"   ۔۔۔۔۔۔۔   کی تصنیف ہے۔
mcqs.explanation: Explanation He was the fourth caliph of Islam. He accepted Islam at the age of 10.

mcqs.question_en: Hazrat Abu Bakr sent which companion to Syria?
mcqs.question_ur: حضرت ابوبکر نے کس صحابی کو شام بھیجا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Hazrat Abu Bakar was first khalifa of Islam

mcqs.question_en: Al-Ateeq (The Delivered One) is the title of:
mcqs.question_ur: العتیق.........کا عنوان ہے
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Al- Ateeq (The Delivered One) The Holy prophet (PBUH) said to Abu Bakr , “You are the delivered one ( Ateeq ) of Allah from the Fire” so, he was named “ Ateeq ”, and in the narration of Aai’shah who said: Abu Bakr entered upon the Messenger of Allaah ( ﷺ) who said to him, “Glad tidings for you are the Ateeq of Allah from the Fire.” [Al- Tirmidhi , Silsilah al- Sahihah , Saheeh .]

mcqs.question_en: Hazrat Saad Bin Abi Waqqas was made the governor of Kufa during the Khilafat of?
mcqs.question_ur: حضرت سعد بن ابی وقاص کو کس کی خلافت کے دورمیں کوفہ کا گورنر بنایا گیا تھا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation · Sa` ad Ibn Abi Waqqas, was the one who built the city of Kufa in Iraq during the rule of Umar ibn al-Khattab. · Saʿd also fought under ʿUmar's command against the Sassanid army at the Battle of al- Qādisiyyah and Battle of Nahāvand . · He was later appointed governor of Kufa and Nejd during the caliphate of ʿUmar.

mcqs.question_en: The police force was first set up to maintain law and order in the Islamic States during the Caliphate of :
mcqs.question_ur: پولیس فورس سب سے پہلے اسلامی ریاستوں میں امن و امان برقرار رکھنے کے لیے  کس نے قائم کی  تھی
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Hazrat Umar (R.A) established Islamic calendar Hazrat Umar (R.A) established the department of finance Hazrat Umar (R.A) established the Town plaining department Hazrat Umar (R.A) established the Police Department Hazrat Umar Farooq formed a parliament namely Majlis e Aam Hazrat Umar Farooq destroyed idol “Sawa” Hazrat Umar (R.A) born in 581 A.D Hazrat Umar Farooq was martyred on 1st Muharram 24 A.H. Hazrat Umar (R.A) killer name: Abu LoLoo Feroze Hazrat Umar (R.A) remained Caliph for 10 years Hazrat Umar (R.A) embraced Islam in 6th Nabvi

mcqs.question_en: The Battle of Camel was fought at _______?
mcqs.question_ur: اونٹ کی جنگ _______ میں لڑی گئی تھی؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation The Battle of the Camel, also known as the Battle of Jamel or the Battle of Basra , took place at Basra , Iraq on 7 November 656 . It was first war during Imam Ali's (a) caliphate , took place between Nakithun (Oath-breakers)

mcqs.question_en: Where tomb of Bibi Pak Daman is located?
mcqs.question_ur: بی بی پاک دامن کی قبر کہاں ہے؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Bibi Pak Daman is the mausoleum of Ruqayyah bint Ali located in Lahore, Punjab, Pakistan.

mcqs.question_en: Qaim-ul-Lail and Saim-ul-Nahar are the titles of _____?
mcqs.question_ur: قائم اللیل اور صائم النہر _____ کے القابات ہیں؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Ali ibn Abi Talib was the fourth caliph from 656 until his assassination in 661 . Ali ibn Abi Talib Born: March 17, 599 AD, Kaaba, Mecca, Saudi Arabia Ali ibn Abi Talib Place of burial: Imam Ali Holy Shrine, Najaf, Iraq

mcqs.question_en: The most exemplary administration out of the rightly guided caliphs was that of_____?
mcqs.question_ur: صحیح رہنمائی کرنے والے خلفاء میں سے سب سے زیادہ مثالی انتظامیہ _____ کی تھی؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation He was an expert Muslim jurist known for his pious and just nature, which earned him the epithet Al-Farooq Hazrat Umar Reign: 23 August 634 CE – 3 November 644 CE Hazrat Umar Tribe: Quraysh ( ‎ Banu Adi ‎ ) ‎ Hazrat Umar Father: Khattab ibn Nufayl Hazrat Umar Died: November 644 (aged 59–60)

mcqs.question_en: ______ is the best drink mentioned in Holy Qur’an.
mcqs.question_ur: قرآن پاک میں ______ بہترین مشروب ہے۔
mcqs.explanation: Explanation It is a verse from the Quran, specifically Surah An-Nahl (The Bee), verse 66 (16:66). We give you drink from what is in their bellies – between excretion and blood – pure milk, palatable to drinkers.

mcqs.question_en: Bait e Rizwan, also known as Bait e Shajrah, took place in 6th AH under the _________ tree?

mcqs.question_en: How many types of Tawaf are there____________?

mcqs.explanation: Explanation There are seven types of Tawaf; 1. Tawaf-ul-Qudoom: It is performed when a person arrived at Makkah whether for Hajj, Umrah, Business or a visit. 2. Tawaf-ul-Ziarah: It is also called Tawaf-ul-Rukn or Tawaf-ul-Hajj. It is performed by all pilgrims who are undertaking the Hajj. This Tawaf is mandatory 3. Tawaf-ul-Wada (Tawaf-e-Sadr): It is a farewell Tawaf and performed as a final ritual of Hajj when a pilgrim leaving Makkah. 4. Tawaf-ul-Nafl: Tawaf-ul-Nafl is an optional tawaf but it is better than performing a nafl salaat. It can be performed at any time and as desired. 5. Tawaf-ul-Umrah: Tawaf-ul-Umrah is a part of Umrah and performed as a ritual of Umrah. It is obligatory for the one who performs Umrah. 6. Tawaf-ul-Nazr: If a person pledged that he will perform Tawaf if his desire is fulfilled by Allah. Then, he must have to perform this Tawaf if Allah fulfills that desire. 7. Tawaf-ul-Tahiyaah: After Tawaf, the person has to offer two units behind Maqam-e-Ibrahim (if possible, otherwise they may offer that two units prayer anywhere in the mosque).

It was established by Muʿāwiyah ibn Abī Sufyān, a native of Mecca and a contemporary of the Prophet Muḥammad.

mcqs.question_en: Khalid ibn al-Walid (R.A) embraced Islam in which Hijri?
mcqs.question_ur: خالد بن ولید رضی اللہ عنہ نے کس ہجری میں اسلام قبول کیا؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation Khalid ibn al-Walid was a well-known Arab Muslim commander in the service of the Islamic prophet Muhammad (PBUH) and the caliphs Abu Bakr (R.A) and Umar (R.A). Historians have reported different narrations on the date that Khalid b. Walid converted to Islam. In the year 6 AH or 8 AH Khalid embraced Islam in Muhammad’s presence alongside the Qurayshite Amr ibn al-As. However, according to a famous report, Khalid converted to Islam in the first of Safar 8 AH (c. 629)before the Conquest of Mecca.

mcqs.explanation: Explanation Jibreel (A.S) who acts as intermediary between God and humans and as bearer of revelation to the prophets, most notably to Muhammad.

mcqs.explanation: Explanation The Battle of al-Qadisiyyah, fought in 636 , was a decisive battle between the Arab Muslim army and the army of the Sasanian Empire of Persia during the first period of Muslim conquests.

mcqs.question_ur: جنت میں پہلا کھانا کیا ہوگا؟

mcqs.question_en: Takbeer-e-Tashreeq is recited in______?

Starting immediately after Fajr Salah on the 9th of Dhul Hijjah , it is Wajib for Hajj pilgrims to audibly recite Takbir al-Tashreeq at least once after every Fardh Salah, up to and including Asr Salah on the 13th of Dhul Hijjah (a total of 23 Fardh Salahs). اللَّهُ أَكْبَرُ اللَّهُ أَكْبَرُ لَا إلَهَ إلَّا اللَّهُ وَاَللَّهُ أَكْبَرُ اللَّهُ أَكْبَرُ وَلِلَّهِ الْحَمْد

mcqs.explanation: Explanation Abū Isḥāq Muḥammad ibn Hārūn al-Rashīd, better known by his regnal name al-Muʿtaṣim biʾllāh , was the eighth Abbasid caliph , ruling from 833 until his death in 842.

mcqs.question_en: How many times Bismillahir Rahmaanir Raheem is repeated in the Holy Quran?

mcqs.explanation: Explanation Bismillahir Rahmaanir Raheem is repeated in the Holy Quran  114 Times Every surah in the Quran opens with the statement as the Bismillah, except Surah 9 (Surah Tuba). Surah Naml, which is the 27th Chapter, has the entire bismillahir rahmanir raheem in the 30th verse. This is why S urah Naml i s known as the Surah with two bismillahs.

mcqs.question_en: Who are exempt from Ramadan’s fasting?
mcqs.question_ur: رمضان کے روزوں سے کون مستثنیٰ ہیں؟
mcqs.explanation: Explanation As one of the five pillars, or duties, of Islam, fasting during the month of Ramadan is mandatory for all healthy adult Muslims . Children who have not reached puberty, the elderly, those who are physically or mentally incapable of fasting, pregnant women, breastfeeding mothers and travelers are exempt .

mcqs.question_en: Which is the oldest and the first Islamic cemetery in the World?

mcqs.explanation: Explanation Jannat al-Baqīʿ is the oldest and the first Islamic cemetery of Medina in the Hejazi region of present-day Saudi Arabia. It is located to the southeast of the Prophet's Mosque , which contains the graves of some of Prophet Muhammad's family and friends. It is also known as Baqīʿ al-Gharqad.
